Michael & Patsy - local restaurant enthusiasts

Went here with a party of 10 and it was pretty great.  Same quality food as on the strip but you don't have to pay for your sides a la carte which makes a huge price difference.  Staff was attentive but needed some reminders. I had the new your strip w/mashed potatoes and seasonal veg (carrots and what the server said was a Mexican squash), no complaints what so ever.  My husband had the special surf and turf (22 oz porterhouse w/ a lobster tail and the same sides as me). He thought his was amazing.  Definitely recommend.
Incredible food, incredible service, everything was delicious!!!! Downtown LV best kept secret!!!!

Great atmosphere. Unique menu! CJ was our waiter and he was fantastic. Extremely knowledgable about the entrees and has good suggestions for our dining group. Triple George is truly another business that is aiding in the revival of downtown! Kudos to the entire staff, the Mahi Mahi was OUT OF THIS WORLD!

Today I tried the Chicken Pot Pie,  Big YUCK.  No flaky crust just a big hard flat top. The pot pie itself didn't have much flavor. I wanted a serving fit for 1 person. I asked the waitress about the size of the dish before ordering and she said it serves 1. Well it would have fed 3 people. I've had other dishes there that are very good. If you order fish and chips you can share that too.

Wow!!! I had friends in town and was looking for something different from the normal Fremont Street, very expensive and sub standard fare. Thus the Triple George. We were immediately impressed with the classic retro look tile on the floor and the beautiful dark wood walls, bar and little snuggeries  (small private dining rooms for 6 plus people). The greeting staff made us feel welcome and comfortable immediately.

We were seated and greated by our waiter who was friendly and attentive. We ordered drinks and began to go through the menu . I was impressed with the diversity of its content. Anything you could want from steak, pork. Chicken and sea food. A wonderful selection of old time comfort foods, braised ribs,  chicken pot pie, meatloaf wrapped in bacon, fried chicken. On the table was a fresh baked loaf of sour dough bread and fresh butter.

Drinks came and we're perfectly mixed and served. We ordered our meals and had time to visit. Surprisingly our meals were delivered all at one time and done to perfection I might add.  Our order included fried chicken, chicken saltimbocca, and a George burger which is 3/4 pound of burger bliss.

Everything here is first class. From top to bottom one of the best places to dine in Las Vegas.

Service was great, food was great, very clean, very welcoming, and not to bad price wise (for good food) and i will be back. If you pay the 6 bucks at the mob museum to park, its a block down 3rd street, and afterwards if you want to walk off the food Fremont is right there. Try it..

Saturday night was my third experience dining at Triple George, and it reinforced my belief that it's the best restaurant in downtown Las Vegas.  The decor and atmosphere remind me of classic steak houses in Chicago or New York-- lots of small rooms, dark wood, long bars, stained glass.  Our waitress was pleasant and enhusiastic, knowing the menu well and making us feel comfortable.  I had a chopped salad (lettuce, tomato, red onion, bacon bits, blue cheese crumbles with a vinaigrette), a filet (perfectly medium rare and very tasty), rice pilaf, glazed carrots and crunchy green beans, Key lime pie for dessert, and a nice J. Lohr Syrah bottle of wine.  Prices less than the steakhouses on the Strip, and the quality is every bit as good.  Would highly recommend

The ribeye and filet mignon were well seasoned and to our desired temperature of medium rare. The mashed potatoes were buttery, silky and seasoned perfectly. The meal was way more affordable than the strip restaurants while still being satisfied.

My best friend and I came in the other night and were some of the only people in the place. We sat at the bar and ordered cocktails while we chatted. I was telling a story and animating a character in it, a person we both know, with an exaggerated funny voice when the bartender walked by. We could tell she heard my story and thought the funny voice was my real voice, and that she thought it was annoying. She went over to the host stand and began talking to the host, who was looking over at us in a way that made it clear our bartender was talking about us. The bartender mimed putting a gun in her mouth to emphasize how annoying we were and they rolled their eyes and laughed. First and foremost I'm concerned about her sense of humor if she wasn't able to tell that my voice was a joke, because it was very obvious. Second, even if I was serious, maybe don't make fun of your customers in a place where we can see you do it! Felt pretty rude and unwelcoming! Would definitely go somewhere else next time.

We ate there with a party of six.  Three of us order the porcini ribeye.  Easily the best ribeye I've had in a long time.  The place is close to Fremont Street so getting a cab in and out was super easy.  I would definitely highly  recommend this place!

Excellent service and food. I met my brother and his wife for a one year wedding anniversary. He had a large reception last year here. 

Good service. The server was great and very attentive. Engaged and personal. 

Good management. The manager came to the table to discuss our great wine choice. My brother is very knowledgeable. He thanked my brother for returning to the restaurant two years in a row on his anniversary and was very gracious beyond compare with any other establishment I have ever visited. Also provided not one but four of his best deserts.  He also shared a great reason to return next year!

Food. Bone in fillet was awesome. Look forward to next year.
The Triple is a must for downtown visits.  The menu and staff are top notch and you'll come away very satisfied!  Highly recommend.

Went there with a party of 6, service was slow. Took over 2 hours, for us to order, eat and get our check. Food tasted good, but small portions. We ordered the Canadian oysters and shrimp George both portions were small
Waiter and manager were not helpful when we addressed the slow service!
Would not go there again

I love how Triple George Grill takes you back in time with its dark wood paneling and cubicle style seating. It makes you feel like you are at a 'oldtime' steakhouse back when the mob ran the strip. But it wasn't only the looks that made an impact on me, it was the delicious food. 

We read about how wonderful the butter and bread that was served before your meal and the reviewers were not lying, it was DELICIOUS! The butter was so addicting which almost made it difficult for me to finish my actual meal. I ordered the power lunch special and it was pretty filling and a good deal. I was a little surprised that they did not serve the 'soup' portion of the lunch prior to my meal but once it came out, it all made sense. I thought it was clever that they gave me a huge plate that housed my soup, half sandwich, truffle fries and my dessert - cheesecake. The meal also included a non-alcoholic drink. All of this for just $15.99. Not bad at all. I went ahead and shared my dessert even though it was so yummy.  

If you want to get away from the newer strip and enjoy some delicious food for good prices, make sure you go downtown to Triple George Grill!

We love this restaurant, we come here whenever we are downtown.  My wife loves Chicken Alfredo, however it is not on the menu, not to worry the waitress asked the chef if he could prepare a dish of her favorite.  They did and it was delicious.  
My ribeye was perfect and the and once again did not disappoint.  Not to mention the sides and sourdough bread with butter and vinaigrette, need I say more.
The wine list is great and there is a full bar if you like your libations a little harder.
Great restaurant!!

what happened???!!!  the french onion soup. overcooked to mush. So wrong--- 
the steak, not cooked anywhere near our requested doneness. Veggies- wrong!
The service--- what service??!
this was our favorite place downtown.  too bad.  we are actually sad.

This place needs to bring back the country fried steak, it was the best in town and it's a tragedy (yup tragedy) that I can't eat it anymore. You'll notice I gave this place a 3 star rating, based on the fact that everything else is just alright. Maybe it's excellent and the country fried steak is next level (what they're eating in heaven) awesome but I'll never know; because after they took the CFS off the menu I had one mediocre meal here, went home to cry, (periodically checked the online menu for months in hopes they would add it again) but never returned.
 Get it together Triple George. Listen to reason. Bring back that Country Fried Steak.

I have visited the Triple George several times over the years and I have consistently impressed with quality of the food, drinks and service. 

This is a classic style restaurant experience a few yards from the hub bub of the Fremont Street Experience. The operators have found the formula for lasting success. I always make it a point to visit the Triple George whenever I travel to Vegas. On this visit, Andrew provided exceptional service!
Very nice!  Clean!  Educated staff with wine.  Food prepared well.  A little to al dente on the veggies.  Nice atmosphere.  Fun old fashioned feel.

Hopes were high when we sat down for lunch.  But after an hour and no food, things went down hill quickly.  Since when does it take an hour for a burger?  And to make matters even more confusing about the delay, the dining room was practically empty!  Our server Rebecca was nice, but missed the mark on service.  She not only messed our order up, but also attempted to charge us for an extra round of drinks; whether this was on purpose is up for debate.  To be fair, the food was tasty but the poor service overshadowed the entire experience.  I would definitely think twice before returning.

I've been here several times for happy hour and salads. Service is usually good but sometimes it can be a little slow. The happy hour menu has a few good selections for a great price. Stay away from the calamari on it. I've ordered it twice & both times way overcooked. Terrible. The salads have been consistently good but I really have no desire to try a full lunch or dinner. I'm just not that impressed.

First of all, our server Justin was great. Very attentive and professional. 5/5.
I got the steak sandwich- the flavor was good but not great, however, a large portion (25%) of the steak inside the bun was inedible gristle and fat which should have been trimmed off before cooking. 2/5 for the steak sandwich.
My companions both got steaks- they said they were tasty but not outstanding. 4/5
We got 2 appetizers- Ahi and Pretzel bites.  The Ahi was superb (5/5)- probably the best part of the meal.  The pretzel bites were a 4/5- liked the sauces that came with them. Took them with me in a takeout box- reheated them later that day however, they were not very appealing when reheated.
The salads were not very good- we attributed that mostly to the dressing.  We ate some of the salads because we needed green vegetables, but had our consciences not been screaming at us to "eat your vegetables!"  I doubt we would have eaten more than a bite or two. 2/5 for the salads.
Nice atmosphere to the place though.
Thanks for the opportunity to comment.

No Happy Hour at 5:45 pm on a Wednesday?! $h*ts cray.

Something about "World Market's in town, we don't do happy hour when that happens." Seems sleazy to me.

I left.

There are plenty of steakhouses in Vegas, but what sets them apart are the food, prices, location, and service. Although the Triple George Grill does fine with the first three categories, it really shines in the fourth.

My husband made a reservation for our anniversary. I asked to be surprised, and I was. Triple George never crossed my mind. It's located pretty close to Fremont Street, so there were a few goofballs out on the sidewalk. But inside was a different story. This was a classy joint. And the tall wooden booths offered a sense a privacy, even though the restaurant itself was pretty loud. (It reminded me a bit of the Palm at the Forum Shops, without all the caricatures hanging on the walls.)

The food was fine; nothing exceptional but tasty nonetheless. We each had one of the specials. My husband had the seared scallops with rice pilaf ($32), and I had the veal chop with mashed potatoes and grilled shrimp ($45). We split a Caprese salad as an appetizer, and even though it came with regular store-bought tomatoes rather than heirlooms (as far as I could tell), it was a nice clean start to the meal -- and a bargain at $7.95. The best bargain yet? It was half-price wine night (!), so we got a nice bottle of pinot noir for under $30. The prices were right in line with Vegas steakhouse standards, but that wine discount really lightened the load. (So go on a Monday if you're in the mood for some boozin', although our waitress said there is a two-bottle limit per table.)

The service was great throughout. Everyone from the hostess to the sommelier to our waitress was warm and friendly, and each of them also congratulated us on our anniversary in a genuine manner. We even got a complimentary ice cream sundae to mark the occasion, although neither of us put much of a dent in it.

We don't go downtown too often, so I'm not sure when (or if) we'll return to the Triple George. But if you're in the area and you're in the mood for an old-fashioned steakhouse experience, give it a try. (Just please cover your pasties and put on some pants before you enter; we want to keep it classy!)

We came here for one of our dinners while we were in Las Vegas getting married in April 2015 (we are a little behind on our reviews). 

In doing a quick search in Yelp for a steak place near our hotel (we were staying at the Freemont), Triple George Grill came up. We loved this place because it reminded us of a few steakhouses in Chicago (mostly Wildfire) but less "chain-like". The staff is very friendly and accommodating. In fact, we were sitting in an extremely loud room and could barely hear each other so we asked to be moved and the hostess and waitstaff was very cool about it (which, yes, they should be but many places might give you attitude). Our steaks were cooked perfectly. Our drinks were delicious. I had the one with the hibiscus flower in it and yeah, you eat the flower - it has the taste and texture of a fruit roll-up. Loved it!

We will definitely come back when we are in town again!

First time here and duly impressed.  Warm private booths, attentive service.  Try the peach old fashioned.  Unusual combination but perfectly complements each other., with the still summer sweet peaches of the season.  Petite filet mignon was perfect and tender.  Came with creamy mashed potatoes, roasted baby carrots & perfect broccoli. If you are in downtown you must give this a try.  Well worth it
My daughter Dawn Abbé enjoyed your lunch very much .tomato soup was excellent & the French dip was lean & tasty. Serve was good.

Food and service were excellent. We were a party of seven and sat outside on a pleasant evening. Our waitress, Brenda was super friendly. The ahí tuna was not only fabulous but surprisingly large. The drunken hangar steak was delicious. We will be back!

Triple George was a great find down town. Great ambiance, excellent food, and amazing drinks. 

Just a quick walk off of Freemont and well worth it.

Oh my goodness we got the royal treatment. Customer service was excellent! I wish I could remember waiter and staffs name. It's been couple of weeks since I was there. I got the veggie pasta, sauce was a bit rich. Parents had surf N turf and filet mignon. They were very pleased. Great dining experience,  we will be back but don't think I'll order the pasta again.

Old school Vegas at its best. The Triple George Grill is nicely hidden away from the strip and behind the old downtown area of Vegas. Mostly a locals place it was great to get to experiance the Triple george as a out of towner. The old style of the resturant brings back the days of Frank Sinatra and the rat pack days of vegas. From the large all wood bar to all the other wood work in the resturant this place brings back the good old days. The service here is top notch and a nice change from the hustle and bustle of the strip. For an appitiser we had the goat cheese. The goat cheese was cooked to prefection and the garlic toast that was served with it was very tasty. For dinner I had the Filet. The steak was cooked a bit rare for me. I ordered it Medium, but was very tastly. The portion size was also nice and large. The steak fries here were different than other I have had but were also quite good. Be prepaired to eat when you come here because the portions are large.

Love Triple George Grill! Impeccable service and you will always get a seat. A great locals spot and wjen the weather is beautiful sit outside and enjoy. The Carmel Salted Martini is a MUST TRY! I was a little concerned it would be overly sweet but, it was a perfect balance of slightly sweet with a little salt. Definetly lick a little salt off the rim before you sip to get the full expierence. The pot roast is fantastic. Definitely try the chocolate endulgence. Normally we do vanilla ice cream but we went all in and asked for Carmel drizzled Ontop and we were not disapppointed. Yummo!!

If I could give negative stars I would. I stopped in with my friend this afternoon for an early cocktail. Granted, we were not dressed to the nines but we were dressed ok for the neighborhood, a biker bar and pawn shop on the block. When we walked in, we got the up down disapproving look from the gentleman at the door. We were directed to the bar. When we sat down, we were semi greeted by a surly old bartender, far past his prime. When I inquired as to what he would recommend , he stated a shot of whiskey or a bud light. That offended me to the core as I took that to mean I was not sophisticated enough for a martini, wine or a specialty mixed drink. I then inquired about a sparkling wine, his response oh YOU want a wine list? I replied yes I would. I happen to have a sophisticated wine palate.  I was tempted to order a bottle of Dom, but could not get his attention to get served, not to mention all of the nasty fruit flies infesting the garnishes at the cocktail station. Needless to say, Me and my black American Express card will take our business to an establishment that would like to serve me in a clean environment with a smile.  I eat out often and will be passing this info to my business network as well as friends. And we are locals!

Went here with a buddy that raved about the lunch menu steak sandwich.  I had a side salad with it. 

It was pretty darn good.  Med-Rare hangar steak on a roll with lettuce and tomatoes.  

The steak had a big beefy taste (grass fed or aged maybe?) and was cooked right.  

All in all walked out about an Andy Jackson lighter, so not the greatest value.  Hence 4 stars.

The male host - the first person you see when you enter the restaurant - was rude and had no customer service skills.  Rolled his eyes when we asked not to sit in the bar.  The food was great and our server was professional.  Leaving the restaurant, again, male host was chatting with a co-worker - never said thank you for coming in - come see us again...just kept talking with female co-worker.  I'm not sure if I'll go back...
Went again Saturday night. Service top notch. Stuffed shrimp. AMAZING!! I would fly out from LB just for dinner at Triple George

Local restaurants are where it's at for me and my husband. Places like Triple George are why! We love coming down here before any show at the Smith Center and for so many reasons. The food is great; as in you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. From fried chicken to a porcini crusted steak, it's just that good. 

On our last two visits, though, we found another reason to come down. Our waiter, Andrew, was just the best. I seriously wanted him to sit at the table with us. I felt like we were in his home and he was just the most gracious host. He was professional as a job requires but warm and playful at the same time. 

When, not if, you come to Triple George make sure to ask for Andrew and eat a yummy meal!

Used to be one of our favorite places downtown. Sadly, we recently ate there for dinner and it was not like it used to be. Service and food used to be top notch. Not sure if they changed management or what, but everything was just off. Food was smaller portions and not as special. Our server was not on the ball, like it used to be. Used to never want for a refill of a drink and this time we ALL had empty glasses for a long time. We didn't even have a bus boy to ask. No one was around. It wasn't a busy night, we couldn't see a reason for the bad service. Oh well. Another one bites the dust.

Anyway the atmosphere reminds me of that place in SF where they are "rude" to you. The booths and bar looks just like it :) I can't remember the name of that place...

We sat in the dining room and its low lit and comfy. The service was excellent.

I got a glass of house merlot and it was not bad. Just wanted a few sips and it did the trick.

They serve big loaves of bread and butter before the meal and I did not try the bread but it smelled good. I asked for veg butter and they didn't think they had any. No worries I'm not a bread fan.

Hubby got the vegan ravioli which when I tried it was super good. Sauce was perfect.

I decided on the gardien "chicken" marsala. It was super duper yummy. The sauce on it was plentiful and the portions here...let me tell you they are huge. Lots of quick steamed crunchy veggies. Tons of rice (it was brown rice) and a large cutlet.

I'm really impressed and glad to have this little place Downtown! We are going back soon and I want to checkout a HH menu and see what is to offer.

Next time I think we are going to split an entree...wow!  :)

Exceptional place for a fabulous lunch and service!!  I had the power lunch and it was a ton of satisfying food!! Service was exceptional! Sit at the bar, and hope that you have Melinda serve you! She took care of us and actually carried in a great conversation with us while we sat. Live this place and will definitely be back when we are in town!!

Ordered the steak medium. Cut into the steak It was super rare. Sent it back, they returned the same cut steak and it was still super rare. All they did was fire it on high heat and the inside did not even cook. 

The waiter and manager did not even seem to care much

This place never disappoints me! They have a drink called the Yellow Jacket. I could freakin hammer these things down all night!!! Along with the fresh oysters! Dang! Went here with my wife for Valentines last year and it was really a great evening. I'm so impressed with the way this place is out together. Cool scene, great food, best drinks in town, and just an overall awesome experience. I'm a regular customer and will continue to be for some time to come! Thanks guys!

Three star food in a five star setting. Sit at the bar during lunch and you will feel like Sam Spade taking a break on a case. This place embraces nostalgia like nobody's business. This is the perfect setting for a long lunch while reading a Hemingway or Fitzgerald short story. The food is solid as well: no-frills American fare, but built with quality ingredients. (Actually, when I think about, that aptly describes the environment as well.) The Ten Under $10 lunch menu is full of pleasing dishes. The prices are about what you can expect for above average food.

What great calamari! Perfect breading and great sauces for accompanying...Killer atmosphere. Love the old school vibe.

The service though...oof. Waited to be greeted. Waited for my drink. Waited for my check. It seemed to be a 3 person system but no one took charge really, no one seemed to be paying attention. I'll try again but I hope they try next time.

Great steaks at a reasonable price. Service was beyond great and our waiter was extremely helpful with choices. This place is old school and I like it. Lots of wood and private booths. It's what a great old steak house should be.  Don't miss the baked onion soup and if you are looking for a great steak at reasonable prices this is your spot.

Im not sure whats tackier; charging $2 for two small bleu cheese olives or not mentioning that there would be an additional $2 charge for two small bleu cheese olives requested with a specialty martini. Great way to guarantee two locals seated at the bar on a $60 dinner and drink bill won't be back. Disappointing.
Service was exceptional, the rib eye was top tier. It's bright, busy and loud, but it's Vegas.

This was the third time we came with three other couples for the Valentine's Day special menu. The first time it was great, last year was good, this year it was just terrible. Everything from appetizer to chocolate souffle was COLD! The first appetizer, a red pepper bisque, was a cream based soup, and it really needed to be warm at least, but it was very cold. The second appetizer, a beef Wellington, was also cold and soggy, also, we had to really look for the beef! There were little bits of beef hidden among the pieces of mushroom. Totally tasteless, but we were hungry. Next, we shared a COLD Tomahawk steak, so cold that the fat (which we trimmed, but still got a lot of) stuck to the roof of our mouths even after dessert. The side dishes were also to be shared, a spoonful of mashed potatoes and THREE asparagus spears for TWO people! Then the COLD chocolate souffle with vanilla ice cream on top (it didn't melt even a little). The service was slow (which probably explains the temperature of everything), and our waitress kept asking how our food was, and from the very first course we complained about the temperature, but nothing changed. It was as she was just asking to make conversation, but really didn't care. We'll absolutely never return and will ALWAYS advise our friends and acquaintances to avoid it!

First impressions count. When you walk in the room looks elegant. The hostess who seated us looked classy.

The food was average at best but I'd probably give them another shot if I was downtown again.

This is an excellent steak and seafood restaurant that is a great alternative to the congested LV Fremont St area.  I had fresh oysters on the half shell (two orders, one of the orders was free using a foursquare checking).  My friends had a NY strip cooked med rare to perfection while the other ordered their veggie entree which had a mélange of vegetables braised with balsamic vinegar. Both enjoyed their entrees.

I chased my oysters with a bowl of their French onion soup.  Sweet onions made in a not too thick broth covered sourdough bread.  The soup was finished with a lightly browned and melted piece of Gruyere cheese.  This was more than enough food for me.

If you're in the downtown area, give triple george a try.  Like someone else once said, "I'll be back!"

Great surprise in Fremont Street area of Vegas.
Very old fashioned, traditional, NewYork Italian style steak house.
Food was excellent. Wine very nice. Good ambiance.
We had calamari which was obviously fresh. I had shellfish and Bill had chicken. We would definitely go again.

Cannot believe it's taken us so many years to finally check out this place. It's amazing!! We started with the black cherry martini and the crab cake. So good!! We enjoyed one of the specials...Chilean Sea Bass and the ny steak. Both were delicious but the Sea Bass was the best I've ever had. For dessert we had the lemon tart. It was small but really satisfying. The service was also out of this world!! I look forward to enjoying many more visits to our new downtown favorite place!!!

Hosted my wedding reception here 2/26 for around 40 people. I was astounded at the remarkable service my guests and I received. Our food was hot and served together, our drinks were full and the atmosphere was great. If you are considering a large get together look no further. Couldn't beat the price either. Ne'tosha was quick to respond to all emails and questions and she really made sure everything went smooth. Thanks triple George grill and staff!
Exceptional staff, amazing atmosphere, and fantastic food. A must do in downtown Las Vegas!

We were near Downtown Las Vegas and wanted to have dinner in a place where we were not going to be fed touristy food. We found TRIPLE GEORGE GRILL on Yelp and headed there to see if it fit the bill. Hubby wanted salmon and there it was right on the menu so we took a chance. Inside we found the place reminiscent of an old school steakhouse---lots of dark woods, linen covered tables  and enclosed private booths. We snagged one of those booths--lucky for us. Brenda our server brought us delicious sourdough bread with butter on a separate plate that had a pool of pink sauce around it. This sauce turned out to be an addictive, delicious dipping sauce for the bread. It was REALLY good. The Cajun salmon came with a rice pilaf that tasted like southern dirty rice as well as some sautéed veggies. The salmon portion was quite ample and deliciously prepared. My order was chicken pot pie and it was classically prepared with celery, peas, carrots potatoes and pearls onions amidst the chunks of chicken. Cream was used which made it deliciously rich. It came in what seem to be a cast iron mini pot which was topped by puff pastry. A delicious GUINNESS was the beverage of choice and even with that we made room for dessert --flourless chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream. KABOOM!  A Home run !  Our server was spot on making sure that all was well and that our waters were topped. 
At the end of our meal, the owner came by to ask how our meal was and of course we expressed our delight with his restaurant. 
When in Vegas, look this place up.  You won't be sorry.

Foods not amazing or close to Tadich Grill in SF that they claim they are created after. Been to taditch, while Triple George Grill looks the same the food is not the same. It wasnt good especially for the price. 

The Fish and Chips were not fully cooked when they came. The chicken parm was fine but I can make better at home. I didnt need to eat this out. Calamari was very good, fresh, hot and crispy. Wedge salad was decent, good blue cheese, nice fresh tomatoes, would have been nicer if they took off the first leaf of wilted lettuce (not a big deal). Mushroom pasta was good, Id order that again. But do note on the pasta sauce that it is a bit sweet and has sun dried tomatoes, not sure if the menue states this or not. 

The service was slow, friendly but slow. We went on a Sunday night it shouldnt have been an issue. 

I had to keep getting up to get fresh pepper from the pepper mill on the shelf above my table because the waiter didnt do it when salads or good came. That was kinda annoying for the type of restaurant.

With all the other great places to eat in Vegas, I wouldnt come back.

We went today for a lunch and it was awesome, our server was Justin ,very nice and attentive without being over the top ( I hate when they ask you every 2 min.  if everything is OK)   Chicken Pot Pie, New York Strip and Fish of the day was our choice, everything was fresh and my steak was great and so was everything else...no complaints...We will be back for sure

This is a very good restaurant located in downtown Las Vegas. location is convenient to downtown and the ambiance is what you'd expect in a great steakhouse if a little on the noisy side.

The service here is exceptional and the drinks are Vegas stiff but very flavorful. There is a large menu with a focus, as you'd expect, on steak and seafood. My last visit was with a group of 12 people and the menu was well represented around the table and no one had anything they didn't think was great.

The steaks are high quality and prepared exactly the way you order them. They are tender and juicy and melt in your mouth. A couple of unexpected favorites (I came back for lunch two days in a row) was the Chicken Pot Pie and the Pot Roast. These are perfectly executed classics.

The only reason I dropped one star is that twice in a row my soup was cold by the time they brought it out and it came too close to my entree from a timing standpoint and I found the service sitting outside on the patio to be lacking compared to the interior service. That said all of the waitstaff are knowledgable, friendly and more than willing to help.

If you are in downtown I'd definitely chose Triple George for dinner for the steaks and the ambiance, you won't be disappointed!
Great food, great service. They have a varied menu. San Franciscans atmosphere. Bartenders are top notch. I've returned a few times and it's always a great experience.
Had an exceptional shrimp and scallop dinner. Sauce was great and the seafood was cooked perfectly. Our Server, Cameron, did a great job attending our needs.

My family and I take a Vegas trip every year and hands down our favorite restaurant to eat is Triple George. We have tried the steaks, seafood, pot roast, and pot pie and all of them are fantastic. We love the ambiance and the old time feel it gives you but still has that elegant feel as well. You won't leave this place hungry or disappointed. Best place to go for lunch or dinner in Downtown Vegas. Can't wait til we go back again next year...

The service was absolutely amazing and the food was incredible.  My wife and I had our first trip to Vegas and tried out several different restaurants on the Strip.  Most were ok but not as good as the hype.  Our last night there we headed down to Fremont Street and found this neat little restaurant over on 3rd about a block away from Fremont. (Thank you Yelp!)  They treated us like royalty!  I got the pot roast and my wife got the chicken pot pie.  Both were amazing and both were HUGE portions.  The pot roast was so tender I didn't need a knife, and the pot pie had a perfect flaky crust.  We ordered one salad to share and they put it on two plates for us.  Truly great service.  BONUS:  This place serves coke!  Yay!  Its hard to find a coke in Vegas unfortunately.

Stayed across the street at The Grand and the staff recommended getting a dinner experience of old. The ambience here is of yesteryear and old school wood paneling with panache. The service was great and the food is truly one of kind. We also had a private booth which made the whole thing with family much more personal . We ordered the bone in fillet with shrimp, asparagus and mashed potatoe; of course a glass of vino or two with our meal. They also brought us bread with a butter and dipping oil with herbs. Talk about getting spoiled; it was an experience of the old Vegas, of long ago. Try it and get some love here, you deserve it. Start the New Year right

Absolutely amazing. I had the Buttermilk sage fried chicken...loved every bite. The chicken was cooked to perfection, moist and tender and the coating was spot on. The vegetables were also amazing and full of flavor. I wasn't quite sure what to expect in terms of the atmosphere, but was truly surprised:: it was so clean and inviting. Definitely on my list of favorites now.

Had a great meal here. The chicken pot pie was amazing and the pot roast delicious. Shared them with a friend. The service was top notch. Highly recommend is you are in Vegas. The ambiance is wonderful as well.

Lunch ~

Chicken Parm is delicious. 
Fish & Chips is 'so-so' (bad fries, just awful)
Fried Chicken is great
Turkey Wrap is very good & healthy

That's the food. 

The atmosphere is not bad but it is acoustically problematic. Or maybe just too loud. Especially the back room. 

The service is never remarkable. And I mean that. Not great. Nor bad. 

The food will bring us back. But we'll also keep trying other places as well. 

Hope this helps. 

Her & I.
Absolutely delicious! Lunch was delicious and the old fashioned is very good. The inside is old looking all wood and private booths

Triple George's is a solid steakhouse.  My bf got a ribeye- he said it was perfect.  I had the vegan burger- it was a little heavy on the soy but overall good.  I do with their gluten free/vegan menu had a bit more variety l; but I'm happy they had options for me.

Awesome place. Came down from Downtown Grand for Lunch and was pleasantly surprised! Service was great! Ryan was a great server. We enjoyed New England Clam Chowder, Penne Primavera Pasta and more. Will definitely be coming back here! If you're in DTLA, swing by this joint. You won't be disappointed!

One of my favorite places in Downtown LV. I could go here over and over again!

Favorites:
Chicken Parmesan a hearty take on the classic chicken parm served with grilled veggies

Petrale Sole pan sautéed and topped with lemon butter sauce (breaded)

Grilled Chicken Cobb a classic mix of hard boiled egg, onion, avocado, bacon, tomato, blue cheese

Other Awesome choices - Chicken Cristopher, Buttermilk Sage Fried Chicken, Ahi Tuna, Wedge Salad, and the Mac & Cheese side dish.

Great food!  Awesome tasting, nice place. Husband had meat loaf & loved it. My steak was delicious!  Service was maybe a 3 star - only because we had to wait quite awhile for the check & our server did not appear busy at the time.

An AMAZING dinner tonight with Justin.  He recommended the Caesar salad which was incredible.  Then we had chicken parm and chicken saltimbotica which were wonderful.  Followed by a chocolate indulgence. AN AMAZING MEAL

We went on a Friday night before heading to the Neon Museum and had a great time! Highly recommend either the porcini crusted or bone-in steaks. Great beer and craft cocktail selection as well with amazing servers and a great atmosphere! Would definitely revisit next time we're in Vegas!

My friend and I enjoyed a fabulous dinner here last night. Made a reservation an hour before...just in case. Were seated immediately after arriving. Service was fantastic. We needed for nothing. Someone was always checking on us. 
  Fresh, hot sourdough bread was delicious. Ordered caprese salad and shrimp scampi. My friend had the chicken Parmesan. Food was perfect. Had molten chocolate cake and key lime pie for dessert. 
  Nice place. Good atmosphere. Friendly and attentive staff. Prices were reasonable. A very good meal and overall experience.

LOVE this place! I used to live in SF and it reminds me of an SF restaurant. The sourdough bread is warm and delicious. And the clam chowder is the best I've had in Vegas. I've been here for lunch and can't wait to try their dinner menu!

Came here for a big bachelor party dinner with about 14 ish guys. The place was cool , a place in downtown vegas . They had ample room to accommodate the big group and the wait wasn't bad but we did make reservations via the online app before hand though. Service and drinks from the bar were great. Not a big wine person but I felt they had a decent selection. Now on to the steaks they cooked a little bit more rare side, but delicious. Felt the steaks were a bit over seasoned with their house seasoning but still a tasty steak. I prolly would come back here.

We met up in Vegas with cousins of ours whose son travels frequently to Vegas on business. He recommended this restaurant, which is a block away from the Fremont Street Experience (see my review of that as well). The steaks were huge but even so, it was a little pricey for being off the strip. The service was average and the décor wasn't anything special and pretty plain (all deep brown wood which might appeal to some). I had the petite New York, which wasn't very petite and my husband had the ribeye, which he claimed was "good for a ribeye," whatever that means. I usually douse my steak in A1 but it sat untouched throughout my meal. I left wishing we had tried a different steakhouse. Measly servings of wine as well, but you're still overcharged for a full glass. Other than that, nothing much to write home about for this one. Wouldn't go back if we came to Vegas again.

We've been here for lunch and dinner. I love the atmosphere. You walk into an awesome looking circular bar, staff is well dressed and friendly. Big booths that are ceiling high. We had the scallops and meat loaf. The scallops were good. The meatloaf was a bit greasy, I couldn't finish it. The baked potato side was great. The food was ok, but we'll be back to test other dishes, we really like the atmosphere so much we intend to find our favorite dishes.

Ok so I bookmarked this place over 6 months before I left for Vegas, finally I tried this place and it did not disappoint very much, the service was plessant a little slow but we were patient had no place to go. It was close to 9pm we came for a late supper while visiting Old Vegas, a short walk away, I ordered the Rib Eye steak it was so tender and flavorful I had an instant orgasm lol. Only mistake to my steak was that I ordered it medium well, but came out medium rare, it was so good i didn't care i was hungry and did not want to ruin the flavor by reheating. Drinks were quite pricey  but with a delicious meal being served and reasonably priced its easy to overlook the drinks. Was not fussy on the desserts either. Overall great food but the rest falls to good catagory.
Amazing food and amazing service! Andrew is a top notch server! Had the bruchetta and ribeye. Both were fantastic. Will be back here in the future.

Items selected:

- Petite filet mignon
- Fish and chips

Plus complimentary sourdough bread basket. All decent.

The patio seating was a nice setting in the middle of downtown.
Ribeye was good. Potatoes were 'Eh', carrots were not mentionable. The tuna steak was awful. Awful, I tell you, awful. Beers and 2 meals $110 with tip. Great service.

Love this restaurant! I've been here a few times now and I am never disappointed. I came for a business lunch and the food and drinks were amazing. I had the buttermilk sage fried chicken and a cucumber martini. The flavors were so good. This was best cucumber martini I have ever had! 

Happy hour here is great. We had the goat cheese marinara and wings. I was surprised how good the cheese marinara was. It came with perfectly toasted bread for dipping.

Review is based on a late evening drink, that really was the best I have ever tried and in general there was a very nice atmosphere in the bar. 

We read about the sea salt caramel martini they serve there, and being Scandinavians we love everything salty.  We came around 10 in the evening and noticed the nice atmosphere at once.  There were dining seats in a horse shoe around the bar, and seats by the bar if only drinking.  

We got our martini quickly, but it was made properly by a professional and nice bartender.  She somehow reminded me of Sandra Bullock and we had a nice chat on how Aria hotel has the best scent there is.

So, salty caramel?  Omg,  I would loooove to have another. Now!

Will come back in a year and have dinner also.

Great Steaks great staff great First dinner in Las Vegas! Had the NY STRIP med cooked to perfection. The ladies had the chicken pot pie was looking good and crust was flaky and delicious! House wines and beers were enjoyable!

We had the most wonderful experience and food at Triple George Grill. We called down and asked if they could fit eight of us in around 8:30 on a Friday night and by the time we walked down (15 minutes) they had a table set up for our party. The hostess was very friendly and welcoming. Our waiter, Victor(best ever), was very attentive and fun, fun, fun! He gave us the menu run down and was very knowledgeable on each item we asked about. We also had a server(bus man) named Leo who was friendly and quick with any extras we requested and filling our waters. Now, on to the food-DELICIOUS! The portions were huge, seriously enough for people to share. When we sat down the brought relish trays and sourdough bread that was amazing. Three people ordered the huge Porter House steak special and one ordered the fillet from the menu, All of them were cooked perfectly and the mushrooms on the top were a great accent. We also had the veggies and the whole plate was cooked to perfection. The chicken dish with proschuto(sp) was Devinne, the chicken pot pie was enormous and a little heavy on the sage. I liked it, but my friend that ordered it isn't a huge sage fan:(. We had the ravioli dish which was exceptional and the Halibut w/shrimp. With the exception of the sage heavy chicken pot pie, our evening at George's was phenomenal! Again, Vince made our dining experience fun and exciting, he was SPECTACULAR! I don't know when we'll head back to Vegas, but George's will be on our schedule.

As Homer Simpson says Hhhhmmmmm. (insert picture of me mouth open, tongue out, drooling in a state of pure food bliss)

What else is there to say. I never go to Vegas with out stopping here at least once and I always leave on cloud nine. This trip was the special of the day Buffalo Rib Eye with blue cheese. We split that with Calamari to start followed by a chopped salad. Accompanied by a bottle of Troublemaker and followed by a chocolate death of some sort, pure food orgasm....

Did I mention I love this place and just writing this is making my mouth water.

Get there late or make a reservation to get a nice booth but make sure to visit the bar first as they have the best, friendliest bartenders in vegas. The basil cucumber martini was amazing and a great price during happy hour.

One last note if you can only go here once you absolutely, positively, with out doubt, no question about it must have the Cioppino. Yes its that good and just typing about it has made me so hungry I must go eat now...

Located near Fremont, this is a great place to enjoy a meal.

If you happen to be wandering off of Fremont, you'll find Triple George next to Pizza Rock.  You walk into a huge bar area.  Plenty of seats in this front area. It's very clean and the hostess was friendly.

We were dining there for lunch and she gave us a table in the back.  The back dining area seems like a completely different place.  It has a darker and more intimate feel.  There are tv screens in the wall for some entertainment.   

Justin was our waiter and was a delight.  We had great service throughout our meal which made me very happy.   I decided on George's Club with fries.   This sandwich is huge and could only finish half.   It was actually piled too high for me to get my mouth around it.  Fries were crispy and delicious.  

I would have no problems coming back here when in the downtown area.   Thanks for a great lunch!

Had a great dinner tonight at Triple Georges. Started with a nice bottle of wine that our server "Laslo" recommended. We then move from the bar area to our table where we continued the nice service we had in the bar. we orderd the chop salad and split it. I had a beautiful Rib Rye. My husband had the lamb chops. Both entries were cooked to perfection. Service was great. Entrees were brought to the table by the manager. There was a slight mixup in our order, but everything  was great even with the wrong entree. Too full for deserts, maybe next time. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

Boss bought me lunch here,  what a treat.
This place has an old-timey SanFrancisco feel to it.
The waiters/bartenders are all in suits, they specialize in fresh steak/seafood, they have an outstanding lunch, dinner, drink, AND dessert menu.

The food is incredible.
The price is a bit much, but this is no ordinary restaurant/bar.
You may dress up on date night here and order a bottle of wine or a classy signature cocktail...something I never do.
There are coat racks/purse hooks everywhere and the booths are very enclosed and personal.
The inside almost reminds me of a speakeasy. ;)
Be back later.
Outstanding service!  Ryan was wonderful as was the food.  Highly recommend if you are in the area.  Reasonable prices, attention to detail on the plating and presentation.  Quality all around!
Okay I've been here now 4 times. The bar is good. The atmosphere is pleasant. But the food is excellent. I would highly recommend the pot roast.

A reasonably priced great meal with friendly staff who kept our drinks full. 
Steaks were cooked as ordered and were good quality. Definitely a place to go in Vegas the next grime I find myself working there.

A great find. We took a group of 16 there for lunch. The treated us so well. I had the Moco Loco. Amazing!  Everyone liked their food. Nothing bad on the menu. Well worth the trip off the Strip. just a block from the Mob Museum - a must see.

Great Chicago upscale atmosphere.  Food was so good.  Trio Of fries as appetizer was great, my George burger had so much flavor, the fish tacos were amazing.  A friend had the NY Strip-melted in your mouth.  Waitress was pleasant and on top of things.  If in Vegas, you have to stop and try this place.  You won't regret it.

I have always had good experiences, but had not been back in a while. The restaurant is as good as ever. Nice Minestrone soup was great on a cold day. It is always hard to beat good, homemade soup. I had a great mixed greens salad with pears, walnuts and at my request, chopped, grilled chicken. It is a great to have a salad with chicken, properly chopped, that fills you up. Service was attentive and efficient. I am looking forward to my next trip.
Great steak and atmosphere. Highly recommended for a nice change of pace from the strip. Although it's not cheap, it's nowhere as expensive as what you'd pay on the strip for similar quality food.

We ate here three times while in Downtown Las Vegas. Whatever works, right?

First time the service was a little slow, but it picked up. Here's the rundown:

#1 experience:
I ordered the Brussels and chicken. The server asked me if I wanted vegan chicken. We all laughed because "vegan chicken" is such an oxymoron. I told him to bring on the real stuff and out came an EXTREMELY generous portion of chicken and Brussels sprouts. I couldn't finish it all. I had been warned the Brussels may be a little crispy (some people apparently complain), but I thought they could have been even crispier. I like them a bit charred. 

#2 experience:
Co-worker had just landed and the rest of us had already eaten, so we accompanied her so she could eat. She loved her dish (fried chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies) and I had a glass of wine with some passion fruit mousse. The wine was a C (not the restaurant's fault) and the mousse was really good.

#3 experience:
Lunch again. This time I had the chopped salad with chicken. Again, a huge portion. It was very good and really liked the balsamic. Colleague and I split a crème brûlée - very good.

My favorite is their bread and the butter/olive oil they serve with it.

Would definitely recommend and if you need a place for a business lunch, this is a great choice.

Keeping the classic feeling of Vegas alive. 

For starters parking isn't always the most convenient downtown so park at The Downtown Grand Casino & Hotel and they'll validate your ticket for free. It's a short walk over...

The food was great except for the lousy Caesar salad that had a watery dressing and was on the bland side. The NY steak was extra juicy and my chicken was delicious with great mashed potatoes and perfectly cooked veggies on the side. If you enjoy ice tea they have one of the best ones around with ice tea ice cubes in it and I must have had at least 3 refills (complimentary) it was so good. 

Service was great and it's a beautiful restaurant that feels like something out of old Hollywood. Dark woods, mood lighting, large bar where you can also eat and very cozy, nearly private booths that are very old school.

What an amazing experience! Immediately upon entering we were welcomed by a host (maybe the manager?) who made us feel so welcome. I like to emphasize on his enthusiasm, for there are times when hosts/hostesses do terrible jobs at making guests feel welcome and this was NOT one of those times. Instantly we broke into conversation with the man while he scoped the restaurant for an available table. Once he had a table for us, he walked us over to a booth that was practically enclosed completely. Such a romantic and private area to have dinner, something I really admired. 
Then, he asked for my jacket so he could hang it on the coat rack inside our booth! I'm not one for fancy places that do these sorts of fancy things so I was a bit taken back, flattered, and then very willing to oblige and hand over my puffy Columbia jacket. 
At this point, I felt like we were in a very classy steak house, but knew at the same time we were in a sports bar? Pretty cool feeling.
Through our banter at the door with the host I mentioned I was vegan, and by the time we were sitting I had their "glegan" (gluten free/vegan) menu sitting in front of me. Not a huge menu, but it had enough variety for someone whose options at a steakhouse are generally limited to, well, salad. I got the penne primavera, boyfriend got a ribeye with two sides... well 4 total for him if you include the salad and sour dough (not vegan). All of our food was divine and the service was impeccable as well. All of our food and the bottle of wine we purchased brought our check to under $100! 
Only sad thing was that there's no glegan dessert! Bummer, but not a deal breaker. 
Will definitely be coming back soon!

After spending a grueling day on our feet at the Fremont Experience, my friends and I wanted a place to sit down, relax, and have a drink and a nosh.  One of my friends remembered her daughter saying the Triple George had some great food and drink and since we were a block away from the restaurant, off we went.  My friend's daughter works at The Miracle Mile and knows all the great little places for us to try.

I fell in love with the ambience.  It is old timey ganster.  There was a long bar to sit at if you just wanted drinks or if dinner is on the agenda, there are booths along the wall and tables along the aisle.  The booths were sheltered from the regular restaurant clientele by a divider.  The patrons still saw what was going on in the restaurant, but there was some privacy too.  It was cool!  We were seated at a table along the aisle.  I wasn't that comfortable in the chair, but any seat was feeling good at that point in my evening.

Our super friendly waitress, Denise?, came and took our drink orders and gave us our menus.  What a friendly woman.  It made the experience all the better.  The next thing that happened rocked me to my socks.  Out came a bread basket with piping hot bread and a dish of soft butter.  It hit me where it counts, because when butter comes with the bread in other places, it's hard as a rock and it isn't worth eating.  To compound my surprise, a plate of veggies arrived; cornichons, cherry peppers, pepperoncinis, carrot sticks, and olives.  Incredibly old timey!

I ordered the Grilled Swordfish with sauteed shrimp, rice pilaf, and veggies and was beside myself it was so good.  This was the best piece of fish I have had in a long, LONG time.  Those cooks really put their foot in it!  One of my friends ordered the Grilled Salmon and she loved hers almost as much as me.  I cleaned my plate, she left a few pieces of rice.  My other two friends ordered appetizers and they seemed to be enjoying them.


I'd say Triple George rocks it old time AND big time and I will go back as much as I can in the future.
I had the Shrimp George, good food & good ambiance.  Drinks were a bit expensive though.

Awesome service and food!!  The only draw back is if u sit at the bar as we did as all the tables were full and we didn't want to wait 30 min, the bar stools are pretty uncomfortable for me especially, me being 5'6", my feet couldn't reach the ledge,so they dangle which is very uncomfortable for me, but I can overlook that as the service was great, always kept my water full and asked us multiple times if we needed anything or how was everything.  I ordered pot roast and my husband ordered the whole roasted chicken, both were delicious!  We ARE coming back for sure.  We only chose this place as it was on our validation list for where we parked downtown otherwise we would've missed this absolute wonderful restaurant- I've been to Vegas a dozen times or more, and this is by far the best food and service I've ever found and to boot you don't have to pay an arm and a leg!  Love it!!!

Everyone at our table had the porcini ribeye. It was delicious, we were all starving from a full day of Vegas, and none of us could clean the plate. You have to appreciate a high class steak house that isn't afraid to give you a huge steak for  a reasonable price just because Gordon Ramsey charges three times as much for half the food in his fancy spot on the strip. Wait staff was attentive and knowledgable. Bartender knew what he was doing, as well. Now that I know about this spot, I might just eat here every time I'm in Vegas.
Nice surprise in downtown.  The food was tasty and the service was attentive and prompt.  Great atmosphere!

I eat here to get out of the hustle and bustle of the Vegas strip.  It's a cab ride away from downtown but the Fremont area of Vegas is a delight to visit.  The staff and bartenders were attentive and friendly, I stick with the staples when ordering, chicken parmigiana, cut of filet, good wine.

Friday night at Triple George. Loved it!!! Classy, fabulous food and Justin our  server was Awesome!!!

P. Coulson
Service was fantastic.  Food was well seasoned and very tasty.  Had wedge salad followed by Petit fillet.  Ice tea had frozen ice tea for ice cubes

Pure class. Delicious food. Impeccable service. My wife and I stopped here instead of one of the casino restaurants for lunch. We both had a Reuben. One of the best we've had - lean corned beef & more meet than sauerkraut with just enough dressing so it could be tasted without over powering the sandwich. Linen napkins, real silverware and fantastic waiters. We'll be back.
Grymt bra personal och riktigt god mat. Rekommenderas till alla. Funkar både med vuxna och med barn
Came here for a birthday celebration.  Service was quick and friendly.  Food was delish!  Salted Caramel Martini was on point.
The Service wasn't great, the steak was under cooked and had to be sent back twice. Very disappointed for the price.

We came by for an early dinner after seeing a matinee at the Smith Center. It was not crowded. They did have a table waiting for us. We had requested a booth. The first booth that they offered to us had a cracked vinyl seat so we requested a different table. The second booth was perfect. I strongly recommend sitting in a booth rather than a table when you  eat here. The booths have high wooden walls that allow complete privacy and the sense of intimacy. Our server came by almost immediately to take our drink orders and to explain the specials for the night. My wife and I decided to share the chopped salad and the drunken steak. The chopped salad, even when shared, was huge and difficult to finish despite it being delicious. The drunken steak did not appear to be huge especially since it was shared. It turns out that appearances were deceiving. The steak was more than ample to the two of us. It was cooked to perfection exactly as we had ordered. This is a terrific place to eat either before or after going to the Smith Center. Excellent food, service, and ambience.
service was great. The entire staff was very attentive. Andrew provided excellent service and made good suggestions. Food was delicious. We enjoyed sitting outside.

I was seriously bummed because we were really excited to try this steakhouse but it was awful and bland. How can a steak that is aged 30 days be bland? I have no idea but, alas, it was. 
They dropped a load of mashed potatoes on our plate. It was just purely tasteless. I had to ask for butter just to give it flavor. And, it is SO LOUD! I just hated it.

This the Downtown High Roller, big Ballers, Bankers, Millionaire Attorneys hangout ! 

But it's is also great for a date, or anniversary. The food is always stellar. 
The mood of the restaurant is regal, and confiscated. White linen, well dressed waiters. 

You can't go wrong with the Steaks! But the Seafood is right up there too. 

When it cools down or at night the patio overlooks part of downtown so great people watching. Plan for parking since it does not have hardly any upfront.

Great Find! Just a short walk from Freemont street. Went there with a group of 4 girls and we had the blackberry a martini's. I would say a must if you like martinis! They were amazing. We had a private booth, the sourdough bread was delivered right away and it was piping hot.. We ordered spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer, absolutely delicious. The Georges Chopped salad was just ok, nothing special. For dinner we ordered filets and the chicken christopher. Everything was cooked perfect! Great little resturant nice ambiance, great service, next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely make another stop at the Triple George Grill

I was looking for a nice dinner before attending an event at the Smith Center.  My girlfriend and I decided on the Triple George Grill.  We started the evening with Sex on the Beach and Scotch on the rocks for her.  That gave us time to take in the decor.  I love the old high end steakhouse type of feel about the place.  The cute guys at the bar were nice to look at too!

We were seated at a booth that was very private, so I made a mental note for a future date night with the boyfriend for later.  I love restaurant layouts that provide an intimate dining space and you can enjoy the company you are with.  

We shared bruschetta with grilled bread that was good but in my opinion was a little too heavy with the balsamic vinegar that overpowered the taste of the tomatoes.  We both enjoyed it.

I ordered the filet steak caprese which I have never had anywhere and it was just so great.  The filet tenderloins were cooked medium rare just exactly as I ordered it and layered between mozzarella cheese and tomato slices and a side of arugula.  It was a perfectly balanced meal.

My friend ordered the pot roast with the pan gravy.  There were vegetables served with it and she loved her meal as well. 

The service was top rate.  I think we had three service people attending us during the evening.  In the beginning of the evening we told our server we had an event to attend at the Smith Center and he made sure everything came out promptly.  That little detail is very much noted.  Thank you.

I did notice before I ordered there was a 15% discount for a Yelp check in but forgot to mention that when I paid my bill.  But they did validate our parking at 3rd Street and Ogden so that's ok.  I will make sure to use it next time.

I am looking forward to returning again soon and let my boyfried experience it with me.  It was a lovely evening.

I was with a group of eight people and they were able to accommodate us very well. The service was friendly and fairly quick for a large table. It is conveniently located within a short walk of the Fremont Street area. The food was good and they had an extensive drink list.

Great choice. Reminiscent of a Chicago restaurant. My husband ordered the Reuben sandwich for lunch and I had the roast chicken with asparagus. The iced tea is the best. They bring out a glass of ice in a wine glass but the ice cubes are frozen iced tea. Brilliant. I've never seen a restaurant do that. I hope the trend catches on. Love it. Excellent food and service.

Our first night in Las Vegas we decided to give this place a try after seeing advertisement in a magazine on the flight in.  The atmosphere was pretty cool, our server was awesome and very friendly.  Be Careful, the appetizer portions are large. I loved the bread with oil, vinegar, and herbs. The steamed clams are delicious. My hubby and I decided to share a main entrée due to the large portion appetizers. We went for the drunken hanger steak-awesome!!!   The mashed potatoes was the only thing that was gross. Our server immediately replaced it with another side of our choice. All in all it was a great dining experience.  We also got to use our check-in discount

Very pleased
-Dr. A

My boyfriend and I stayed at the new Downtown Grand Hotel while in Vegas last week and were looking for a nice place to eat, away from the Casino smoke and noise. Triple George Grill fit the bill! Just across the street, the interior provided a nice, quiet respite from the Vegas hubbub. The tall wooden booths created a privacy we relished as we devoured our meals. He had the petit filet that he declared the best he'd ever eaten (and he's eaten a lot!) and I had the shrimp and scallop pasta dish, which they made with spicey marinara for me rather than the dairy-based sauce. The scallops were plump and succulent. The shrimp tender and moist. The sourdough bread....I must have eaten two loaves on my own it was so tasty.

Next time we're in downtown Vegas, we will be going to the Triple George Grill. Not only was the food delectable, but the service was a comfortable pace and friendly.
Always the best! Great food. Fabulous service. Thank you for watching out for us Becky! Will, thank you for making our experience just that much better!!!

Excellent steak. Don't tempura lobster! It is so good by itself, when you do that to it, it tastes like fish sticks. Great spinach artichoke dip. Comfortable ambiance with old-school Vegas pictures decorating the walls. Slow table service, but it was a Saturday night.

When you walk in this place, you are instantly transformed to the 1920's with the timy square tile floors to the cherry wood private booths and the classic Vegas photos.  The place even has gold coat racks along the whole wall. The real.prize of this place is THE FOOD!!!!  It is top notch, fullfilling and moderately priced gor the high quality of food you get. Good drinks, good food. You can't go wrong!

Great petit filet mignon. Order the meat without a sauce. Great charbroiled flavor. Amazing service. Was just the right balance of service. Andrew knew all the right times to ask us if we were okay and if we needed anything. Nice San Francisco feel. Overall this place is great. Skip the strip, come downtown. Great vibe. Definitely a must while you're in Vegas.

Popped in for quick lunch, mainly needing coffee after reading my brains off at the Mob Museum. Was really looking forward to trying this place again!

I got the Reuben sandwich which was okay, after requesting a side of mustard. Shouldn't that come with? Mustard made my meal cuz the meat was kinda dry. Fries were okay. Their garden salad was amazing, came tossed in our preferred ranch dressing. So yummy, could eat that all day. My BF ordered the French dip. Good bread but meat lacking in flavor n the au jus was hardly enticing. Nothing to it but a tinge of salt.

Complimentary bread's crust was hard n thick, you could crunch your face off eating that.

Service here is wonderful n they've good coffee. But, maybe dinner items are better here.
The food and service were great. We had a party of six and everyone enjoyed their meal.  Will definitely go back again!

The bartender with the gauged ears makes the world's best Bloody Mary. And the filet mignon is among the best steaks I've had.

That is all.

Had dinner with the hubby. It was a spur of the moment on a thur night. The place wasn't too busy. It was a short wait. The place has a classy but casual atmosphere. It reminds me of old Hollywood. The staff is very attentive. Had a very diverse menu but a bit pricey. Everything we ordered was good from the appetizer to the desert. Would definitely be a place we would recommend and come back to. Even if it was just for drinks.

Love the bar.
Love the service.
Love the beef.

But most of all, I love the downtown, low key atmosphere coupled with the classic long bar.  Sidebar is tempting for a martini after work and I just haven't gotten there yet.

PS:  fantastic cocktails from the great bartenders.
Nice bar.  Old school feel.  Good food. Super location in downtown Las Vegas.  Go for it!!!

My wife and I took another couple there (we live in LV as well as Chicago). Three of us had filets (cooked just the way we each of us wanted) and my wife had Chicken Parm. All the other food items (bread, spread, salad, veggies, etc.) were excellent. Service was efficient (perfect in fact, as was noted by our companions).
As a note to Norm K, I had french fries with my filet as I always have in the past when I've dined there. (They're not on the menu as a filet option, but they're always available if you request - and they're good.)
There's a parking garage about 1/4 of a block away, and TG validates.
We spent $280 (including a generous tip) for the meal which included 6 drinks amongst the four of us. Elsewhere it would have cost close to $350-400 at most name/good steakhouses.
Highly recommend this gem.

This place has a lot of 5-star food, like the half chicken (so moist!), pork chop stuffed w/ apples and goat cheese (ridonculous), and mushroom soup (only on the menu as a special), but also has some not-too-exciting fare like the chicken sandwich (kinda dry). 

this place is definitely a lunch spot, where you'll find it overflowing w/ white-collared lunchies, but i find the food better for dinner. it's just too bad the place is pretty empty at night. regardless, the food is excellent, the meats grilled to perfection.

Two trips, and two completely different experiences. One trip had great food (An excellent tomahawk steak, and fantastic calamari) and great service. The second trip, during the work week, had slow service, an under seasoned steak, and my wife's fish was slightly burn't on the skin side, and undercooked on the top side. I'll give them another try, but they are hit and miss so far.

Great place to eat! The vibe is very classy but yet not too fancy, and the food is fantastic! I had the steak sandwich and it did not disappoint. Our server Vincent was great! Extremely friendly and gave fantastic service. If you ask for him he will make your day!

Great semi-casual steak house with a cool San Francisco vibe, friendly service and an adjacent bar (The Sidebar) where hipsters can drink, smoke AND dine from the TGG menu! Awesome comfort food (bacon-wrapped meatloaf ... O - M - G!)  at fair prices and wonderful (but overpriced) cocktails. Their martini of the day is always a great deal though. Love the valet parking too. Could do without the loud Harley's going up and down the street, but this is due to its location next door to Hogs & Heifers.  Highly recommended!

Ok really what happened to the food? 

I loved the clubby feel of the restaurant. It was very much a place that reminded me of back east with its dim lit recesses. 

However, seriously WHAT HAPPENED TO THE FOOD?

We got oysters that were actually very tasty. I would order those again. It was a good start. I was excited.

I ordered a steak sandwich which came and had a thin grisly piece of meat, probably the cheapest cut from Sysco. Why I was asked how I wanted my meat cooked is beyond me because this cheap piece of meat was incapable of being cooked any other way than done. It was encased by a plain dry white hoggie roll, topped with one slice of seemly unwashed lettuce and one slice of tomato and red onion and chipotle mayo on the side.

However the saddest part of that plate was the INSTANT mashed potatoes. They just broke my heart sitting there sad, flavorless and gelatinous on my plate.

Why would you do that to your patrons? Why? 

The other half got a burger which was adequate. The meat was thick, the onions flavorful, bacon thick and crispy. The vegetables were a shining star lots of flavor, good variety and cooked al dente. 

However the plate ran into trouble because the flavorful juicy vegetables were right next to the burger on the plate which by the time it was served made the burger bun soggy. It would be an easy fix to put the veg. in a ramekin. The fries were ok. 

Overall, drinks and bar, service and Atmosphere A++++, 5 stars, but the foods was really disappointing.
Hands down the best steak I've ever had. Fabulous atmosphere like walking straight back into an era of class and elegance. An experience worth paying for..

Great restaurant in Freetown! We were in the strip but looking to visit Freetown for the evening and Triple George got thumbs up from everyone.

Really pretty, vintage interior. The bar takes up an entire room! Drinks were great and strong. 
Nice ambiance and good acoustics despite it being a packed house the night we went (it was first Friday which is apparently crazy in Freetown). Prices were great and easily half what we would have paid for a comparable spread in the strip. Hubby and I shared the pot roast; our friends got the shrimp and pasta and roast chicken. Pot roast had a generous serving of roast, was ultra-flavorful and a steal IMO at $16. Our companions were very happy with the chicken and the shrimp. 

4 stars only because our server, while nice, had a distributed section and was not near us a lot so we had to flag down a different server to get his attention a couple times. He was really nice and attentive when he came by, but clearly having tables in different sections was tough on him (he was sweating when he came by). Definitely not his fault but something management might consider on busy nights.

We'll definitely stop back next time we're in Vegas!

Mixed feelings.
We had the mussels and were not really impressed.
The shrimps were absolutely delicious and the fried chicken was average +. 
Service was a little cold but ok, what we didn't appreciate is that the fried chicken had pork in it, and my boyfriend doesn't eat it. Not mentionned on the menu, so we told about it to our server when the bill came. Not great. 
I still think the food is worth checking that place out - just beware of what you order.

My boyfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day and it was kind of a disappointment. The waiter did not come around much, but we saw him walk past us a number of times. The bread was great. Fresh and yummy! But, the food was kind of mediocre. They kind of skimp on the seafood in the cioppino. And for the price that you pay in downtown, I feel like they need to serve you a decent portion. It was an OK experience, but unless they lower the price or make the food better, I probably won't be going back.

This place was amazing. The service was probably the best that I have seen in a long time. In the time that we had drinks, appetizers, and dinner, the wait staff checked in on us almost 20 times.

We started with drinks and an calamari appetizer. Then we moved on to dinner for 2, I had pot roast and Marcia had the hanger steak. I don't think that I have ordered pot roast in a restaurant before, but after reading all the tips for the pot roast, I decided to try it, and it was amazing. I would strongly recommend trying the pot roast. The hanger steak was good. Its is not often that when you order medium rare, that you actually get medium rare, but it was cooked perfectly. 

Our both was almost like a room of its own, and is great for an intimate dinner for 2, or for a group of 4.

The total bill for 2 of us was $74, and worth every penny. There was no disappointment here, next time I am in Vegas in the Fremont district I will certainly return to the Triple George Grill.

Remember... try the pot roast.

Found myself in Las Vegas so i introduced 2 friends to the Triple. Great staff, friendly, good wine and 3 excellent steaks. Awesome as ever. I'll be back again on my next trip. this place is always worth a visit.

We had heard of this place but never knew exactly where it was on.  On our walk back from the mob museum we spotted it.  We wanted somewhere good to go for dinner since it was my boyfriends birthday and landed on this place.  It was either here or Binions Steakhouse since we were downtown.  However we were a little spooked about Binions now being at the top of a closed hotel and having mixed reviews so we decided to try Tripple G.  We had heard it was locals spot.  We were pleasantly surprised at how awesome it was.  We guarantee we will be back many times in the future.  They had a surf and turf special which was a split lobster and 10 once filet with truffled mash which we both decided to have and it was well worth the price.  $42 dollars which you would never get on the strip and even if you did it it would never be that good.  We also each got a Ceasar Salad which was fresh and excellent..   Our waiter Brian and his Assistant Andrew were incredible as well.   This was one of those restaurants you can't find in our area anymore.  A good local restaurant with good cooking that is a little more upscale but not pretentious.  The dress code is casual fine dining so you don't have to be uncomfortable while you have an excellent meal.   This is one place you have to try!

A litlle slow for lunch, food took awhile and a little noisy out on patio, but not their fault, service was great. As far as food, Chicken Pot Pie is great. Being from New England the Chowda is too thick with mushy potatoes, but flavor was good, Caesar was good.  Wife liked the Chopped Salad w/ Salmon.

Triple George is a formal, wooden, martini bar without the smoke that also serves a nice lunch or dinner.

The atmosphere is dark with a long wood bar -- exactly the type of decor you'd expect in a classic "old boys network" bar.  If you want to have a martini in a suit--this is one of the few formal places in Vegas that might fit the bill.  There are very few t-shirts and shorts here.  Call it the Vegas professional's happy hour bar.

Beyond the professional drinking spot, Triple George offers a nice classic steakhouse menu.  They offer numerous lunch specials, ranging from some creative salads to classic chicken and steak sandwiches.  For dinner, the place is a little more like a classic steakhouse (oysters, salads, steaks, and mashed potato options).  

Basically, it's a classic American bistro restaurant and one of the more formal atmospheres in Vegas.  Thumbs up.

Excellent! In town for the Lang Lang  concert at the Smith Center; wanted a "nice place" close to the concert hall & TGG is the place.  Great service; excellent cocktails;
and be sure to order the pot roast as an entree. We will return & recommend to all.

Heard about this place through friends.
Excellent food and service. Well worth 
another trip again and again!
Looking for a great steak? I would recommend this restaurant. Excellent salads. Service is top notch.

I'd say four or five stars for being a cool, off the beaten path, downtown location. It's directly next to Hogs & Heifers biker bar on 3rd street and it seems the only way to park on the one-way street is via motorcycle or valet service. 
I met up with my man for his lunch break, he works downtown, and he surprised me by taking me to this hidden venue. I love the decor and the old school Las Vegas ambience inside. It's classy, but with an edge, and I was very excited to try it out.

Unfortunately the two stars is for service / food. We were seated in one of the big wooden booths, which is great for privacy, but also where we seemed to be forgotten about, being out of eyesight.
