My main entree was the 6oz filet w lobster. Omg. So good. My best friend had the salmon and she said it was the best salmon she has ever eaten. My sister and best friends wife had steak as well - and both commented how good it was as well. All of us had the mashed potatoes and this was a great choice as well. To finish off our meal the waitress brought me a chocolate 2 layer cake for my birthday and it was very good. I highly recommend this restaurant!

This place does 100 things right and one thing wrong.

Food, service, atmosphere, variety all done right.

Probably the best unknown steak in town, the porcini dusted ribeye is absolutely incredible and the blackened salmon is spot on and something I dream of. Just these two dishes make a trip here worth it. Then add the burgers, the meatloaf, the patio and cocktails and you get my point. They have a little something for everyone. If you haven't been you are missing out.

Like I mentioned earlier the only thing they do wrong is their marketing. That's why you don't know about how great it is. Make the time and get here for lunch or dinner, they are both worth it.
Found the Triple George Grill when walking to the Mob Museum.  Everything we had was awesome! All staff were very nice, especially Cameron who was avery attentive server and gave great suggestions!

One of our great finds in Las Vegas.  They have nice patio seating, but as there was a chill in the air, we took a seat at the bar. 
  My husband ordered the Martinique Manhattan and I had the French Revolution. In my husband's words, it was a very unique take on a Manhattan; glad he ordered it but wouldn't order two. I felt the same regarding French Revolution. I like prosecco and St. Germaine, but it was sweeter than desired. (I've become more of a dry wine aficionado).
  My husband ordered the special of the night, a Tenderloin Oscar. It was slightly on the salty side, but otherwise really well prepared. It was served with a side of garlic mashed potatoes.
  I ordered the swordfish which was served with a caper buerre blanc sauce, a side of wild rice pilaf and sauteed squash and carrots cut julienne. We both agreed the swordfish was superb. It was tender, moist, and delicious with the perfect amount of caper sauce. I savored every single bite. 
  I foresee us returning to this restaurant during our next visit to Las Vegas.
  For those watching their pocketbook, the meals were about $25 each.

I was looking for a restaurant to go to with my family while in Las Vegas. I read great reviews about Triple George Grill so I suggested we go here for dinner. It exceeded my expectations. All the food was well executed. 

Calamari - It was crispy and hot - a great starter for a group.

Shrimp George - crab-stuffed shrimp w/a lemon butter sauce
I loved the combination of the crab stuffing with the shrimp and the sauce brought it all together. 

Petite Filet Mignon - It was cooked to perfection and the vegetables and mashed the potatoes really complimented the dish.

Chocolate Cake - a decadent way to end a great meal.

All the servers were really nice and helpful. I definitely recommend Triple George Grill for a delicious dinner in downtown that's a lot more affordable than eating on the Strip.

Came here with out of town guests (on our way to Fremont Street.  I was pleasantly surprised by the entire experience.  Without a doubt we will put this place on our list for repeat visits.  Food was great, service was excellent, and prices were better than you would expect.

I happened to come to Triple George on a weekday afternoon and the whole area was DEAD.  So, I can't really offer much in the way of the atmosphere, but it seemed like a pretty cool place. The food was good -  I had the George burger and it was well prepared and tasty.  The local craft beer selection was also a great option for an out-of-towner.  The prices seem to be in line with typical Las Vegas prices, if you're in the area and hungry, I'd definitely recommend it!

I have heard of this place since I moved to Las Vegas 6 years ago, but just visited for the first time last week on a lunch break from jury duty. 

Attention locals:  Brighten your jury duty day with a lunch at the Triple George.  There is enough time to walk here from the courthouse, have lunch, and return during your one hour lunch.

The decor is old style with dark wood and a long bar area with plenty of seating surrounded by booths.  There were a handful of people having lunch when I arrived.  The bartender was quick to offer drinks and take my order.  I got the steak sandwich.  When it came out I was a little surprised, but to be fair it is true to the menu.  It was a new york steak (very well cooked) unsliced on a bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, and some sort of garlic sauce.  Once I got over the bit of shock, it was really good.

They have a section of the menu that is all under $10 if you want to grab a cheap, quick bite to eat in the fremont street area.

I have traveled to Las Vegas probably 200 times in the last 25 years and the past 2 I've come downtown. One if my goto eateries is Triple George part of the Downtown Grand. 
I've been to Triple George 5 times and 3 of these times I've had the pot roast. The pot roast is without a doubt the best I've ever had. My guests have also raved about the food and drink. The service is impeccable and the value is excellent.

Good food, great location, great service. Not the best for a large group, as it is a set menu.  My steak wasn't the best, considering the $$$ I paid.  Many others had a very good experience.  I would go back again to try it on a personal basis.
Very nice. Private booths are a nice option for customers. Staff very good at menu questions/descriptions/suggestions. Steak top notch - mashed potatoes melted in your mouth.
Great, fresh, tasty food. Service was impeccable and a great space. Priced appropriately. Highly recommended among the weird commercial food around.

Great food, service and atmosphere.  The waitstaff was at the top of their game, super attentive and helpful.  Had the surf and turf special which was great.  We decided to stop in on the spur of the moment, and were underdressed for the place, but were made to feel absolutely comfortable and welcome.  Highly recommended.

It was an underwhelming experience. The food was decent all around, but not mind-blowing. The baked goat cheese marinara ($10.95) was heavy on the cheese, light on the marinara, and came with more than enough toast. The chicken parmesan ($14.95) was pretty good, but similar to a million other versions of the dish. It was something that we could have gotten anywhere else. Last up was the filet mignon ($30.95). It was a nicely charred, tender cut that was cooked medium rare, as ordered with some buttery and garlicy mashed potatoes along with green beans and carrots. 

The atmosphere makes for a nice chill place for locals to hang out and the isolated booths that run along the bar make for an ideal place to have an intimate dinner where you can actually sustain a conversation despite the loud crowd noise from the bar.

Amazing! 

I had a longer drive than usual into Vegas so I nixed my plans of going out to eat. Checked into the Downtown Grand but wasn't feeling like any of their restaurants ( I forgot the Commissary is now open). The place was a 2-3 minute walk from my room so I called in a take out order at 9:20 (they close at 10). I had read the reviews on Yelp so asked Todd the bartender about  two items. Of th two, he suggested the fried chicken and it was AMAZING...

The take out people even packed it up correctly with the gravy sauce separate which made all the difference because I gambled a bit before going back to my room so the dish was not all soggy...

The dish came with a great mash potato and excellent carrots/green beans I read the reviews here so I asked them for bread and butter...the butter for some reason was a little bland but the sourdough bread was amazing. I appreciate that they didn't pack it until I got there so it was still slighty warm even after I made it to my room 40 minutes later...The dish was already a 10, if I had had it hot/sooner I would it would of been even more Food-gasmic....Its a good thing I will be visiting the fitness center..lol

How much was this meal? $15 including taxes, I tipped $2...sure I lost $20 gambling but I honesty would of paid $30 for some buffet on the strip that was not as good as the meal I had in the comfort of my room...

New fave take out in the downtown area...They also have a nice big bar vintage style to belly up too which I imagine is great for date conversation which is a nice contract to the party bar next door of hogs & heifers. Because I was a party of 1, I probably wouldn't site down and do the formal steakhouse thing which is better in a group....

The food was good, the atmosphere was excellent, but it did not exceed my expectations. Yes the food was food, but a little on the bland side. The service was friendly but not prompt.We waited 20 minutes  for a beer and they were not even busy. Over all we had a good experince but as locals we felt they are better options for us.

The food was really good the waitress we had was really spaced out and slow.  She was just mindless and did not ask if we needed anything after we were seated. We were seated outside and it was a bit busy so maybe that is why she was so preoccupied, regardless she appeared to not be that busy with anyone else. The atmosphere was really nice, food was good, it was the service that failed miserably.

Ordered the special steak, My special customer ate 25%- too rough. Tuna was over cooked. Bartender put tonic in a gin martini. Waiter was very casual and called us dude. For $140 before tip, I will bring my business elsewhere.

Very disappointing. No wonder it was 25% occupied.

We were looking for a restaurant to go to with my family while visiting Old Vegas in Freemont. Our friend brought us here, we didn't know what to expect. OMG best decision she made for all of us and I'm so thankful for that! I ordered the spicy pasta with shrimps and scallops...this is the best pasta I've ever had, it was so delicious, great portion and not over priced...I wish they had a location in Chicago.  My family ordered steaks, chicken and fish and chips and everything was delicious as well. Our waiter was friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable with the menu, too bad can't remember his name to give him 5 stars for his great customer service(I think his name was George). I highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to visit Vegas again.

Food was very good. We did chefs salad with New York strip steak. I request a booth with tv preferably its a better vibe versus no booth options. Bread and butter with olive oil and oregeno are great. Steak was served with mashed and veggies too many zuchinnies imo but what do i know. Service struggled per usual regardless food is always great.

I have been there several times for lunch and dinner. 

I prefer lunch because the outside seating is super nice right now. 

There is a farmer's market around the corner on Friday. Sometimes they have a special salad. You gotta try it. Fresh and yummy. 

Soup could be too salty - but you may ask them not to make it too salty when you order.

Steak that I usually order is delicious, a bit salty tho. 
Pasta is good as well - I would say its more refined than Cheesecake Factory. 

Seafood is outstanding. Highly recommend. Shrimp cocktail is awesome.

Overall, everything is good... Good with wine!

Before it gets chilly outside, you should try them out.

We went on a mission to try some food that wasn't whipped up inside a hotel or casino and someone in our group found Triple George on line or something. 

This little outpost is a block off of Fremont Street, in the DT3 construction zone behind the Fremont Hotel & Casino. I realize that doesn't sound appetizing and I was more than a little skeptical as we walked over.

All of those doubts were quickly jettisoned as soon as we walked inside. The decor has a really cool retro '30s feel to it. Classy, but not stuffy.

You won't see many tables when you walk in. That's because most of the seating is hidden behind private wood walls. You literally have your own booth tucked away out of the sight of everyone in the place. It's really, really, really cool.

Service was friendly and appropriate. I could tell that our server could very easily switch into her "formal" mode when necessary. With us, she was perfectly casual, yet professional. Nice.

Food? Dynamite. Truly. I was shocked at just how good everything was. Very simple, very fresh ingredients taken from local markets, according to the menu. Grilled asparagus and sautéed spinach sides were delicious. Lunchtime burgers were cooked to perfect doneness--well done for one friend, perfect medium for another.  Wedge salad was, again, simple but delicious, topped with bacon and blue cheese. The fish special rocked another friend's world real hard. I've rarely seen anyone get so excited over fish and wild rice, but Triple George managed to make that happen.

I've hit up a ton of restaurants in Las Vegas, but Triple George quickly joined my list of personal favorites.

Great, mid-level steakhouse. Truly scrumptious and consistent food. Sedate and business-like atmosphere at lunch, but turns into a more romantic and old world ambience at dinner. Try the steamed mussels, which are prepared in a most surprising and delectable sauce, which makes you feel that you are sitting by a hearth after a long day on the water in a French fishing village. The mashed potatoes are fulfilling, and the steak is tasty and well-prepared. It's a great meal, and a good pairing with a trip to the Mob Museum across the street. The omission of one star is for service, which is quite good, but not excellent. It feels like it's the kind of place where "everybody knows your name," but the wait staff and other Front of House are a bit standoffish and not warm, and not super professional. It is the ONLY aspect of the place that reveals it is a franchise chain. If they tweak that, it will BE PERFECT.
The service here was excellent! Exceeded my expectations! The martinis are delicious! And our waiter was the best! I can't wait to go back! The meat was tender and juicy the service is A+++

Spent $150 on dinner and because it was late (although it was never mentioned that it was closing time) the lights were turned on bright to hurry us out as soon as dessert and coffee were delivered... Kind of like a college bar at closing! The Caesar salad that was supposed to be romaine lettuce was iceberg, but the best part is that I said something and the server was quick to bring the "right" lettuce and brought out the exact same ICEBERG Caesar salad!! Did she think we were stupid?!! Apparently so... nothing more was said. Otherwise, food was good... Filet was a little tough, but not the worst ever and the baked potato was good... veggies were grey.

used to go for happy hour wings and beer.  one week, we ordered normally: several servings of wings/fries, drinks, apps.   Bill came and WHAT???   they had taken wings and apps off happy hour 50% pricing - they didn't tell us and the staff knew us!!!  

so, check and re-check (pun) prices before you order.

Everything we had was great. I had the marinated hanger steak and it was fantastic. I would not order anything else. I loved it. Steels we're cooked correctly and very flavorful. Sourdough bread was hot crunch and great with the butter. 

Don't order the fish and chips- greasy. Other than that, it was all good.

Although our server was very nice, the overall service was inadequate. The staff was not knowledgable about the food, and even after we had an issue and the server offered to get a manager, the manager never  came by. They comped the problem food but couldn't be bothered to stop in and ask what our issue was. Even though I am a local bringing in a guest. 
The drinks are good, ambiance was nice but overall I would not recommend it.

4.5 stars

Excellent downtown spot once you figure out where to park. Triple George is in an area of downtown Las Vegas which is a few blocks from a serious high crime area. I would say this part is "transitional" and lunch seemed fairly safe. 

Between three of us, we sampled the ahi salad, pot roast and burger. Everyone agreed the food here is excellent. Prices are reasonable and the ambiance is very nice.

This is definite must-try!

About the closest you can come to an old time saloon in Vegas. It's obvious why this place has been around so long. Gotta say that this time around, on a Saturday night, the service was a little spotty. We sat at the bar as usual and interacted with three different servers before the drinks were even delivered (one of which was wrong). Also, our end of the bar was empty so we requested that the TV channel be switched to a game other than that which was being shown. Our request was conveyed to the manager who listened and then rejoined the crowd of wait staff congregated outside the window to the kitchen. (No channel change)
In any case the food, when it arrived, as usual was top notch and servers were all pleasant. Comparatively speaking, Triple George offers good value for Vegas and, despite the hassle of dealing with downtown parking, should definitely be on your list if your in the Fremont street area. We're locals so we have a relatively good handle on the downtown dining scene and Saturday's experience was unusual so we will definitely be back.
Great service, great ambiance. Andrew did an awesome job taking care of us. The food was just as great but it was the lobster that has me wanting to come back. Must check out when in downtown LV.

I am going to split my review in several parts. First I would give the hostess when we first arrived no stars. She asked me several times what my name was and if I had a reservation. She finally gave us a table in the front near the door. When we asked for another table she said we could move to a booth in about 15 minutes. We waited almost an hour for the booth and in that time several other people came in and were given other tables in the restaurant.  

Once we got to our booth Brian our waiter was very attentive. I will give Brian five stars for his service for our entire meal. 

The price of the meal includes sides so a good value for what you get. 

I will gave the Chef one star.  There were four of us and we all ordered steaks. Only one out of the four meals was cooked correctly. One steak was ordered as medium, it was well done. My husbands steak was ordered as medium and it was medium rare. My steak was ordered as medium and I got rare.  I sent it back and when they brought it back it was only medium rare.  I told them to redo the whole meal. When they finally brought the new steak it was cooked perfectly. But everyone else had finished their meal so I just had them box it to eat later.

William the asst manager only charged us for two meals so at least they tried to make it right. I am not sure I will come again. Perhaps the regular chef was on vacation last night. Vegas offers many restaurants to choose from.

My husband and I make a point of going to the Triple George every time we're in Vegas. He ordered the ribeye this time, with veggies in place of potatoes. Perfection. I took a chance and ordered the cioppino. Divine. Special thank you to Andrew, our waiter.  

The only reason I rated this place at 4 stars is because it's next to a biker bar; not their fault.  Do call for reservations just to be sure you can be seated, it's popular with locals.

We went back again with friends last night. Friends are vegan. Justin gave them a vegan menu (practically amazing). BUT, I had the swordfish in beurre blanc sauce. It was one of the best fish dishes I have ever had (and I used to live in Maryland)!

This place was a pleasant surprise. I was visiting Las Vegas for a long weekend and was done with the Strip. I was chatting with a bartender who recommended this place. We took a cab from the Mandarin Oriental, thinking that downtown Las Vegas might be a refreshing change of pace. We were right. After wandering around Fremont Street, we made our way to Triple George. 

Whatever you do, sit at the bar. And hope that Marti is your bartender/server. She recommended a couple of delicious entrees on the menu, she made some perfect martinis, and her level of service was just the right balance between friendly/chatty and professional. 

It reminded me of the kind of place you'd find in old San Francisco. The food was second only to the hospitality.

This is a nice & solid steakhouse. A bit of old school charm and a bit of now. Prices are totally fair and you get more than most people can usually eat.

Ribeye- ***pepper crusted and good piece of rib eye.
#burrata & #heirloom tomato salad w watermelon- ***** stars of savory, creamy, sweetness with a drizzle of balsamic.
Cocktails are delicious and food vino. 
#triplegeorgegrill # lasvegas

Triple George Grill was an A-Ok place to dine, but price wise was great! Meat were cooked at the perfect temperature as requested, needed seasoning but that was fixable with some salt and pepper at the table.
Service was a little off. She was super nice and perky but she forgot a lot of our requests and had to remind her often.

I would come here again and try the happy hour instead as the drinks we had were pretty good! This place is pretty good when you're comparing it to the rest of downtown eateries around Fremont Street.

I had the chicken Alfredo and ordered my food to go so I didn't have the dine in experience. But the foods was really delicious I loved the chicken it was fried and then put on top of the Alfredo and I can honestly say it's some of the best Alfredo I've had.

This steakhouse is right  across the street from the Mob Museum & MGM Downtown Las Vegas Casino.
We liked the hamburgers steaks,and fries.
Abundance of Nice service people check in on you.
We liked this quiet end of Vegas.
Nice booths and tables.
Good bartender.
We could eat outdoors on a nice day.
Food was generally very good.
Decor was dated but plush.

I was not very impressed. My friend chose this place to eat before going out for her bachelorette party and we had a reservation but didn't get seat for over an hour. Yes, not all of our group showed up on time. I think at most they were 15 mins late but to be pushed an hour because of this doesn't make sense to me. Myself and my best friend got there first and checked in. We couldn't be seated so we went to the bar and grabbed a drink. The bartenders were really nice. More that one came over and asked how we were doing and what we were in town for, a star goes to you guys. We ended up getting seated a little after 8pm for our 7pm reservation. The waiter was really nice and got our next drink orders going. They put out some sourdough bread with soft butter with oil and vinegar. I liked that. We check out the menu and thought about what to order. The waiter went over the specials and I just went with a Cesar salad. The group also order crab cakes, spinach dip, and brushetta. I really liked the brushetta I just think it should have been cut. Otherwise the dinner took a while to come out but there was a lot of us. My salad was huge, another star. I actually counldn't finish it. My friend got steak but it was a little over cooked but tasted good. Something I also thought was weird was they didn't have redbull but a knockoff that I can't remember the name of. It tasted similar but just odd for the place. Our friends made a cake and they were nice enough to let us bring it, another star to that. Overall the best part was the bread, brushetta, and the cake my friend brought. I want to go back and order something different and hopefully my whole group will show up on time.

After a family outing at the Mob Museum we happened on Triple George for a late lunch, or was it an early dinner? It was a family day, so happy family is all that mattered. 

The food was great! The service was impeccable.
Everybody loved their food, including our 4yro nephew!
SUCCESS!!

Would love to go back for a romantic dinner for two!

I booked a reservation here for my boyfriends birthday at the last minute. Our reservation was at 9 but we didn't make it their until 9:50 due to confusion and an accident on the freeway. They still took us in and had a birthday dessert for him! Their New York strip was great according to him (he ordered it medium well) and our waitress was even better!!! Thank you for the outstanding service!!!

Triple George is where to go if you want a really good meal near Fremont Street. My server, Becky, was awesome. Friendly, engaging and came by just often enough to ask how dinner was. I opted for the petite filet mignon and a shrimp cocktail, both of which were great. As was the bread. 

Ambiance is great. I'd rate it $$ or $$$ depending on what you order, but it's definitely worth it. This is a place you can bring people to impress. Free WiFi, also, which was great because I had to work during dinner.
Started off rough but the manager Will made it worth our wild!! Thank you Will for go ting above and beyond!!! Top of the line customer service!!! Annndddddd Great FOOD!!!!!!

Was staying downtown and decided to take customers to Georges. Very good service, steaks are great (try the 16 oz Ribeye) and excellent variety of drinks.  Would say this is nice surprise for the price and service.  Price is medium range but great for the quality

Fully recommended.
Very good value...dinner for 3 with drinks and soup only $114. Love the location near Fremont and Grand Hotel. Beautiful room and good service.

Really great atmosphere--as soon as I walked in, I recognized the homage to Tadich Grill in San Francisco. Espresso martini pretty tasty, as was chicken and rice soup. Ceasar salad was average, but crab cake was delicious. My son tried the chicken pot pie and I heard no complaints. Would definitely return and try more of the menu.

We went here for dinner on our anniversary.  My husband had the filet and it was very tender and flavorful.  I had the crab stuffed shrimp.  They were very good.  Both came with delicious mashed potatoes and beautiful, colorful veggies.  The ambiance was very warm and romantic.

If you're going to order anything be sure to order the pot roast. It is absolutely to die for.All of the  food here is superb but the pot roast is exceptional.  Intensely flavored, melt-in-your-mouth tender and the gravy is soooo delicious.  I started with an order of raw oysters that were ice cold and as fresh as they could get.  There were 15 of us and we all enjoyed the food and drinks here.  Not a complaint among anyone.

Good lunch spot. One of the few places for catering to business folks and locals and doesn't have the slot machines at the bar. Food is good and it looks like their happy hour is good but I'm never in the area to try it.

We came here on a Sunday in July. They are across the street from the GRand, but are still considered to be a part of the hotel. They were having happy hour for their anniversary so that was an automatic score. We were greeted promptly when we sat at the bar. 
We ordered some wine and a  Moscow mule. We had to wait about 20 min for the ginger beer to get there since they were out. But we didn't mind the wait. 

They have a large extensive menu. It's Full of different cuts of expensive meats and seafood. However, what brought us to this hidden gem was the vegan/gluten free menu. We ordered the cauliflower rice and the roasted vegetable dish. It was awesome. The cauliflower rice was better than anything I've ever had anywhere else. So delicious. They do not offer vegan dessert, but my friend ordered the rumchata cake. He said it was really sweet, but it was good. 

Everything was decently priced and portions were large. The service was friendly and they offer a vegan menu with a limited, but decent selection. I'll definitely be back.

I have dined at Triple George several times and each and every time I go it seems to get a little better. They finally started taking reservations too! They serve very large portions at a great price and the service is very efficient yet friendly. It reminds me of alot of restaurants in the Bay Area which to me is a welcome relief from the Strip. Some of my favorites are the Porcini crusted Rib Chop and the Porterhouse. Unlike other steakhouses Triple George adds a vegetable and starch choice to their entree making it a great deal. If you are tired of getting gouged by the restaurants on the strip and the rude service that Las Vegas strip restaurants seem to give do yourself a favor and try triple George.

Came for lunch. Service was good. Food, ok. I had the pot roast and my husband had the lemon herb chicken. Both entrees came with mashed potatoes and some veggies. Mashed potatoes were ok. They had that grainy texture. The seasoned veggies were pretty good. The pot roast was a bit too salty for my taste. The chicken was a bit bland although very moist and tender. My husband took a few bites of his chicken and was done. He did however finish his vegetables. Service was very attentive and they promptly refilled glasses as soon as they got about half full. If we're ever here again we'd probably try different items.

This is a really friendly "neighborhood" bar. There were locals stopping in for Happy Hour. Good specials. We weren't all that hungry and split a salad and a steak. They weren't at all put out about splitting orders.  Highly recommended. Great value.

What a fine establishment to say the least.  If you know Tadich Grill in San Francisco since 1849 you know Triple George Grill.  The restaurant is just a half block from the Mob Museum just off Fremont Street.  Just follow the crowd to the place and enjoy.  As soon as you walk in to  Triple George Grill you know, somehow you know,  you are in for a real experience.  The menu was diverse including a great variety of menu items, sides and appetizers.  The fried chicken is one not frequently found in any restaurant - give it a try for sure.  It is so hard to recommend a single menu item.  What I suggest is to get there at 1100hrs for an early lunch, stay to drink, then in no time it's time for dinner.

Take the time to relax and enjoy a wonderful Manhattan cocktail.  A cocktail to sip, enjoy and take your time with your spouse or your friends.  We will definitely go again and again and again.

MANGA!!

I tried this place because of good reviews & was not disappointed.  Service was excellent & so was the Ribeye steak.  Side dishes were not very good...French onion soup tasted good, but was just luke warm and baked potato was way overdone. The Brussel sprouts & fresh warm bread were great.  Overall a good experience & we plan to go back again.

Yelpers were right, thanks again.  Total hidden gem off Fremont Street.  Our Server was Brenda and she was just as pleasant as a peach!  Very attentive to our drinks and service.  We both ordered the filet mignon and it melted in our mouths!  I also enjoyed the fresh veggies that came with it, they were not mushy and they were seasoned and flavored deliciously.

The place is set up really classy looking.  Old (well maintained) wood trim every where with black and white photos on the walls.  We aren't big drinkers, but I image this place being a great place to crack a bottle of wine.  It just had that "hang out, drink, eat great food with a great vibe" kinda feel to it.

American chow for the lover of steak and seafood! After getting a review from the Smith Center, I decided to stop by for a quick burger, but I ended up ordering a steak with a calamari appetizer. Both were delicious.  
The wait staff seems to work really hard at being friendly. Maybe they want their tips or something, but I think their attitude is a great asset for this Vegas spot.  
The prices are a little high, so bring a credit card if you can't afford the cash. I was pleased with my food though, so I'd say it is worth the money.

This place says they have vegan options . But their vegan options are not 100% vegan . I am allergic to eggs and when eaten it makes my colon bleed (colitis) . They are the only place I ate out yesterday I ordered a vegan burger and now I'm passing a lot of blood . There was probably negligence and they gave me a normal bun glazed with egg or something . Some people chose vegan as a lifestyle and others because of allergy it's a serious thing and should be treated as such . Very disappointed and hurting .

We really liked this restaurant.   My family meets up every year in memory of my Aunt and every year, it's challenging to get a restaurant that can handle a party with 10 or more people.   This place was great in getting in at the last minute.   Great service and really good food.  Everyone in my family loved their entrée especially my wife whom had the seared Ahi Tuna and she's very picky with any seafood.  I would recommend this place to anyone.  They even had a small live band on the patio after 6 pm Saturday.   The restaurant's ambience was rich with dark wood everywhere and the bar was beautiful.   You can make reservations through yelp so that made it easy.

some friends and i were strolling around fremont street and wondered off onto a side street and found triple george...
so- we went inside and to our surprise, there was a swanky bar for us to make it our happy hour before dinner drinks spot...
the drinks were good and old fashioned. it was comfortable and we stayed and talked about the old photos on the wall and how we should come back for dinner sometime and get one of those hidden wood booths to sit in...

i give it some stars for the drinks -minus the food...
i will come back again.

Wow talk about a hidden gem! This is my new favorite place! After heading out for a happy hour tour of downtown this was our first spot! We came during happy hour and it was pretty busy so we found seats at the bar. The inside of the restaurant is beautiful. It's crisp clean linens on the tables and romantic lighting. We began by ordering off of the happy hour menu which by the way the choices were all to die for. I started with the baked goat cheese,bruschetta and the chicken parm sliders. The cheese was a 10. The bruschetta was good but not mind blowing and the chicken park sliders (gtfo) so good! I really liked the ambience in here I felt like a regular the service was phenomenal the two bartenders were nice and suggested many things even though they were busy! I drank the revolution and it was tasty and pretty. Overall this is definitely worth trying when there isn't happy hour. I can't wait to come back!

My husband and I were in Downtown Las Vegas last week and I saw this place while out on a walk. It looked so cute that I decided to give it a try and I'm so glad we did. It was the best food I've had in Vegas, ever! And I've been going there for the past 20 years. The place has a classy feel to it and it is decorated in sort of an Old Hollywood style...Art Deco. It's beautiful inside and has a cute patio for outdoor dining as well. We were seated a spacious booth near the bar. The service was awesome. We started with the clam chowder soup and it was AMAZING!!!! WOW. My only regret was that I didn't find try this place on our first day of the trip. I would have loved to come back to have a bowl of soup for lunch. It was that good! We ordered a glass of the house cabarnet and a Moscow mule, both were great. For dinner, my hubby ordered the filet and I had the blackened salmon....WOW WOW and WOW. This was a nice treat and a wonderful night out with my husband.

Last night my party and I had reservations at Triple George.  We had a party of five.  They sat us in a booth made for four and put a chair at the end of the table.  It was too tight and awkward.  We asked for a manager.  Within a minute he was at our table.  We complained about the size of the group and the table we were sitting at.  He listened and offered to make sure we were at a table that we desired.  It was not another three minutes that he personally led us to a new table.  He was apologetic and really made sure we felt comfortable the rest of the night. Our food was good and we were out quickly ready to see a show.  We were very pleased how they quickly managed the issues and made sure the guests were happy.

Came here for a double date with friends this past Friday night. Our server was very sweet and funny! (He was flirting!) you got point! He suggested for me and my girl friend to try out there best seller Blackberry martini while we waited for our dates. The martini was so smooth you couldn't taste any alcohol :) I ordered the grilled vegetable plate (zucchini, mushroom, eggplant, asparagus and broccoli) oh soo good! Best vegan plate! I love the triple George! Try the chocolate indulgence cake for dessert you won't be let down!
Great atmosphere! Wonderful food at a great price! Cecelia, our waitress, was amazing!
Wow!  Love this place!  Very classy place. I happened to go there during their happy hour. The appetizers were delish!  I had goat cheese appetizer and beet salad appetizer for dinner.
Been here 4 times and every time has earned 5 stars. Since my first trip to TGG I make sure I visit anytime I come to Vegas. Great selection of wines and other liquor. Highly recommend the Pot roast.

We ate here last week and I'm still thinking about how good the steak was. The porcini encrusted ribeye was one of the best steaks I have ever had! The coating is slightly spice, which was a nice surprise and the steak was so tender, I could cut it with a spoon. I will have to come back next time in Vegas.

Excellent food slightly off strip. 

Price was great for the huge portions. My wife has he chicken pot pie 

I had a steak and it was good for the price.

We had the molten lava cake where was delicious and rich.

Great service

Highly recommend better than most of he strip places for the price
Service is good, very friendly and good food who could want more nagar it was very good.

Our group ordered 5 dishes of steaks. Took one and a half hour to cook and turned out all of them over cooked. Very disappointed. Manager offered $75 off our $300 bill. Seriously?!?!?  This would be our last visit at this restaurant. Bye for good.

OOOkay......
Play by play. Waitress  (where am I... Who am I... I'm a butterfly... Yay )
Food:
A slice of tomato and a slice of cheese called a Caprese salad.
Sandy scallops, oh on the big sceen was Home Shopping Network...! 
WOW What disappointment.

We dropped in on Halloween night after spending the day at SEMA. It was early. 5:30p or so. We sat outside and except for a couple rowdy drunk types at the biker bar next door, it was quiet and pleasant. I had a petit filet which was very good. Our cocktails were good too. Service was great also. When we come back to Vegas, we will certainly put Triple George on our good places to eat.

This is my second visit to Triple George Grill, my first meal ( a 6oz fillet minion) was average and accompanied with two stalls of very over cooked and crispy broccoli. My husbands steak was very good and flavorful, so I wrote my experience off to bad luck. Last night we were back (7 days after the first visit), I ordered a light meal of Shrimp Bisque, Beef Wellington and a Caesar salad. The cup of bisque ($9) was flavorless and required a fair bit of salt and pepper to make it edible. The Beef Wellington ($13.) was a 4x4 square of pastry, filled with chopped beef, pearl onions and runny tasteless gravy. This was a Cornish Pastie ( a poor one at that) not Beef Wellington, I was unable to eat it, and was bitterly disappointed. The side Caesar salad ($9), was saturated in dressing and cheese, overpowering the small quantity of lettuce on the plate, again I could not finish the salad. Finally I ordered a double vodka & soda which came is a short highball glass, the final insult to injury was to discover the double drink cost $20.00! 
Regrettably though I enjoyed the venue and location of this restaurant, I will not be returning, it is overpriced and has poor quality control.

What's not to like about this downtown Las Vegas dining/pub?  I'll admit it is one of my favorites for drinks after work.  The crew is very personal and their hospitality just oozes with being your best friend.  Guess that is why I keep returning!

Todd and Jerry both can entertain and ensure you always have a full drink.

The restaurant always has some incredible steaks well prepared and fresh seafood....always check out the daily specials.

It might seem difficult to get too off the many one-way streets downtown, but off 3rd and look for the valet sign and once you drop off your keys, you are just steps away from a memorable evening.

We had a group of 6 and we made a reservation online as we were driving to the restaurant. We had to wait a little while for the table, however, so we sat at the bar and ordered drinks! The bartender was amazing! She was making drinks and taking complicated orders at the same time! She also talked me into a completely different drink than what I ordered because she thought it might be too sweet for me. She was right! I loved the drink she suggested, it was a martini of some sort.

Once we sat down, the great service continued! The food was really amazing as well. We got an order of baked goat cheese marinara for the table. This was by far my favorite dish of the evening. I ordered the shrimp cocktail appetizer as part of my meal. It was good. The shrimp was nice and cold and the cocktail sauce was tasty. I also ordered a cup of the soup of the day, which was a vegetable beef soup. It was also tasty, with big chunks of beef.

We came here on a recommendation from a friend, and WOW!!! My first thought was way too many waitstaff/ bartenders/ hosts, but then I got it, I really got it! Someone was always there to say hi, get a drink, fill water, clear a plate, take an order. And not in an obnoxious get out of here way but in a we want you to have everything you need to enjoy yourself. Each person we dealt with had a sense of humor, was courteous and was very knowledgeable on their food & wine. Being the foodies we are, we kept sitting by the kitchen to really watch the entire scene. Let me tell you something, these owners and management have truly invested in all of their staff. The executive chef was expediting from the back of the house to an expediter on the front of the house. It was truly amazing to watch such professionalism through out the experience. Being in the Bay area, this restaurant could easily take on the upper echelon here.  We loved it so much, we were there three nights in a row! Cannot wait to go back!

The night I want to review is our first night there. The three of us each ordered a martini style cocktail - lemon drop, cosmo, vodka martini. Each was made so well, the glass was cold and ice chips were at the top. 

We started with baked goat cheese marinara and oysters on the half shell. The baked goat cheese was excellent. The sauce was not at all overbearing- slight kick, good flavor of garlic and tomato, olive oil, the accompanying bread was fresh and warm. The goat cheese had a nice mild flavor to it, finishing off the dish very well. The oysters - wow - so fresh! I like smaller ones. These were closer to medium but very, very fresh and flavorful! They came with a house made vinaigrette which really accented the flavor.

For our entrees, I went to the dark side. I say that because I stay away from typical gamey meats in any restaurant. Well I chose this coq au vin creation with duck, lamb and beef (we were there a few months ago, so the memory is not quite there). This dish was absolutely amazing! All the meats were so tender, falling of the bones and melting in your mouth. The sauce was not at all too rich or heavy, coating the meat & veggies. The veggies were roasted to perfection.

One friend had the petrale sole. OK, this was huge! It was lightly battered, pan fried and all kinds of delicious! It was covered with a lemon butter sauce, not creamy at all just perfect. 

Another friend had porcini crusted rib eye. This was a huge cut of meat, grilled to perfection at medium rare. The steak was so tender, it too melted in your mouth. The porcini crust was an excellent compliment to the flavor of the rib eye. 

Triple George had an extensive wine list which was paired excellently to each of our dishes by the staff.

Everyone was beyond professional, completely exceeding any of our expectations!

We went in our lunch was payed for.  The person who payed for our lunch left.  We were then told by the server and manager that they had over charged the card and needed one of the other guests to pay for the bill.  I would think at a restaurant like this, you would have better service.  We were not even given a discount or told we would be taken care of the next time we came in.  The manager gave us a card and said call me if there is a problem with the transaction.  I'll never eat here again.

i stopped in for dinner last night, and had the fanney bay oysters as an appetizer.  they were tasty but there was some shell in the shucked little guys :(
followed by the house special crab stuffed shrimp- these had  the perfect amount of breadcrumbs sprinkled on top for texture.  
an easy walk from the golden nuggett.
We went here for my birthday dinner. It was quiet and very nice. I ordered the fried chicken and it was delicious. I'd recommend this to friends.

I like that this restaurant is close to where I was staying on Fremont St.  My friend and I came here for a late dinner, so the restaurant was mostly empty.  There is more privacy at this restaurant, as each table was partitioned from the other tables with wood panels.  I like that.  Funny thing, though is that some guy stopped at our table by accident and was surprised that it's not his. Then a few minutes later, another guy did the same thing.  Guess it's hard to tell which is your table when you can't see the people sitting there.  

For appetizers, we had the seared ahi and crab cakes. I thought both dishes were very tasty. The ahi was topped with what tastes like horseradish. I thought that was an excellent seasoning.  The vegetables that came with it were delicious!  It was perfectly flavored, as opposed to the typical steamed and bland veggies of other places.  The crab cake was good, but nothing spectacular.  I had the vegan burger as the main course. It was, at best, just average. The burger consisted of a veggie pattie and arugula, nothing else. Now, I'm usually ok with arugula, but this time, there was a smell to it that I didn't like, so it was hard for me to finish it. I tried to mask the smell with catsup, but it didn't work out too well.  I should have probably known better than to order a burger at a steak and seafood place. 

Our waitress was something else. She's originally from San Diego, and boy, is she ever the horrible actress!  Her overly excited voice and exaggerated acting were quite entertaining as she rattled off the specials of the day. I think she lost me right when she started talking. I was distracted by her expression and overacting.  She seems to enjoy her job.  

Overall, I thought the appetizers were good, but the vegan burger, you can skip.  The waitress was entertaining, but I think I can only handle her in smaller doses.

If you expect to have a hot meal prepared well do not go here. The manager is disrespectful and will not care.  We ordered a new York strip with pepper corn sauce and it came with a mushroom sauce. I being allergic to mushrooms the manager did not care defended his so called pepper corn sauce. Then the food served to the table was cold. Manager again said did you tell server that would have been a good thing to do if she had come back to the table before we complained. And please don't make a reservation cause they will charge for the people that did not show up. So I would say this would not be a place to go if you want a good hot meal and service that cares.

We came here for a nice steak dinner. We were not disappointed. Sat at the bar and our server was Marti, she's excellent. Also, top marks for the manager, Jerry. 

Food was outstanding, service was excellent, we will be back!
Great place to eat just off Fremont Experience.  Fantastic selection.  Monique,  our server, went out of her way to take care of us even though it was a busy night.

my friend had her wedding dinner here , we all got to pick what we wanted from the menu i was so excited for that i got the petite filet  it was good, 

this place is downtown seemed to be a good area where u can walke from place to place which is awesome not  needing a taxi in this town ,this place seemed a bit old but it had a good feel ,the service was great !

everyone seemed to like there food i would def go back !!

Love this place! Have been here a few times and it keeps getting better.  The filet melted in my mouth.  The service was extraordinary and the ambience was that of an old time mob hangout.  The secluded booth gave us a quiet, romantic dinner.  Never disappointed, we will be back!

Omg!!! The food was AMAZING!!!! We found it on Yelp, read review and so so so so glad we went. The food was delicious! I had the filet and French onion soup. Both great!!! Friends had the Ahi and chicken. 

We woke up the next morning talking how good it was!

Wow! This steakhouse was absolutely outstanding!!! We had a party of 6 and it didn't seem to hinder our wait time or our experience! We had filets with béarnaise sauce (the sauce had a little kick to it) , porterhouse steak, chop salad, T-bone steak, creme brûlée, and chocolate lava cake. 
All of it was so good and the steaks were cooked exactly how they were ordered. 

The ambiance was open yet shockingly quiet with a true steakhouse feel. Some areas even had more private seating with TV's in the booth which I thought was a cool touch. One thing about the menu that confused us is that we were lead to believe that the entree's didn't come with anything. They in fact came with a side of veggies and mashed potatoes but none of us saw that indicated on the menu.

We also all had a slew of cocktails ranging from wine, beer, and mixed drinks. Everyone was very complementary of every item they ordered. We will definitely come back!
Had a great ribeye tonight. Becky took wonderful care of us and we were very happy with our experience. Thank you.

This place was amazing!!!   Thank you to all the Yelp reviewers who pointed us here!  My husband and I ordered the blackened ahi tuna and the 9 oz filet and split them so we each had surf and turf.   The tuna was the best we ever had, and the filet was awesome!   Both meals came with our choice of starch and a vegetable.   The sides were great a well!  Our server, Brian, was a great balance of friendly and professional.  Overall, an amazing nice meal out for a better price than many other steak houses in the area.

Craving a nice steak dinner for Thanksgiving with a coworker, we decided on coming back to triple George, it's been a while since we've been here.

We had made reservations and were promptly seated and shortly after met up with our waiter, Ryan.

Nice guy, drinks were ordered and arrived quickly. They had a special Thanksgiving menu which my coworker ordered from, I chose the regular menu and I noticed some changes.

The steaks looked appealing but the side choices to order from looked dismal. 

The choices were roasted asparagus, or mixed mushrooms, French fries etc., I was hoping for something a little along the lines of Mac n cheese, or a "gratin" of some sort, maybe grilled veggies...

I ended up ordering two appetizers as my "sides" instead, the spinach & artichoke dip is really good, served with toasts.

I also would recommend the short rib ravioli, delicious!

My rib eye arrived perfectly rare and seasoned, the carrot and broccoli, unfortunately was a bit cold, I only ate the carrots, and the fries were just fries.

My coworker like her prime rib and deviled eggs. Apple pie was good too.

The customer service here is very good, everyone was friendly and pleasant. 

I did show the hostess my Triple George 15% discount from their Yelp page and asked if I could use it, she said "no".

In customer service, you should never use the word "No." especially since it's their own promo and there are no restrictions.

Overall, it didn't ruin my holiday, I had a pleasant time. 

I live in downtown Fremont and I often will suggest a couple of other steak houses first.

Let's see if I return here and their "Good" service becomes "Excellent" then, I can add them to my list of recommended steak houses to others.

:)

This place is a hidden gem off of Freemont St, I highly recommend it.  Great food (try the veal scaloppini or delicious  steaks), great atmosphere, great service, and GREAT VALUE.  Where else can three horses get a awesome steak, hot bread, salad, potatoes, veggies, and drinks for $103...Christ the higher end steakhouses want $103 just for apps and a bottle of wine...can't beat the value...must try at least once, you won't be disappointed, I ate there twice during my last four day stay at "The Nug"  Love it and will come back again.

As usual, I turned to the best source for restaurant vetting and it felt as if we won the jackpot after the previous night's losses.. Most of the options on Fremont St. felt boring ('old' diners and restaurants) but this place felt authentic and laid back.

We were surprised of the somewhat upscale feeling in this restaurant. Not necessarily the upscale where you need to dress up, but just in terms of cleanliness and politeness that is sometimes rare experience in Vegas due to the tourism that comes in and trash everything and leave with no remorse. 

Once seated in a secluded area, the hostess took our drink orders and off we were...
Before anything, a basket of warm bread and butter was offered. 

We started with the Calamari, which was excellent.
We also ordered:
- Pot Roast
- George's Club
- Atlantic Salmon
- Chicken Christoper

Every single item was delicious, and we decided to make Triple George Grill a must-stop every time we come back to Vegas. 

Winner winner, Triple G dinner.

I love this place. The last two times my husband and I were in Vegas, we stayed in the Downtown area. A good friend working on the strip recommended this restaurant. A block away from the Fremont Street Experience, you get away from the crowds to enjoy great food, atmosphere and fun. 

The first time we went in August, the managers noticed we were new and introduced themselves. I was under the impression the restaurant itself was new as this is a tactic you see when new places open. Not the case here. Triple George has been around awhile and the managers always try to notice who walks in the door! 

As self-proclaimed fanatics and my own twenty plus years in the biz, we love sitting near the kitchen to get the feel of the place, see the flow, enjoy the way the restaurant and staff make the flow happen for all the guests. I was certainly NOT disappointed. From our vantage point, we could see into the kitchen, around the large bar/ lounger area and into the dining area. We were treated to an entire evening of attentive service, excellent cocktails, fabulous food, near perfect timing, and the joy of watching truly seasoned staff in their element of harmony & flow through out. 

We started off the evening with martinis - shaken to the point of the ice chips floating on top and made to our specs - barely a hint of vermouth and for me the slightest bit dirty. Not being a huge martini drinker, this was very good and very well done. We chose the goat cheese/ marinara appetizer. This was very tasty and the accompanied bread was toasted nicely. The only complaint on this I would have is it is really too big for just two people. The goat cheese was warmed just enough to spread onto the bread. We could have had this as our dinner. Each of us had salads. Being a bay area organics snob, I am always leery of the freshness of produce in other parts of the country. Here I was not disappointed. Each salad - iceberg wedge and Cesar, were fresh and crisp, definitely not day old produce here! Bacon bits on the iceberg wedge were not processed but made in house as was the blue cheese dressing - not heavy creamy, but complimented the blue cheese in the dressing. The dressing for the cesar was also fresh made in house - not overly salty as I find many to be. 

The main dishes were great - rack of lamb and the special of the evening. I cannot remember the exact name of the special from back in August. If I do I will certainly update. The temperature on the rack of lamb was perfect - medium rare. The cut was definitely high quality as the flavor was excellent with no gamieness to it at all. The accompanying potato and vegetables were very tasty and not over seasoned at all. The special of the evening was a stew of three meats - lamb shank, beef, and pork. The stew was a coq au vin style with onions, carrots, potatoes and mushrooms in a dark wine sauce/ stew. The meats fell off the bones and were so tender and delicious! Again, huge portions of food but very tasty.

I will always make it a point to go to this place when we are in Vegas!
Awesome staff and great steaks. The atmosphere is wonderful and I like the bar. Prices are very reasonable.
Our experience at Tripple Georges was amazing from the hostess, wait staff to the food! Can not say enough about our dinner, highly recommend this restaurant.

Me and the boyfriend celebrated a late Valentines day dinner here. We made reservations for Saturday at 6pm and arrived a bit early and was promptly seated as soon as we walked in. The hostess wasn't very friendly and took her awhile to find my name on the reservations chart. I figured it was busy and she was probably having a bad day so I let it fly.....  

We got seated in the back away from the bar, it was very quiet and dark and they had about 3-4 flat screen TV's playing on a large brick wall. Our waiter came over quickly and took our drink orders and he was very professional and gave us a great description of their specials that night. We had already looked at the menu beforehand so we put in our order right away. Our drinks came fast and prompt and we were given a basket of complimentary sourdough bread. It was DELICIOUS! nice and warm and crunchy....so far, so good.  I was really digging the atmosphere, I thought it would be loud and rowdy being that we were seated so close to the Hogs & Heffers bar right next door, but surprisingly it was quite romantic.

We ordered house salad's to start, they were fantastic. I am kind of a salad snob and was very pleased. I loved that they served it with a thin sliced cucumber instead of thick round pieces, the croutons were delish and the ranch dressing was very very good. I almost licked the plate LOL!

Soon after we got our main entree's,  I decided to try the Seafood Cioppino and it was amazing!  you def. get what you pay for with this dish, it was huge. The seafood was very fresh (shrimp and scallops were my fave) and the tomato broth was great and went well with the baguette they serve it with. I was very pleased!  My boyfriend decided to get the Ribeye medium well. He said it was really good and came with smashed butter potatoes and vegetables. He said the smashed potatoes were the best he ever had!   We finished off the night with a slice of cheesecake with raspberry fruit topping and boy was it worth it.  I am so glad we decided to come here and cannot wait to go back and try all the other delectable items on the menu!  Triple George Grill you ROCK!  =)

Excellent!!! In each and every way: food, ambiance and service. Everything is great. Don't miss it. You're going to feel great in your secluded boot, pampered enjoying delicious food. It deserves more stars, it's underrated.

Celebrated my 30th birthday early with my bff. We choose Calamari for our appetizer and it was delicious. 

For dinner he had the filet mignon and I had the INCREDIBLE Crab Stuffed Shrimp. I am not a fan of zucchini in any form, but paired with the Shrimp and Rice Pilaf...I enjoyed every ounce of my dinner, chewing slowly to savor the flavors. 

The real champion at Triple George was Becky our beautiful server. She suggested Creme Brulee for dessert and upon learning about my birthday, added a "Birthday Flare" to my decadent dessert and suggested the house red to pair with it. 

Best dining experience I've have since moving here. A new Vegas favorite.

I've eaten here three times now and I have to say it is one of the best restaurants.  The food is top notch.  I've had the Pot Roast and the Grilled Chicken Cobb Salad and both were great, and good sized portions.  And the servers are all very good, very nice, and very attentive.  With all of the high-priced quality restaurants here in Vegas, Triple George Grill is definitely as good as it gets for the price.  Highly recommended.

With menus closed and at the side of the table, empty water glasses also in plain sight, and two hungry and eager new patrons trying to waive a waiter or waitress down to pay attention to us, we decided to get up and speak to someone about the 30 minutes we had just waited without someone even taking our drink order.  Sure, Vegas was busy this last weekend but hey - they had a table for us in less than 5 minutes since we called ahead. It's too bad we only got the table and no service. The food smelled incredible but we were never given the opportunity to even place an order. The Ass't General Manager had someone seat us and after we complained, he offered to pay for a meal for us but since we had tried to waive down service for awhile and received blank stares and snubbed looks, we were not in the mood to be treated like 2nd class any longer. Instead, my partner and I went across to Fremont Hotel to their steakhouse and spent $120 there.  It was DELICIOUS and the service was impeccable. Hey, I tried giving my money to the "little guy" and even used Yelp to find George's too...

I went to Triple George Grill last night with a bachelor party and it proved to be a great idea!

We had a reservation for 8PM for 10 people and we definitely arrived late with 12 people as opposed to 10. The restaurant was extremely accommodating and had us seated within five minutes.

The servers were quick to get both our drink and food orders. I had a Shirley Temple to drink that seemed to be more grenadine than Sprite, but that's alright! Besides, how many people order Shirley Temples that are over the age of 12 beside me anyway?

I ended up having the Ribeye ($34), which came with a choice of rice pilaf or mashed potatoes as well as a medley of vegetables, which were string beans and carrots. I asked the server if I could swap out the vegetables for mashed potatoes so I could have both rice and potatoes, but she said I would have to order it as a side and it'd be extra. 

The flavor of the steak was VERY good. The menu says it's topped with garlic herb butter, but I didn't really taste it. Without any sort of sauce or rub at all, I thought the flavor was great. 

The special of the evening was also a ribeye that had some sort of cajun-looking rub on it as well as a bleu-cheese sauce. Minus the sauce, it looked pretty darn good.

Looking around the table at what everybody ordered, I definitely have a lot to try in future visits. The chicken parmesan looked excellent, as well as the burger.

Our total bill for the 12 of us came out to roughly $450, which wasn't too bad considering this was a nicer place.

Definitely a great place for groups, and probably for dates too. The atmosphere is a little dark, very old-school Vegas...my kind of place! Will be back in the future for sure :)
Awesome dinner and drinks. Steak was cooked to perfection, veggies, and service was especially good considering the large crowd.

The blackened swordfish of the day was cooked perfectly but the chef drowned it in pepper, which was unfortunate because otherwise this fish would have been delicious. The squash soup (also a special of the day) tasted like it came from a can. The service here is very good but the food just doesn't add up.

Great ambiance, lousy food. I am not one to trash a place and for the record have had several good lunch experiences here. But frankly skip the idea of dinner based on our dinner last night (pre-Hamilton show). 

First off we ordered a glass of Malbec. Never have sent a wine back before but this one was really off. Never saw the bottle but either it was a cheap version or just wrong.

Given that start, we didn't want to compound the situation by sending dinner back but should have. Asked if Ahi Tuna was high quality. Waiter said absolutely. Foolishly believed her and asked for very rare. The entree both smelled and tasted fishy which is usually not the case with good quality. Worse, it tasted terrible and looked like it had freezer burn around the edges.

Maybe shame on me for ordering fish at a Vegas grill, but if you don't buy quality don't sell it. We won't be back for dinner again, way too many better choices downtown.

This is one of the top restaurants in Las Vegas. It's near the older downtown area and the best value in comparison to the well known top restaurants on the strip. This is the 2nd time I have visited the restaurant.  One block off the old strip. A must go to place. Every dish we have had is excellent. The fillet is to die for.

Yelp continues to do me no wrong.  Reservation made online and then changed time online with no problems. 

We arrived 10 minutes early for our Friday night reservation and we walked right in, no waiting. 

The restaurant has outdoor seating and is located between Freemont Street Experience and The Mob Museum.  Located next to Hoggs & Heffers,  so keep that in mind before sitting outside. 

Old school, rustic vibe which we loved. We sat in the main dinner room by William the host and our waiter was Brian. Not overly busy for a Friday night and I am not sure why because the food was out of this world and the prices were extremely fair for the dining experience at this restaurant.  I am guessing it is the location,  but this place on the strip and they would be a high dining establishment.  Casual attire, or feel free to dress up either way you are fine.

Goat cheese in marinara sauce was very tasty,  nice size portion and fairly priced. The drinks were very reasonable with plenty of alcohol in rum and coke I ordered.  The wine we also ordered was very cold and again a perfect size and price.

The 16oz NY Strip was out of this world,  one of the best I have had. Very fairly price for quality of meat and portion.  I compare it to something you would find in a high end steak house.

The stuff shrimp with crab meat was also fantastic,  nice size portion. 

When back in Vegas this will be a place we visit again

Hidden away amongst the scary gene pool of downtown Las Vegas lies a true restaurant gem.
This place makes you feel like you have stepped back in time to another era - The Golden Age of Vegas where women were classy and provocative but not trashy; men smoked cigars and Frank Sinatra was always crooning in the background.
It just has that classic; old school feel about it -not unlike the Tadich Grill in San Francisco -and the decor is in keeping with this i.e obligatory piano; large, wooden booths line the walls and the wait staff are dressed appropriately.
The menu as you would expect at a grill is largely meat and fish based and very classic. Everything we ordered was exceptionally good from the sublime Lobster Bisque to the outstanding Wedge Salad. Heck even the mashed potatoes were amazing.  
I really love this place and cant wait to come back.

Enjoyed dinner.. The Bread and butter was good, they drizzle some balsamic and something else onto the butter. We liked the goat cheese appetizer and French onion soup was very good and super cheesy.

My party liked the Hangar steak, juicy and came with a "pepper marmalade" which seemed like onion strings marinated in something yummy; rib eye; hamburger was pretty huge and juicy.

Iced tea came with ice tea Ice cubes so it wouldn't get watered down. 

One thing that we noticed sitting out on the front patio...Was nice and the weather was great but the biker bar next door was a little too loud at times and made the ambience a little distracting and noisy.
Great food! Fast Service. Accommodates 14 people on a short notice.

Wasted $240.  My daughter and I had chicken Christopher it was mediocre. My hubby had something with shrimp( it was recommended by our waitress) my mom got fish and chips, son- some type of Italian style chicken. Our cousins got salmon and another dish. We were seated outside and it was chilly so we asked for a heater...our cousins had a show to go to and when we sat down the waitress assured us that we'd be done in an hour so they wouldn't be late. We didn't see our waitress for about 30 minutes I asked the hostess where the heater and salads were. She said they were plating our dishes now. I looked around the inside was fairly empty. I had to ask about 15 minutes later because they only had 20 minutes to get their plate eat and get to the show. Finally our food came and it looked nice. My potatoes tasted like instant potatoes. The veggies were good, and my lemon chicken was cooked well but under seasoned. My hubby hated his dish. Not a single person at our table said their food was good. It's not terrible but definitely not worth the cost. I'd prefer to go to claim jumper or Brio...hell even Church's Chicken is better than here. On a scale of 1-10...
Ambiance- 4
Service-1
Food-4
Price-2

Lovely atmosphere with dark wood and old pictures a U-shaped bar and priviate dining booths.  Service was excellent and the lounge (not open at lunch) looked very interesting.  We were sorry we hadn't come later in the day for cocktails instead of stopping in for lunch.  

The food was totally mediocer.  Our group had oysters on the half shell (boring), crispy chicken salad (large and nicely done), reuben sandwiches (OK) and baked cod that was actually breaded, fried and tasteless with mashed potates (cold) and a broccoli/zucchini medley that was ok.  Bloody Mary cocktail was spicy -- too much so to be enjoyed.  High-moderate prices for just ok food.

We'll try them for cocktails only next trip.

Great food at a reasonable cost. Be sure to try the chicken Christopher! Our server was so attentive and helpful. I had a shit meal on the strip for twice the price. I'm glad I found this little place.
Back again oyster were super yummy Andrew was amazing wine was tasty and we got the special can't wait to try it love this place

I came here with a group of co-workers during a recent trip to Vegas for a sales meeting. This place was picked by our manager. I read some reviews before we got there and was expecting a great experience, but I definitely left disappointed.

I will start by saying that the service was excellent, and they were very accommodating for our large group. Everything about the food was very average. We ordered quite a selection of the appetizers and nothing really stood out for me. The best part may have been the garlic bread that came with goat cheese marinara.

I ordered the NY strip rare and it came out medium. It was a very disappointing piece of meat. No one else in the group was impressed with their meals, although the one person who got the porcini-crusted ribeye seemed very happy.

I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. It's Vegas, and there are many other restaurants that are way better.
Great dinner and service. Memorable. The creme brûlée should be illegal, it was that good. Thanks, Andrew!

Like I've talked about in past reviews service can make or break an experience for me. I have been dying to try this steakhouse out and i chose to celebrate my birthday here. We dined January 27th (party of 12) at 7pm. We never got our waiters name and considering we only saw him twice through our rushed 1.5 hour dinner, we didn't get a chance to even ask.

Upon arrival we were a tad early so Andy and i grabbed a seat at the bar and ordered a few glasses of wine. The experience we had at the bar was our first red flag. The bartenders were all running around like chickens with their heads cut off. Given it was pretty busy but if you're a high volume bartender it shouldn't have been so difficult to handle. The older woman who greeted us about 10 minutes after we sat took our drink order and came back to slam down the wines and quickly ran off. 

We were pretty annoyed with the nature of this so we went next door to Hogs to grab a drink while waiting for our party. Once everyone arrived we were seated. About 15 minutes after seating we flagged down a bus boy and asked him if we could get our waiter. another 10 minutes went by and he finally showed up. He took our orders and quickly ran off. we sat there without drinks until our food came. When we reminded him of our drink order he disappeared (again) Our drinks came out when we were finishing up our food.

Andy and i shared the crab, lobster and truffle fries. The truffle fries never made it to the table to we just enjoyed the crab and lobster which were both phenomenal. 

I really wanted to like this place. I cant even begin to say how excited I was to dine here and celebrate my birthday. What a waste.

My bf & I have been coming here for years. We're not locals but we always stop in because Marty (bartender) is absolutely phenomenal!  Yeah, she's a great drink slinger but more importantly she's a great person. Months will pass & I'll randomly walk in & she remembers my name & picks up our conversation as if I just came back from the bathroom,  lol. 
The food is flawless & ambiance is chill & classy. 
Happy hour is fantastic too!

We've gone to Vegas several times per year and never noticed TGG. To be frank we never really have gone down towards the Mob museum, where this is close by. Since we've been on diets, we decided to make an early reservation around 5:30 pm. We were politely greeted and taken to our table without a wait. What a nice looking and well setup establishment. The bar was located in the center of the room upon entering. We were seated in a nicely built and well though of cubicle towards the back the restaurant. It was like we had the place to ourselves with the privacy. Our waitress was a very tall young lady, she was the best. She was polite, helpful, informative, efficient and on and on. I can't say enough about her customer skills, (I'm sorry that I forgot her name). My girlfriend chose 9 oz. Filet Mignon with a medley of carrots and broccolini at 35.00. The chef cooked it to perfection of medium and it melted in our mouths. We tend to share our selections, as she always claims to make the best selection of meat. I had the special of the day 12 oz. Steak with a lobster tail and vegetables. I think that mine was the to die for selection of the day, be agreed to disagree. My drink selection was a Tequila Maria. This was the only flaw of the dinner as it was to spicy for my taste. We ate on a Tuesday evening, and it was just a perfect dinner for two. I will for sure visit Triple George Grill again.

What a charming place off of Freemont!! I was pleasantly surprised. The decor is charming and didn't have the Freemont Vegas vibe. 

Make a reservation as this place fills up fast. Not a good place for kids, but perfect for a work meeting or date night.

I enjoyed a tasty drink... The Venetian (I think that was the name).  Prosecco, St Germain and a hibiscus leaf. It was heaven!! And the edible flower was a fun treat!! 

Our table ordered salads to start. The blue cheese was light and delicious. We ordered steaks, fish, chicken and mushroom ravioli. Pleasing a party of 9 is a difficult feat and they did just that. It wasn't the best food we've had in Vegas, but it was good.

We finished our meal with a trio of desserts... Creme Brûlée, Chocolate cake, carrot cake... They were all good but the table favorites were the creme brûlée and carrot cake. 

I'll for sure visit this place again. It's a bit more expensive than I'd like (Drink $14, dinner $20-30) but I'll come back.

So you are in downtown Vegas, you have no desire to hit the Strip, you may have just hit the tables and worked up an appetite.
I found myself in this state of mind and arrived at Triple George with my buddy Omar (from Seattle). 
We sat outside on a beautiful spring evening and started to attack the menu with some appetizers. 
The fresh oysters were remarkably fresh: one almost thought that one was Oceanside.
The shrimp cocktail was delicious especially the sauce that accompanied it. 
And the mushrooms au poivre left you longing for more. 
Now to the main course. 
The chicken pot pie was huge but also with huge flavors. My buddy didn't think he could finish it, but finish he did. It was that good. 
I opted for a Caesar Salad with a cup of bisque. A superb combo. 
All this topped off with Davidoffs slowly releasing the smoke in a beautiful evening breeze. 
Last but not the least: superb service.

Took my impossible to please friend(s) here. The raving was off the charts. I got my usual NY Steak. It was well-seasoned and cooked perfectly. The squash was sneaky good. One friend got a filet. He was so moved by quality he had to reverse course on his drink and get some wine. Another friend said the pot roast was the best he's ever had. This jabroni can eat and is picky, picky, picky. He bellowed "I'm really happy with this." Quite an accomplishment because he was in a sour mood after drafting two kickers in fantasy football earlier in the day. Thank you TG. It's NOT easy to please a big crew from out of town. You nailed it

Two stars for food only. Environment and employees were rude. It was my 78th birthday and we have been to all the steak houses downtown. I read about Triple George on yelp and how beautiful it was. Well, it is but they sat us in the bar where it was loud and no atmosphere. The hostess made a face when I asked if there was a better table. While we were waiting for our dinner I peeked in the main dining room and it was beautiful. The manager came by and asked how we are doing. I asked him why we can't sit in the dining room because it was my bday and I wanted it to be a special evening. He said we only serve large parties in there  on Sunday nights. If it was my business I would make this elderly couple happy and give them a damn table in the dining room. Oh well, next night we went to Second Street Grille and sat in their beautiful dining room. We live in Henderson and visit downtown often but it won't be Triple George.

Triple George Grill was professional, personal and the perfect choice for our rehearsal dinner. We had a specific menu in mind and even had a taste testing prior to the event. Our guests complimented all night on how delicious and fresh the food was. Ne-Tosha was always quick to respond to my e-mails which made planning stress free. As a bride with a lot to worry about, I didn't have to worry about them delivering. Highly recommend to others!

For a weeknight, the restaurant was fairly busy, but we were seated quickly. The atmosphere is great, and the drinks were good. We ordered the goat cheese appetizer, calamari, and french fries. The calamari was chewy and overcooked, the sauces were just standard marinara and didn't taste homemade, and the goat cheese was average. The highlight was the french fries.
