I'd recommend trying this place for the portion sizes alone, so I will be back. However, I suggest to skip the burger and try a steak!

Went to Triple George for the first time and felt nostalgic to see that it was next door to the now-closed Sidebar (my favorite place for a real Vodka Gimlet). The food, being the best thing, was definitely above average - and that's true even with the grilled vegetable plate I ordered.
The service was prompt and the servers had good personalities. Nice ambience, lighting not to dark or light and the bread pudding dessert was amazing!  I WILL be back :)

Went here when our regular spot was booked. What a surprise. Best steak I've had in Vegas. Reasonable wine prices. The short rib ravioli appetizer is to die for. We have been here many times for Happy Hour, which s a total bargain.

This place used to be really good, but my last two experiences have really changed my opinion of Triple George. First-timers, note that their website does not accurately reflect prices of their menu items - we noticed price variations from $5-6 for less expensive items all the way up to $14-15 on steaks and some seafood this time around.

First, they appear to have gotten rid of their valet (again, website still features it), meaning your options, as far as I can tell, are to park in the Downtown Grand valet and walk a block (fine, as long as the valet isn't full, as it was during the first of these bad visits) or try your luck at one of the various garages around downtown. For the mid-to-upper class dining experience, definitely not the best. The valet needs to come back.

Second, the service has gotten worse and worse with each visit. We frequently come to Triple George before catching a show at the Smith Center, and normally this is not a problem. They even used to have special Smith Center-themed menus (these haven't been around the last few times) and were on top of their game to get you out the door in time for a show. For our most recent visit, we told them (as we usually do) that we had a show at 7:30. Still, we nearly missed seeing The Book of Mormon, despite arriving at Triple George nearly two hours before showtime. The reason? The food came out over an hour after ordering. And it was nothing special - a steak, chicken saltimbocca, salmon, and roasted chicken, all of which had to be eaten in about 10 minutes to make up for the time lost. That is unacceptable. 

The food? I've had better. The steaks are priced relatively well respective to other Las Vegas steak places, though that's still overpriced. Steaks are just okay - a little thin in my opinion, so they end up a little overcooked (I order rare to get medium rare) - but they have a decent variety. Taste is just average. The chicken/pasta options are really bland. They have pretty decent drink options if that's your thing (I stuck with a beer). 

At least at some of the other steakhouses around the city you tend to lose the shorts/t-shirt crowd, but not here. I mean, that's downtown (it's sandwiched between a pizza place and the Hogs and Heifers biker bar), but that just isn't what I am looking for. I haven't been here for lunch (I've heard it's good), so I can't comment on that.
always a good place to have salmon or steak. i love their calamari. food is great! service could be better. but iverall i would always go here to eat.

We went for a birthday celebration in a party of 6. Our reservation was at 7:45 pm. Food was not served until almost an hour later. I ordered the Ahi Tuna charbroiled and when it arrived it was only slightly pan-seared and pretty much raw and horrible tasting. The manager was called over, tuna taken back to the kitchen and did not get back to me fully cooked until the rest of my party had already finished eating and we needed to leave for another engagement.  Since I really did not get to eat my dinner with my party I figured the manager would remove the cost from my bill but he did not. Manager was summoned and when asked why I received only a puzzled look and no answer. The rest of my party enjoyed their dinner. I left totally unsatisfied with a raw fish taste still in my mouth. Gross.

4.5 stars: After many overpriced and disappointing meals on the strip we decided to give an older, more classic restaurant a try. We are so glad we did!!!

We started with drinks. Their bartender made great cocktails but they also have wine and beer. We had a Manhattan and the El Diablo. We munched on their warm sourdough bread with butter while waiting for our food. We split the the george chopped salad because it was large enough for an entree or to split as an appetizer.

My husband had to sage buttermilk fried chicken with bacon gravy. He loved it and I did too (I kept stealing bites)! The chicken was so flavorful and moist and the bacon gravy was decadent! 

I wanted something a bit lighter and ordered the Mahi Mahi special with pineapple salsa. It was light and the pineapple salsa was a great complement to the Mahi Mahi.

We wanted dessert but were so pleasantly full. Give this place a shot when in Vegas. Service was excellent and this was, hands down one of the best places we dined at for the value and quality.
Really good food all around great sourdough bread best outside of San Francisco love the buttermilk sage fried chicken and French onion soup

Long overdue review.  Our group has been coming to Triple George Grill every year on the 2nd Saturday of September since 2009 for our annual pilgrimage to Vegas. For those who know Vegas, there's no shortage of awesome places to eat but TGG is the place we keep coming to because they have the three things we love for our annual gathering.... Great food, great drinks, and awesome service!  This place has the feel of an old style steakhouse with simple and perfectly cooked rib-eyes, classic drinks that are made by REAL bartenders, and service that makes sure your needs are met yet not overbearing.  

Thanks to the staff at Triple George for another great meal... we'll be back next year!

Wow, I went here with a friend who recommended this place highly. He wasn't wrong, we had a few beers and I had an onion soup and Shrimp Scampi Linguini. That food was just over delicious. Fresh and fine tasting. Very simple. I will certainly be back. The welcoming hostess was as well very nice as were all the bartenders and personnel. Great place to eat and socialize downtown Vegas.
This was my choice for my wedding rehearsal dinner on May 29 and then my birthday on July 13. Always excellent food and exceptional service! I can't recommend this place enough!
My husband and I came here for lunch prior to going to the Mob Museum. It was absolutely excellent! The cocktails are excellent! I had fish tacos and my husband had the Ruben and both were delicious.

Old school steakhouse located in the downtown area, a few blocks from Fremont St.

The restaurant has a 1940s/50s look to it with black and white photos on the wall and hidden booths behind wooden partitions.

The restaurant has table, booth, or bar seating. 

Our waitress was really friendly and we started with some cocktails and complimentary bread. For my meal I had the petite filet which came with mashed potatoes and vegetables. It was delicious.

For being in downtown the prices were not too high. Great food and atmosphere.
Great steak but terrible service. Maybe it was an off night! Recommend going and getting their signature ribeye.

Tonight I had the pleasure of sharing a fabulous meal at Triple George Grill with my bride of 40 years. I will have to say that it was the finest meal that either of us have ever had that neither of us had prepared.
That may seem a little conceited, but most of the time meals out come up a little short. We usually go home thinking that we could have made just as good, or better at home for a lot less coin.
 Not so with the meal we were starved tonight!  Bravo Triple George!
 My lamb chops were done to perfection and the accompanying sauce and veggies completed the whole experience. 
 The wife had the petite filet and commented that it was the first time in many dining experiences that she completely cleared her plate.
 I am sorry that I did not catch the name of the young lady that so graciously and professionally presented our meal, but she seemed to be one among many professionals representing this establishment admirably. 
 Once again, Bravo Triple George!!

Worst Customer Service Experience in a long time !!

Why ?

Not what I was expecting ( read below ) 
Food had no Flavor
Manager handled situation very unprofessionally  


My friend wanted to go out to a nice dinner on New Years Eve, everything was booked except for triple George ( and i can see why now ). She called me and told me she had found this place, so i looked up their menu online and was really looking forward to their fried chicken since i am a sucker for fried chicken !.

Once we arrived their was a pre set menu over their regular menu on the outside and it was $65.00, i wasn't thrilled at all about this but there was also nowhere else to go so decided to give it a shot, we get seated and handed our menu for the night ( only the pre set menu and drink menu ). We ordered our food and it came out in a good timely manner, however nothing had any taste to it, i reached for the salt and yes I spilled it so naturally I threw some over my shoulder lol ( that should have been an indication of how my experience was gonna go ). I let the appetizer and soup go by, I figured the steak and Lobster would make up for it, out comes the steak and lobster with mashed potatoes and asparagus, took a small bit of everything on my plate and . . drum roll please
SURPRISE !! No Taste, so i reach for the salt !!. I didn't really want to say anything because i didn't want my friend to feel bad because she picked this place ( I ate everything by now ), but then she complained so I am look phew now I can say something. Finally someone comes over to ask how everything was, so I told the waitress the food was bland, that I had to put salt on everything, she offered to get a manger and at first i told her not to worry about it, BUT as i say no, the people behind us order from the regular menu !! I ask the waitress if the regular menu was available and she said yes, and apologized that no one had told us, so at this point I am like OK, I usually don't do this but yes bring out the manager, and we would like the chocolate cake as our dessert lol.
Manager comes out and asks me what seems to be the problem and i explain.

so as if things weren't interesting enough here is where they put the cherry on the top ! 

The " Manager " replies with a " I'm Sorry " which I'm like OK thank you, but then he says " I wish you would have said something sooner " so he is telling me that there is nothing he can do now ?!  now I am no free loader and not expecting the meal to be comped, but I do like to feel that the establishment is willing to do SOMETHING about it ! I mean anything ! even as to offer maybe a coffee on the house to go with our dessert, but does he ? NO ! then i ask whats up with the regular menu thing and all he can say is :

" I am sorry for the service you received today, but I can assure you that the next time you come in, you will treated with exceptional customer service "  

WHAT !! this guy thinks I am coming back after this, I don't own a restaurant or a business at the moment but i thought exceptional customer service was suppose to be provided from the beginning, not the next time after you make a complain.

and to top it off after I had a couple bites of the dessert, the waitress comes by and asks if my dessert was good and if it needed any salt ? well I am glad she found humor in the fact that I had to pay $65.00 for something I didn't want and had no flavor, oh and yeah bad customer service. 

In the end I was disgusted with this experience, my friend wanted a nice meal for new years eve and you want to enjoy a nice meal and have a good time and conversation to bring in the new year, instead we got this. it was difficult to enjoy the rest of the night, but we did, but that doesn't mean I wasn't constantly thinking how bad and how unprofessional this place was.

I will say that this place has potential, I like the layout and has potential to have a good ambiance with both locals and tourists, I hope they get it together.

Nothing spectacular.  I had heard some great things and was somewhat disappointed.  The waiter wasn't outright rude but he kind of neglected me and didn't even look at me while i was ordering.  He really kind of didn't seem to want to be there.  Its got a nice enough ambiance and has the whole sultry dark room professional wall street feel to it.  and the food doesn't stick out in my head as either good or bad.  A decently solid meal I guess.
I had a ribeye and creme brûlée for desert. It was the best meal I have had in a long time!

So this place was OK. Our appetizers and drinks came out relatively quickly but our food took over an hour to arrive. I had the steamed mussles as an appetizer and they tasted really good but our issue was the long wait. Two tables that came in after us got their food first and all we ordered was seafood pasta and a medium rare 8 ounce steak. The manager came out and said he was actually cooking the food, which I thought was strange. The worst part was that they weren't  busy....at all. The food tasted good but was not worth the hour wait.

My expectations were higher. Is not that impressed by my meal. The service was good and friendly however they did not give us 15% discount even though they promised when I showed coupon from yelp. Prices also higher than $$. I would say it is $$$. So 3 stars from me. Overall disappointed.

We came here to celebrate my youngest brother's 21st birthday! The food was all delicious and perfectly cooked. I had the filet mignon, med rare, and it was awesome! Our server Nadia was wonderful! The rest of the staff was also really great! Thank you!

I really like this place.  Very classy with lots of nice wood paneling and a huge wooden bar.  Mom and the boy both enjoyed their perfectly cooked steaks.  I ordered the Pot Roast and it was melt in your mouth tender and the mashed potatoes were the BEST I've ever had!  

The service was great, our waiter was very attentive.  Our drinks never went unfilled and they cleared the table as we finished with our plates (something I truly appreciate).

The only downside was that they have TVs in the dining room, which I hate.

This is the place to go for dinner or a great happy hour!  Todd the bartender rocks!  He's there when the place is packed but never forgets the people he's serving!  If you want a place for good food and a happy hour you can't beat this is the place!  Thanks Todd for being such a great bartender!  Makes me fell at home!

Now that The Carson Street Cafe in the Golden Nugget is defunct The Triple George is the last of the power lunch places in Downtown Las Vegas.  We are talkin' classic here! This is a must do for not only every local but every visitor as well. I recommend the Bloody Mary complete with a shrimp and bacon, that's right the bartender is not fooling around. There is not one bad thing on the rather reasonably priced menu! In other words get yourself downtown and bask in the classic Las Vegas aura! Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

We went to Vegas for Valentine's Day and I looked at places downtown for dinner. Of course, I come to yelp. I made a reservation on open table. They called me the day before to confirm. 

We walk in early but, we were still seated right away. She hands us the Valentine's Day menu. We didn't get a regular menu like everyone else. On the Valentine's Day menu, there are 4 courses for $99 a couple. For the first 2, each person can pick what you want out of 2 choices. And for the entree and dessert, you shared. 

First course: truffle salad or a red pepper bisque. We got one of each. Duh. The dressing on the salad was tasty. The bisque was also tasty. They made a heart with cream. The garlic bread in the soup was a nice little touch. 

Second course: beef Wellington or scallops. Again, we got one of each. The beef Wellington was good but, there wasn't much beef. The sauce that came with it was good. It has mushrooms in there. The scallop came out on top and potato Latka. The scallop was cooked well but, the sauce it came with was underwhelming. The potato was alright as well. 

Entree: the choices were tomahawk, surf and turf, or duck. We went with the surf and turf cooked medium rare. When the server described the menu, she made it seem like they were going to split the food for us. We got it on one plate and they gave us a plate to split ourselves. The 9oz filet was on top of mashed potatoes and 3 asparagus. It had 4 grilled shrimp. The filet was cooked well but, it was quite bland and dry. We asked for a side of their bernaise sauce. Once we got the sauce, it was good. The shrimp was over cooked by a bit. 

Dessert: some pear thing and chocolate soufflé. We went with the chocolate. I am not sure I have had a soufflé before but, my bf has. I do watch a lot of food network so I can tell the consistency was wrong. My boyfriend said the flavor is right, the consistency was off. The vanilla ice cream that came on top was good. 

Oh, I ordered a dirty martini and my boyfriend got a coke. The drinks basically came out after our food did. When we first sat, a guy came by and poured us some water. He spoke once. Asked if regular water was ok or if we wanted bottled water. When he did come by to fill the water and I would say thank you, he didn't respond. Uhh I almost said you're welcome for him. I controlled myself. Anyways, he also dropped off bread and butter. The butter was soft and it sat in Italian dressing? That's what it tasted like. We were one of the first ones in that part of the dining area but, it filled up quickly. The restaurant itself is a cute little place. There seems to be a lot of locals there. 

Overall, it was a good meal. Perfect portions. Service was a little slow. It was a good price for the food we got. Oh, no big deal but, FYI we were charged $3 for the bernaise. It was worth it for the filet though.
The steak was soft and juicy. So were the lamb chops. The dipping oil for the bread was delicious also.
Great food. Try their steak special and the swordfish if you go. However, it is too expensive for what it is, especially around lunchtime.

Good food & great service tonight. We stared with the baked goat cheese appetizer. We split a wedge which they kindly cut in half and served to us on 2 separate plates. Then my husband had the pot roast and I had the steak sandwich. Both were very good. I would go back any time.

Thanksgiving pre-fixed menu was great. Triple George never dissapoints, the food was amazing prime rib was cooked to perfection. The dessert was so amazingly well done, flakey apple pie crust with layers of fresh apples topped with a generous scoop of vanilla ice cream. The service was well paced and Ryan was very pleasant and attentive. Oh and please make sure you order the short rib raviolli.
Great bar, great food.  Hidden gem.

Awesome staff. Very friendly. Great taste on the food. Might want to expand with the menu for I find it limited. Big portions with their servings. 

A must place to visit if you have the urge for steak while staying in downtown Vegas..

This place is a great little find. You get a nice dinner and still have money left to gambles with! The wedge salad is better than the we had last night at Vic & Anthony's. 
Great little caprese salad too. 
They put their own unique spin on ordinary bread and butter.

Can't rave enough about how freaking amazing Triple George is! I have been to Vegas twice in the past month and have eaten here on 3 occasions, back to back on one visit!! The food is amazing and to die for. The prices are absolutely phenomenal, I cant speak highly enough about this restaurant! The martini's are some of the best we have ever had, try the espresso martini for something new and different. If you are looking for an amazing appetizer order the baked goat cheese marinara, it will literally melt in your mouth. The porcini crusted rib eye steak is one of the best steaks I have ever had, it is the perfect balance, and the mashed potatoes are nice, light and airy, and the portions are served with grilled vegetables as well. You cannot go wrong ever at Triple George and you owe it to yourself to eat here.. Do yourself a favor and leave the Strip for two hours and take a ride downtown to eat here..
Very nice experience at triple George's. Service was outstanding meal was very very good will return.

First off, our server Monique was an all-star!

Stayed downtown for a couple days so I started browsing for fine dining since it was my friend's birthday. I was very pleased with all the positive reviews and menu selection as far as food and drinks went with TGG so I made arrangements.

After meeting our wonderful server Monique, complimentary bread was brought out along with a plate of butter surrounded by what looked and tasted like Italian salad dressing. (yeah, your secret is out! lol)

For refreshments, we ordered a Cherry Lemon Drop and the Great King George which was their version of an Old Fashioned. Both were really great thanks to the female bartender at the time.

We didn't want to eat much, so we ordered the Chicken Pot Pie, Ribeye, and Petite Filet Mignon and a nice glass of Melbec Red recommended by Monique herself (thumbs up for that). The pie was good but could've been more filling with a whole crust rather than just a layer of crust on top of the pot it came in. The Ribeye was made perfectly! Medium rare throughout the whole steak and was overall just prepped perfectly. Honestly, I was really upset with the last plate.. 

So Filet Mignons are unique when it comes to cooking. In order to get the best flavor out of it, you must babysit it while it sits on the grill. Afterwards, there has to be a settling phase for the meat to cook by itself from the outside to the inside. Needless to say (see photo), it took 3 attempts to try and get the right temperature. First time was over cooked, second time was under cooked, and the third time also under cooked. It seemed to me that they did not let the meat rest the second and third time, which caused the middle of the filet to be really raw and mushy. That or the meat was not fully thawed out.

Of course the manager (William) came to apologize and was able to kindly make up for the inconvenience by taking care of our drinks. Overall, they tried their best so I can't be too upset. It was the birthday girl who was more upset since it was her Filet Mignon :/

PS: Prices have almost doubled since last year, so don't get too excited when you view the old photo of their menu.

When two independent people recommend a place for lunch I'm listening. Both the guide at the Neon Museum and the guy at the door at the Mob Museum recommended Triple George Grill for lunch.

We were not disappointed. This place is old school - wood paneling, waiters dressed in suits, big portions!

I had the Reuben Sandwich which was very good, others had salads or the Potroast which was also (as I hear) very good. All in all a fantastic place for lunch!
Very nice place. Reminds me of a 50s mob throwback era. Very cool decor. Food is excellent. Private mahogany booths. Must check out. Great happy hour specials from 4-7.
My review in summary; service was impeccable, steak was great, sides were eh. Worth the money spent and I'd visit again.

Staff here is amazing! We had one waitress(a mature blond woman) and few gentlemen who were all attentive. 
Our food came out in perfect timing (first bread, then appetizers, main course,  and drinks were constantly filed)
We shared a calamari, I had the petit filet minion,  and my sister had the apple glazed pork chop.  I absolutely love read meat,  and it could not have came out more juicy or perfect(no steak sauce needed).  The prices here were great,  I'm sure our bill was under $75

Excellent place for lunch with friends and/or business associates. Reminds me of restaurants in Atlanta and Chicago. Great service, delicious tasting dishes. Love their outdoor seating with live music.

Triple George Grill again receives a 4-star rating. Although not a knock-out the place is a diamond in the rough of downtown Vegas. I treated my husband to a birthday dinner here late on Monday night. We showed up at about 9:20 PM, and it closes at 10 PM, luckily we were not the only patrons still in the establishment as our dining experience went past their closing time.

Our server was a very happy woman who knew her menu very well. Overall the service was 5-stars. Not a problem.

I started off with a White Blend from Napa Valley, CA called Rhapsody, my husband ordered water. The White Blend was... hum, how can I put it? Very close to being atrocious? Of course, this is not the restaurant's fault, it's my fault for having a picky wine palate. Their wine menu features primarily California wines, with a few Italian varietals. No French wine. *clown tear*

Moving on, I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna Steak ($23.95), raw, with a side of wild rice, green beans/carrots, and soy sauce/wasabi. The tuna was pretty much perfect. The wild rice was pretty meh. Green beans and carrots - okay. 

My husband splurged and got the Porcini Crusted Rib Eye ($41.95). The meat was like butter. Beautifully done. His meal came with mashed potatoes and green beans/carrots. I gotta admit the sides here are pretty disappointing. The menu states that each entree will come with the chef's recommended sides and honestly I'd like to see a bit more creativity with them and also a bit more taste as well. Fortunately the steak made up for it, and it's a damn good thing it did considering the price.

Lastly we required a dessert and my husband picked the M&M Cheesecake. It appeared to the dessert they were serving just for that night because it was not on the dessert menu. It was a lovely cheesecake and the addition of M&Ms was fun. My favorite part was the buttery graham cracker crust!

Overall TGG is a decent dining option, especially for locals who want a nice steak but do not want to head down to the strip.

My son had the George burger and said it was good.  I had the salmon with rice pilaf and julienned veggies. Very good.  They bring you warm sourdough slices to start with herbed soft butter balls with a little vinegar poured over the top.  Very good.

Triple George stands the test of time as one of the longest running restaurants downtown. Even before downtown 3rd was developed into the nice hangout/restaurant row that it is now, Triple George has been here every step of way as one of the anchors of downtown's redevelopment.  The food is excellent w/solid choices of meat, seafood, and even vegan dishes that will satisfy most taste buds.  Steaks are underrated here as well as they have a very delicious rib-eye that's big enough for two. Other goto is the chicken christopher w/mash potatoes and greens. Also a great place to have dinner before or after The Smith Center as you can take Ogden all the way there.

just an update...we ate at the venue on 02/07/2014, but were charged on 02/27/2014??

when we called to ask, we were told "this happens all the time" no, sorry this does not. i did not put down my credit card like i would at a bar where the bartender would place an authorization pending your request to close your tab. 

i received the bill and put my card down for payment, we should have been billed that day if not by the next morning once their credit card went through the settlement process.

would definitely not recommend anyone deal with this

I ate here for lunch, with my mother and my husband and we all agreed it was wonderful!

Normally I don't pay too much attention to ambiance, however it really jumped out at me at this place! They have booth seating in a way that makes your dining experience feel very private. I never realized how enjoyable that could be. 

I LOVED the bread! I loved it so much I kept going back to it and taking bites of it throughout the entire meal! Now that's good bread.

I ordered the Pot Roast and found it to be tender, very tasty and well complimented by the mashed potatoes. It came with steamed carrots and broccoli. The only downside to that was, I tend to prefer my carrots cooked with the pot roast, not separately, but in spite of this I very much enjoyed my meal. All around good experience!

We went to Triple George on Christmas Day this year with family we were visiting while in Vegas. I found this restaurant on Yelp in the search for a good steak house. And let me just tell you, Triple George did not disappoint at all. The prices are pretty high, but that's to be expected from a good steak house. 
We parked at the Grand Casino across the street at their Valet parking and walked through the Casino straight across the street from Triple George....they validate parking so it was free.

When we got there, the hostess was very nice and welcoming. They accommodated our party which consisted of a wheelchair and stroller. Because of the holiday, the Chef had prepared a special 4 course meal, however after looking at everything included, we decided to order off the menu. The four course meal would have been too much food for all of us.

Around the table we had New York Steaks, Prosciutto with Chicken, Grilled Chicken, and a seafood pasta. None of the dishes disappointed....they were delicious to say the least. Our waiter was great and the manager came by to see how we were doing. The ambiance was warm and welcoming. When you walk in all you see is the bar, but behind the dark wood walls are more tables that seem like a great romantic setting for a first date.....  

After enjoying our dinner, we ordered Creme Brûlée and a New York Cheesecake which we all shared. All the desserts were exquisite. Next time you're looking for a Steakhouse in the Fremont area, stop by Triple George Grill, you'll be glad you did.

I'd love to do a real review, but the fact that I left after not seeing a server for 15 minutes prevents that. The menu looked promising, and the decor was kinda cool. I guess the server was more interested in the group of eight that sat down about 10 minutes after us. For all he knew I had $100 bills falling out of my pocket. I'm in the business, so I could understand if he was busy and at least stopped to greet us. I expected more.

My friends and I had a reservation on Friday evening. The first thing I noticed was how friendly and patient the hostess was because I could not remember whose name the reservation was under. As I was being seated, I noticed the bar area had ample space and the bartenders had excellent drink presentation. The overall space is a lot larger inside than it looks outside. 

The most amazing thing about this restaurant is the vegan menu with ample selections. I had the Vegan "chicken" Marsala and the house salad. Prior to the salad arriving, Mary, our server brought out bread with butter and olive oil. My friends raved on how crispy the outside was, yet the inside was soft and delectable. 

The mixed greens in my salad were fresh and crisp and I would recommend the balsamic vinaigrette.When my plate arrived, I was very pleased with the green beans and carrots. They had the right amount of crunch and tasted great with the marsala sauce and mushrooms that were atop my "chicken". Out of the vegetarian/vegan plates I have ordered over the years from various restaurants, this one looked the most appetizing. My friends who never want anything vegetarian, wanted to try the "chicken" marsala with the basmati rice and they loved it!  Needless to say, I cleaned my plate and enjoyed every bite! 

Since it was my friend's birthday, Mary brought out a chocolate cake with ice cream and whipped topping. The cake looked amazing and my friends enjoyed it. 

My bill was about $25, and although it was a little more expensive than what I would normally spend, it was well worth it and I will definitely be back!

We go here for special dinners: birthdays and anniversaries. The place has a great vibe but can be a little noisy during peak times as there is a huge horseshoe bar and everything is out in the open. It feels more like a place in San Francisco or New York than glitzy Las Vegas. Service was good and the food came out at about the right pace. I have had steaks and the lamb chops before so I thought I'd try the blackened salmon. The server said the salmon was fresh and "very nice." It was a good choice. The fish was cooked perfectly but the blackening seasoning was just  touch over done, too strong.
The veggies were cooked perfectly. The rice had a fairly strong flavor I can't describe. I would have liked the flavor a little lighter. I had The clam chowder and it was good, not super great but I would order it again. The creamed spinach had a very cheesy flavor. It was good but I really like the creamed spinach at Lawry's and nothing compares to that.
My wife had the crab stuffed shrimp and loved it. There were huge shrimp with ample amounts of crab. She has this dish every time and was not disappointed. I was lucky because she shared on with me and I also loved it.
The steaks are a little pricey, but in the past they have been exceptional. Having the salmon was the first time I've not had either a steak or lamb and I discovered the entire menu has a great deal of appeal. We really like this place and give it a strong recommendation. Make a reservation and go around 6:00pm as the place gets very busy later in the evening.

We've only visited the bar area so that's the only part I can review for now. 

The first time we went, I loved the place. Soultry female singer, great martinis, and I discovered the tomolive in their signature martini.

Fast forward to a couple of months, our most recent trip. No singer, crowded and the smell of seafood (albeit, it is a seafood restaurant). When asked what kind of olives were in their martinis (because we didn't know what they were for months!) no one knew what we were talking about. Then, once researching their drink menu to find that those yummy round pieces of goodness were tomolives, a bar tender told us that they haven't had those the three years he has worked there. Then, when ordering the martini, which on the menu specifically said there were tomolives, a different bar tender told us they were out of them. If they haven't had them in "three years", although we did have them a couple months prior, and if they aren't going to have them, why leave it on the menu to tempt those who are seeking. That was truly the reason we went back to the bar to order their pricey signature drink. It was not the same and my martini, ordered extra dirty, was not. Maybe if I tried the restaurant side, I may like the food and update my review, but the bar was disappointing and the menu looks expensive. We'll see.

First impression-great ambiance and decor.  Service was also really good.  However, the entrees were totally overpriced.  I had the Butternut Squash Ravioli and it was very underwhelming.  My husband had the steak special and it was delicious but not worth the $55!  We won't be coming here again.

Came here for dinner with my wife last year and the food was amazing, will be visiting Vegas again this weekend with siblings and I am definitely taking them here, chicken christopher and salmon plate was delicious

The restaurant is one of the best in Vegas. It's reasonably priced, with friendly efficient service. The ambiance is classy and laid back, the perfect place to sit talk and enjoy delicious food. Their teas is pretty amazing, fresh and not over brewed and ice cubes were frozen tea! Hands down the best steak I've had in a restaurant, it was seasoned and cooked properly and paired perfectly with its two sides. This place is definitely worth a try!

I went to this restaurant based on the high reviews. I was very disappointed. I ordered a $60 steak, it was the daily special. It came out cold. Not warm, not luke-warm, not room temperature. Cold, as if it had been left out under the air conditioning vent. I informed the waiter, who at first attempted to place the cause on the fact that I ordered it medium rare. Sorry, I have eaten at MANY great steak restaurants, and never have I been served a cold steak "because it was medium rare." He took it back for them to flash it. He returned, and it was warmer. However, because there was a sauce on the steak, the sauce was now seared into the meat, it was no longer a sauce, but dried and cooked into the meat. Nothing was offered to compensate for the horrid food I was served, and I left unhappy. I do not recommend for any reason.

Had soup of the day (mushroom) and a filet and baked potato and all were very good. Wife's pot roast was very good. Our guest's pork chops looked very good. Service was very good, and attentive and outgoing waitress. Dessert was good, I had creme brulee and the others shared a banana split like dish a la Triple George. Good experience and including drinks was fairly reasonable for Vegas.

I really really like this place! The downtown location is fabulous.  The decor was so warm, cozy, very old school Vegas. The wine list was very nice, and friends that were with us ordered Mojitos that they said they were made perfectly. First of all they brought the most amazing bread with whipped butter, olive oil, and fresh herbs. It was so good we ate all of it! The bread and wine were worth the trip by themselves. 
Our appetizers were Seared Ahi and Spinach Artichoke Dip, both were really really good. Again the garlic bread that was paired with the dip was perfect.
My husband had the Sage Fried Chicken, he said it was excellent. I had the Pot Pie.... yum yum yum. It was really good, creamy full of flavor, I really recommend trying it.
The other couple with us had the Chicken Fettuccine and the Crab Stuffed Shrimp. Both of the dishes looked great and our friends were raving about how much they liked the dishes as well.
We are going back next week!

My first visit was a couple of Friday's ago because some friends were getting together for cocktails and cigars! Yeas, they are guy friends and NO I don't smoke cigars. Well, I would have tried it at least, but I have not smoked for 1 year now and didn't want to push my luck! We sat at the bar for dinner, which was really just salads BUT THEY WERE AMAZING! I think we all had the chopped salad and considering it was stinking hot outside that really hit the spot! The waiter was fantastically amusing! And attentive. The drinks were generous and I'm sure the good tips we left didn't hurt our service! 

Next visit I would love to sit in one of the little booths because it looked really romantic. Well, old Vegas style romantic. Dark wood, soft lights, great atmosphere! 

Later we went and sat outside so the boys could smoke and the patio was great as well. Much entertainment watching the folks at other extablishments...quite amusing! We are actually all bikers, so being next to that other place gave us a great view of some pretty awesome bikes. But we much prefer the ambiance of Triple George, I  guess we are just a sophisticated lot! LOL!

The boys tired out early and rode off on their bikes leaving us girls to entertain ourselves! We wandered next door to the Sidebar, which I guess is "related" to the George! The music was hopping and the crowd was a little young for me, but they were amusing and did not seem offended that us "old folks" were hanging out there! A little bit of dancing in that small space was enough for me, but the music and videos were hopping! Very much enjoyed our time there! 

My group intends to make Triple George a regular part of our Fremont Fridays! I can't wait to try it again, as soon as I stop galavanting around the country and stay home on a Friday night!

Experience:  Came with a large group of folks to try this spot out. It was a Thursday at 1:00. 

Facility: This was a very nice restaurant. It had almost an old speakeasy feel with the fine wood accents. The atmosphere is a tad upscale. I did feel a little underdressed since I was in jeans, but it was the lunch crowd, so I didn't stand out too bad. They had a large bar in the main area too, that looked like a nice place to grab some drinks. There was also outside seating, which would have been awesome because the weather was gorgeous. 

Service:  The service over all was very good. The waiter had a good disposition, and was patient with our large, some of them picky, group. However, I did explain that I needed a lot of water (I was nursing a hangover) and keep the refills coming, yet my glass was empty often, and I had to ask for a few refills. 

Food: There were some neat things about this place, but overall the food was...meh. 
The served hot bread 4/5 on the table that was good, but some herbed butter on the side. 
The ice tea 5/5 was pretty awesome because they bring out a glass full of ice cubes made of actual tea. Then they add the liquid tea on top. Great idea!!!!!!
I ordered the fish and chips 2.5/5 after another review on here raved about it. I wasn't as impressed. The fish was ok...a tad bland. It was beer battered, but had a storage aftertaste I couldn't place. The fries 4/5 were hot and pretty decent. The Coke slaw 4/5 surprisingly had a nice twang to it. I would not order the fish again. 

Overall: it was just ok.  Great atmosphere, but the food was lacking. The person next to me ordered a steak, and it looked great and was cooked perfect. Maybe I'll try that if I ever come back.

Four of us went to dinner at this restaurant, and all four of us agreed that we really enjoyed our dinners.  The onion soup was delicious, and not salty, with just the right amount of cheese.  Three of us ordered the filet, and one ordered the ribeye.  All the steaks were cooked to our liking.  A plus, unlike many steakhouses which charge you additional for sides with the steaks, Triple George serves their steaks with mashed potato and steamed broccoli and baby carrots.  Service was attentive and prompt.  Over all, a wonderful dining experience.

My in-laws came to visit to meet our new baby boy and we decided that for their last night in town we needed a nice steak for dinner. We wanted to avoid The Strip and it's super high prices, but we still wanted to be in a fun part of town. Triple George absolutely fit the bill! Papa H hadn't been to Vegas since the 70s and he wanted to see how much Downtown had changed. I made a reservation only a couple hours prior on Open Table on a Sunday evening for the five of us. Hubby dropped us at the door so we could get settled, but he had no problem finding a meter right across the street. We were seated shortly after we arrived and our hostess was kind enough to seat us where my in-laws requested. 

My in-laws seemed pleased with the drink selection and our servers were hyper vigilant about keeping all of our glasses full. 

After we placed our food order, a basket of heavenly soft sour dough arrived at our table. It was accompanied by two soft scoops of butter that sat in pool of sweet juice and seasoning. So good!!

Both couples opted to share a wedge Salad which they split for us. Very thoughtful! And the wedge had that crunch I was craving. 

Hubby chose one of the specials of the night - a center cut ribeye and a lobster tail with a side of mashed potatoes and the most enormous asparagus I've ever seen in my entire life. 

I opted for the lamb chops. I couldn't believe they give me SIX chops! It was covered in the most deliciously flavorful gravy and accompanied by mashed potatoes and a mix of roasted carrots and squash. The lamb was cooked to medium rare as requested. And because I had so much, I shared quite a bit with hubby. I'm pretty sure he ended up liking what I got more than what he'd ordered for himself. 

The mashed potatoes were definitely super buttery and amazing. The carrots were beautiful and simply seasoned. And this unique green squash had very nice, sweet flavor!

While the in-laws were too full for dessert, hubby and I don't know what that phrase means. So he got the Creme Brûlée and I got the Flourless Chocolate Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream. His was the largest serving of Brûlée we've ever seen! It was served in a much deeper dish than we're used to, which provided the perfect ratio of custard to sugared top - this was the best Creme Brûlée we've ever had! 

My cake was smaller in comparison. It was petite, but had a scoop of ice cream equal in size sitting on top of it. While this ice cream wasn't particularly rich or sweet, the cake certainly made up for it!

We were so impressed by this place. It's beautifully decorated and has a great feel. I'd love to go back and try lunch sometime!

I have found a great gem of a restaurant in 'Old Las Vegas' and our server was Alice.  I ordered the Ribeye medium rare.  The steak was cooked to perfection  and was delicious!  Service was quick and personable.  One of my pet peeves is when restaurants misrepresent the weight of a cut of meat.  Not here.  I was even able to make a reservation by text message although I think a walk in would have been seated as quick.  For people visiting Las Vegas, get off the strip.  Check out the old and established section of Las Vegas. Less crowds, older established places, and a classier experience!  Three George's fits t
Great atmosphere - awesome steaks - friendly staff - I'm a regular for sure.
Excellent food & value! You won't find a steakhouse in Vegas with better price, food & ambience! Worth the can ride to Fremont!

This is one of my regular spots since I live down the street, it's always amazing! However I always eat at the bar. Well, last night I decided to get a table. Big mistake! No hostess for like 5 minutes, get sat.....no server or busser for a bit. Server comes, takes order.....gets us water. Don't see anyone for about 20 minutes (out of water) went to the bar to get water.....food comes about 10 minutes later. Food was really good as usual, but what's up with the service in this joint when you sit at a table? Anyways, stared at empty plates for a bit before I just decided to get up and track down the server for my bill. Will I return? Yes. Will I ever sit at a table again? Never lol

The food here is fantastic. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal. The tomato soup is awesome and I love their salads. Their service is ok, it can sometimes be hit or miss, but that definitely doesn't deter me from going there.

Triple George Grill was awesome!  Coming from a group of (5), we rated it the best hidden secret/restaurant in Las Vegas!!  

The next time in Las Vegas we will be sure to come back!!

Perfect atmosphere, very 40s screened booths et al. Our waiter, Cameron, was truly fantastic and charming. Finally, the food, WOW!! The porcini rump steak is simply magnificent, the calamari is an ideal starter for two. You can get steak cheaper in the area but it won't be nearly as good. All in all If I wasn't leaving town I'd be going back there!

Just had lunch at Triple George's worse service ever and giving the feed back to the manager was even worse because he was part of our service.. My recommendation would to stay away during the day and enjoy dinner at George's because it seems that is what they are good at!!! However one poor blonde women was working her ass off outside as everyone inside sucked and the manager was ok with it! Well I'm glad that lady thanked us for coming even though she had no idea we were there! What a sad review to a place I love to go!!!

The private booths are very tall and good for intimate business meetings or dates;) it has an old school feel and good attentive service. The steaks are really good. They also have specials prix fix dinner deals with the mob museum. Great time to enjoy the museum and then head there for dinner. Perfect pairing and you'll get the "made" experience. Be sure to head back to the underground bar at the mob museum for drinks in the speakeasy style or the biker bar next door. Great steaks + great location to other bars and attractions downtown old school Vegas.

Nice booth seating, immediate service. Wait persons should give the prices when announcing the specials. Don't clear the plates and ask who wants coffee when one guest of three is still eating. Sole had nice panko crust, but the fish was mushy, not flaky, inside.
Andrew was the most attentive server! He was great!! I'll come back for the service if nothing else!! The food was good too plus management! Highly recommend!!!

Loved the atmosphere and the service. The food was good too. LOVED the veggies the best, I am a veggie lover, primarily a vegetarian who eats a tiny bit a fish here and there. I had a special which was sword fish with crab on top. It was very good, but the veggies were better. :) also tried the mashed potatoes which was someone else's in my party. They were soo tasty. I will probably go back. :)
Delicious food. This place has open for 9 years, I have been staying in Downtown Vegas for years and did not know this place existed.

Steaks were fabulous. scampi was awesome.  Bruschetta was to die for. Crab Louie made as a chopped salad not a great idea but pile of crab on top was delicious! Really cute place within walking distance of Fremont.  We will definitely be back!

Great food great service 
We've been eating here for a few months now the atmosphere is classic steak house. The wine selection is fantastic.

Good..not great ..good service..average food..salmon salad was  lettuce with a few pieces of salmon...disappointing ...bread putting desert was very good..cool atmosphere..but you can't eat atmosphere!!...a one and done with all the options out there!!!

We found this place on yelp and decided to try it based on the reviews.  The overall quality of the food was good.  My husband ordered The filet mignon and it was cooked perfectly; my son ordered the blackened salmon and it was very tasty.  The complimentary sourdough bread and butter they serve is delicious.  I ordered the chicken pot pie and it was huge, it needed more flavor but overall it was a good dining experience.

Excellent food and service! Came with a large group...no trouble keeping up with us. Some of the higher end entries seemed a little small, but, tasted great. We will return but will choose items from the "Favorites".  Better value.

Another good place to eat downtown. They have outdoor seating and inside is a bar in the middle and mostly booth seating. Shrimp scampi was very good. The fried chicken wings were ordered by others in my group they said it was  really good as well. Service was good didn't wait long for food to come out. We came during lunch Memorial Day. Ate food so fast we forgot to take pics :)
Did not like the Charbroiled Chicken Sandwich that much, but the truffel fries were out of this world good, surely should order them.

Very good place if you're in the downtown area!  

We had the Cioppino and Filet mignon for dinner.  The Caesar salad was pretty good, I liked the sourdough croutons.  

The Cioppino was very tasty and flavorful, the tomatoe soup base with the seafood was great.  It was loaded with mussels, scallops, shrimp, clams, and etc.

The filet mignon was really flavorful and done medium rare really brought out the flavors in that filet.  

Dessert was the bread pudding and a brownie cookie.  Both were pretty good, but nothing that stood out as a great dessert.

Service was pretty good, staff was attentive and friendly.

Our waiter quickly appeared for our drink orders, water, and recited the day's specials.  We received a complimentary relish tray and placed our orders.  My wife opted for the evening's special, sesame crusted Ahi tuna served with mashed potatoes and mixed seasonal vegetables. The tuna was served rare so it was sent back to the kitchen until it was suitably medium rare.  I could tell something was amiss when a frown appeared on her forehead after taking a few bites.  The tuna was extremely tough and the potatoes had been genetically re-mastered resulting in an out-of-worldly consistency and flavor. I fared only slightly better with the seafood cioppino - shrimp, mussels, crab, white fish, clams and scallops in a somewhat spicy tomato sauce.  We concluded the meal with a bread pudding that was tasty, but too heavy.

Yelp let us here and I come to Yelp to share how wonderful experience was Triple George.I can't think of anything I would change. Mixologist prepared a pomegranate lemon drop to die for.  Appetizer bruschetta was amazing and melting in your mouth. The calamari was cooked just right. Fish of the day was swordfish and was perfect, although . We had the apple glazed pork which was delicious at medium although I suggest at medium rare. Service from Cameron was awesome. Pricing is certainly fair. We will definitely come back here. Perfectly laid back and as delicious as he gets at a reasonable price.

Not a nice place for a couple to go out. Their sitting for two is either near the restroom, or near the exit. Very awkward. 

Food is good though and the service too.

My family and I were in Las Vegas for a week.  We had gone to Fremont Street and planned a late dinner at Triple George.  After a week of seeking out great places to eat, Triple George Grill was easily our favorite restaurant of the trip.  The drinks were smooth and tasty.  Each of us ordered something different from the menu, and all of them were delicious.  The filet and fried chicken were our favorites, but the shrimp and scallops pasta dish and the pot roast were very good.  We sat in the private booths in the bar area, and while that prevented people watching, it allowed us to focus on each other without loud noise or distraction.  Andrew took great care of us, and the staff seemed to work together to provide an excellent dining experience.  We will definitely make it a point to dine there again the next time we are in town.

My husband and I went down there for our anniversary. One of the best meals we have had in a long time. My filet mignon practically melted in my mouth. My husband  got the Buttermilk Sage Fried Chicken and loved it so much he said he felt like going around to all the other tables and telling them if they hadn't gotten that chicken, they'd ordered wrong. We had the Rumchata Bread Pudding and creme brûlée for desert and both were so good that that we ate till we hurt because it felt so wrong to leave food that good. All the staff were warm and awesome. A fantastic night out.

Service didn't exist. I saw more of the busser and food runners than my server, but even they were still borderline clueless about proper service. The server didn't seem to care about steps of service or maybe he didn't know them. We waited for about 10 minutes before getting acknowledged of our existence. During that time we finally did get greeted, there was no drink order and didn't get to hear the specials like the tables around us with a different server. We received our drinks after we ate the appetizers, had to stop someone to ask for plates to share the appetizers and water refills, and had to serve our own wine. All the while, our server came by (when he decided to stop by)with a happy smile as if we were enjoying the horrific service. I felt like I should have been on a prank show to test my frustration. We didn't get any acknowledgement that the entire experience was lousy. With too many employees walking by and lack of care for your guests, I doubt it will be a place we care to return. To top it off, our server was training someone! Wow. That's quite the example of setting yourself up for failure. This should be a nice restaurant.  You're paying for the good food and that is all. It's understandable I can't expect perfection, but some sort of "sorry to keep you waiting", "thank you for your patience", something said to let us know we are appreciated and not just an expected gratuity at the end would have been nice and changed our minds about this place. I hope they care to read this and re-train the staff about what steps of service means for every single guest and reconsider who does any training if you want this business to be successful. As a local, I really hoped I could be writing a better review and feel rather lenient to give 3 stars or an appropriate gratuity tonight without making a complaint.
Great steak, great sides, great service...  all at a reasonable Vegas steakhouse price...

As I mentioned in another review, I don't get downtown very often. I attended an event at the Downtown Grand, so I took that opportunity to try out Triple George, as I'd heard great things about it.

I tried the salmon, which was outstanding. The ambience of the restaurant is really cozy as well.

The service wasn't as good as I would expect, but that could have been because I was seated with a very large group at a prime dinner time.

Overall, I love Triple George and will make the effort to go downtown just to dine with them again.

Dear Lauren what a gem hidden in downtown Las Vegas I never ever would've heard about this place unless it was for my friend Laura lie from crowd siren who does a lot of restaurant opening this and start up businesses in the downtown area she is very well known when she suggested the King George to me and my friend Alanna and Holly we didn't know what she was talking about
But when we got there I felt like I wasn't in Las Vegas I felt like I was in Holbrook in or Boston or Washington DC one maybe a little bit of Manhattan like a steakhouse it's got some pretty cool duck horror and boots we ordered different sandwiches soups but mainly we were drinking and laughing in fact I'm surprised that we did not get kicked out but our server was very nice to us we went there for lunch and it's amazing that Laura lie even went back to work
If you can find this place it's pretty nice and it's good to have a nice business dinner I would recommend that for sure because it's like you're not even in Vegas

We went to Triple George for dinner at sat on the patio. There were other tables who were seated after us who got their food 10 minutes before we did. When we asked our waitress said she would go check and the manager brought the food out a short time later. The food was lukewarm and my friend's burger was not cooked properly and was dry. Our waitress said she would get the manager and disappeared. The manager apologized and was very polite. He told us he would send out waitress back out to get a free dessert. She dropped the dessert menu off and disappeared for another 10 minutes. They were not busy, so I'm not sure where she was going when she disappeared. We finally just asked for our check. When the manager found out that we never got to order dessert he comped our drinks and appetizer. We were pleased that the manager tried to make things right, but were disappointed by the service we got from our waitress. The food was ok, but not spectacular.

What a great way to end a trip to Vegas. A group of 8 popped in for a quick bite before we left to go back home. When we walked in I thought we were in over our heads as we were in a hurry. The wood work & well dressed staff gave the appearance of upscale dining and the food confirmed that opinion but the prices did not. Yummy food, professional & friendly staff at affordable prices. All 8 of us really enjoyed our meal. The easily accommodated our time crunch without a rushed feel. Truly a gem of a find. Parmesan Truffle fries are a must.

Just excellent. Save your pennies (because its not TOO expensive) and get the specialty rib eye. It's amazing and melts in your mouth. I can't remember the name of our server (younger gentleman) but he was great. Atmosphere, location, and vibe resonates that of old Las Vegas, and peeps, let me tell you, this steakhouse is a secret that most don't know about, even locals. Go there. Now. Stop reading and go! Seriously. Now.

The food here is excellent! They have a nice happy hour also with nicely priced appetizers. I got the goat cheese appetizer and it was only $5. The atmosphere reminds me of a 1930's bar, with old black and white photos and the bar tenders dressed in vests.  The staff is very nice and attentive. Definitely a place to return to!

This was beyond bad.  The rub on the steaks was so salty it was almost not even edible.  The service was slow, the items we ordered were not available, the server didn't bring the lobster and the it was gone by the time she checked back...and worst of all, this place was soooo over priced.  About $100/person with one cocktail for terrible food (steak truck-like) steaks and a cocktail.

Met friends this past Saturday for dinner and drinks. I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip...very thick and it stuck to excellent garlic bread perfectly. Wonderful flavor. Think it couldn't get better? Well it did. I had a cup of Baked Onion Soup, Oh my goodness was it ever delicious! In between these two rounds of I had 2 margarita's on the rocks. EXCELLENT is all that can describe them. I like my margaritas tart and no where near sweet, so these were perfect for my pallet. Next came the petite Filet butterflied and cooked medium, mashed potatoes and chef's veggies. To be honest, I didn't have much room for the veggies, but the taste of carrot I had was superb. The filet melted in my mouth just like the garlic butter melted on top of the filet. Hubby had the Ribeye and said it was even more tender and juicy than my filet (he tasted it), how that was possible is beyond me. BTW, we are locals and have access to many steak houses in Las Vegas. So far, this was the best steak I have had in Vegas in the 12 years I have lived here. Brian was our server and he was great and attentive to us. Also, if you go during nicer weather, sit out front. It was perfect to people watch and enjoy this fabulous meal!

Great server. Alice was very good. Terrible food. Ungodly salty. Bathroom was a mess. Broken faucet. Paper towels all over the bathroom floors. The calamari stunk. The Cesar salad had more croutons than lettuce. The French onion soup was so salty I thought it was a brine and goddamn the spicy shrimp and scallops linguine had a half of a stick of butter. It was a very nice establishment. Nice long bar. Beautiful mahogany booths. Unfortunate.

Our normal happy hour joint Oscars Steaks House was having a private event so we wondered down to Triple George for their happy hour only to encounter a No Happy Hour Week due  to the "convention" in town. As we looked around the bar it seemed to be WHAT convention as the bar was half full. Another guest sat next to us asking for the happy hour menu. We noticed a trend of locals being shut down for the convention!  Not a good plan by management to shut the locals out because of a four day event. Might want to think that one out for next year!  Locals visit triple George numerous time a year, where as visitor come and go! Bad business.......

We had a large bachelor party booked here for months. Due to administrative error (double booking by their staff) we were told we could be seated in different areas (not as a group) or to find another venue. One star for lack of flexibility, poor customer service, and because Yelp won't let me give a zero. Sad I'll miss out trying the place as it was hyped by the organizer, but I hold a mean grudge once burned.

A great downtown resaturant away for the hotel buffets. Old vegas charm. Top notch service. I had the sole with capers. MMM licious! Hubby had the fish of the day prepared with a kick! A short walk from Fremot Experience.

I only gave it one star because thats the only choice I had the waitess that help us was slow she didn't even say hi to us just asked us our order & the food tasted like hospital food I had steak it was so tough and chewy when I asked for med with a little pink except it was so over cooked I felt like I was cutting into a brick my husband had lamb it said a 10oz except it was 2 5 oz lamb chops which was misleading...both of our meals came with mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables (gross) again tasted like bland hospital food. Not to mention it was $80 bucks with our meals and 1 soda and a water 
The ambiance is nice but that's about it  
Moral of the story NOT WORTH IT save your money and go to Pizza Rock next door....

Great Old Vegas atmosphere here.  I can just pricture the Brat Packing eating in the corner.  

They start you out with sourdough bread and a relish plate.  The bread is the bomb!  

We had a party with about 17 people, and we all had a bunch of the items.  What I liked best is the farm fresh vegetables that come with the entrees.  

The staff is very helpful and accomodating.  My only complaint is that I asked them if they had an automatic gratuity for large parties, and they said no, but then charged us one, anyway.  Not a big complaint as that is pretty much standard.

We our regulars at TG and love the food and service.  My only complaint is the way they manage to increase our bill when using Restaurants.com.  We had the special - grilled ahi and shrimp George.  When our bill ended up being $10 more than it should be the waitress told us there was an up charge of $3.75 for the bleu cheese mashed potatoes (versus the regular mashed potatoes that came with the entree) and that their software "ghosts" the up charge.  It still ended up being $5 more than it should have been.  Bottom line, great food, great service and great ambiance.  Just watch that bill!

Went here with my girlfriend for my birthday dinner. I was sunburnt, tired, and had a headache. This was the perfect antidote to my ailments. 

The atmosphere is low-key, and semi-upscale but done with an old school charm. The food is straight forward red blooded American man food. My filet was cooked perfectly to order and was served with standard vegetables which were pretty good, but unspectacular. I took down a ton of complimentary bread before my meal, so the hearty portion size was a little intimidating.

I loved the old school Vegas vibe it had near Fremont Street. I loved that they didn't try too hard. The food is better than average, but it will not blow you away. This is all a nice change from most Vegas restaurants these days. Prices were pretty good compared to other Vegas restaurants.

Great downtown experience! Food is top shelf and service was great. Live music while eating outside in the sum. Waiter was attentive without being obnoxious. The steak I had was perfect and the lobster bisque was heaven. Wife had the stuffed shrimp and it was delish!  If your doing Freemont this is where to go for dinner!
Good food, friendly staff. Great happy hour. Really like this place. I'm here for unfortunate times but really like this place.

Husband and I love it here. Second time coming. We get the filet and it is always super yummy and tender. Sides are good too. Our last experience it took our waitress a long time to come over but their "floater" (fills water, bread, clears table, etc) he was fantastic! 

Good clean restaurant with yummy food! We'll be back!

Really wanted to like this place. Right down town and the front room/bar is pretty cool. Those are the stars. 

The service was lackluster for sure. The server barely came around and if it wasn't for the sweet girl refilling our drinks we would probably just walked out. 

My boyfriend ordered their steak and lobster special $65.00 and I ordered a steak with potatoes and a side of asparagus. The food comes out and my boyfriends steak looked like, and I quote him, "something from sizzler" it was thin and colorless. So he asked to order a different steak and waited 20 minutes for it. My food was fine, but the steak had very little flavor, the potatoes were good. 

Server never came to see if the new steak was ok, and no manager either. Check comes and not only do they not do anything to compensate for his ridiculous steak... But they CHARGED HIM for the new one! 

NO NO NO! This place was too pricy for that crap! 

The only good service was the girl refilling our drinks and the busboy who really took care of our table keeping it nice. 

Won't be back. Too many good food choices all over to be treated like that. Sucks because we live here and my boyfriend lives right up the street.

Recently tried this place and I will return. Service was wonderful and I enjoyed the atmosphere. We started with the calamari which had two great dipping sauces. My husband had chicken that was reminiscent to chicken-cordon-bleu.  I had the mushroom ravioli which was the best I've ever had. The bread and butter they bring is to die for. Highly recommend!

For the price, it was the little things that stand out in a lower rating than normal. The servers were not particularly polite (not rude, but also not friendly), the bread was not cut all the way through (which made it difficult for the group to separate), and the vegetables were over-cooked. The atmosphere and decor was great and I enjoyed my main entree.

Came here with some friends on a Thursday night.  I ordered the shrimp pasta; the flavor was decent.  However, the price for the food here doesn't correlate. I think it's a bit overpriced, but if you're in the neighborhood and require some "finer" dining, then Triple George Grill is the place to go.  

The service here was great, too.  Our group stayed behind for almost another hour after we were done with our meals to chat (the place was empty by that point), and our waitress was very nice and continued to fill our glasses with water and checked in on us way after we paid our bill.  They also have these booths that can give your party a lot of privacy.

Came for lunch on a Friday afternoon. The ambiance of the outdoor seating area was charming and relaxing. The food was very good, and prices were reasonable. The servers were friendly, my only complaint is that they seemed a bit unorganized.

I had been here several times for cocktails. This is a very cool, retro-hip place to sit inside and sip on delicious concoctions. As you walk in, it appears small, but extends quite a ways to the back and sides. 

On this night, I took friends here for dinner. We sat outside on a beautiful evening. The challenge is the music from Hogs & Heifers next door is pretty loud, although not overbearing. Our waitress was swift and thorough. She explained that this is a "San Fransisco Style" grill, meaning they specialize in steak and seafood, she said. So, I ordered the scallop special and my wife had the chicken pot pie. The sear was good on the scallops, and they were seasoned nicely. The chicken pie, though, was under seasoned and dry. The bartender knew the wine list and selected a nice wine based on our meal and my preferred favors.  I don't know that I'd return for food...maybe...but it will remain a fav for cocktails.

For a fancy restaurant, this place was only casual dress! The food was beautifully plated and delicious. Even the appetizer portions were huge! We had a party of 4 and we didn't order that much because of the large portion size. Everything was just phenomenal! 

We ordered the scallop and shrimp special they had going on along with the veggie appetizer and rice pilaf and bruschetta. Overall everything was above par and just great. Definitely will consider it the next time I'm in Vegas. 

It's also conveniently located right next to Fremont St. which I've never been too and it was a great experience to walk around that area after our delightful dinner.

Nice restaurant located downtown, basically down a back street/alley.  The atmosphere was old school, with a large bar area and very secluded booths.  This created a bit of a problem, as we had 5 people and they stuck a chair at the end of our table, basically preventing the servers from getting to the table without effort.  The apps, salads and onion soup were excellent.  My adult son enjoyed the seafood cioppino, the wife liked the ravioli and the chicken parm was nice.  The Shrimp George was a bit dry and the "spicy" shrimp and scallop linguine was not spicy at all.  Service was very good.

We dined here on my first night in Las Vegas. This was possibly the best choice of eating establishments I could have made.

The hostess was very polite, pleasant and promptly seated us. The restaurant was very cozy and we were seated in a rounded booth. And for our overall dining experience let me start with this: our server was outstanding!

He was on point with every recommendation and adequately described the dishes. During the meal he was attentive and never intrusive or overbearing. For dessert he asked the chef if he would make Italian donuts for me (I had inquired about it but it wasn't on their regular menu). The chef agreed and the Italian donuts topped off an incredible meal.

The Food: I ordered the Pot Roast after I found out that people would come from all over just for the Pot Roast (as per our server). I started drinks with a Black Cherry Drop which was very good (recommend). I also had the Baked Onion Soup (French Onion Soup) and that was really good as well. The Pot Roast was heavenly and if I didn't believe that people came specifically for that dish, I was/am a firm believer now. Cooked perfectly, I enjoyed every hearty bite. 

It was a great night at Triple George restaurant, so much so that I happily over tipped! 

I will be going back!
Been here a few times, friendly staff, the food was great!!! Nice atmosphere if your in the downtown Las Vegas Area I definitely recommend this place!!!
Dropping a star thanks to Becky seeming annoyed to wait on us.   Sorry--we ate our way through Vegas all day and didn't want appetizers and soup prior to the main course.

When you walk in you're immediately taken into the past with its nostalgia and pictures hanging all over. Its dead center in downtown so it makes sense that if someone had told me the names of celebrities that came in back in the hey day, id believe it.

I got the New York steak cooked to my perfection. I was a little surprised that it didn't come with a side but the six bucks I paid for my baked potato was totally fine by me. I ate at the bar which was also fine and a guy named Derrick took care of my drinking needs as well.

This was a very good value for Las Vegas.  It began with outstanding service from Ryan, our waiter. The New York strip steak was well prepared and the sides were nice. Carpaccio was exquisite and well presented. Ahi tuna was grilled to perfection. We will certainly be back!

I was really looking forward to trying this place out because one of my friends had said he heard it was great.  It definitely fell very short of great.  It was a Sunday night and it was pretty slow so there was no wait for a table.  The service was okay, nothing special.  We didn't order drinks right away and told him we were going to order wine with dinner, but he never came back so we had to flag him down so we could place our wine order.

I ordered the petite filet and a loaded baked potato medium rare.  My friend ordered a NY strip steak.  Both came out in a reasonable amount of time, but my petite filet was absolutely tiny.  The smallest petite filet I think I've ever seen in any steakhouse.  On top of that, it was medium, not medium rare.  I was with a group I didn't know very well so I didn't want to be the "high-maintenance" girl so I just ate it, but I was sorely disappointed. For the price, it's just not worth it.  

There are too many other great food options downtown to waste this much money on a steak that should've been cooked to perfection on the first try.  

My friend's NY strip seemed a bit closer to medium rare, but again, way more on the medium side.  Just disappointing.

The bread they serve as you wait for your meal is awesome!!

Great old-school vibe with an awesome long bar with a full menu. Great for lunch or a cozy quiet evening

Recommend the salmon or steak. Classic yet perfectly prepared every time!!
Thank you Andrew!!!!! This school teacher loves you and the ribeye!!! The shrimp were huge and the marbling on the steak topped most steaks in town.

Wow. This place is amazing. We wandered in after leaving the Mob Museum and boy am I glad we did! The booths are so cozy and intimate; perfect for couples or family! They have bar and outdoor seating that looked nice as well. EXCELLENT and FAST service. I got the roast beef (comes with mashed potatoes, gravy and veggies) my husband got the burger. They both were very delicious. The bread and butter they serve is awesome! We are here celebrating our anniversary & are considering coming back the day of bc we hear they have the best steak in town! Our server was Andrew L, he was so pleasant, ask for him!

First and foremost the service here was amazing. Ive been in the service industry for about 6 years now so everytime I go out to eat my standards for service are high and Triple George Grill exceeded mine. I had the buttermilk fried chicken and it was as good as it sounds. Portions are huge and the prices are not bad. Id give 10 stars if i could.

Triple George is one of my favorite spots. I have dined here for dinner and enjoyed the most amazing steak. However I mostly frequent for lunch as it is near where I work. They have plenty of vegan and gluten free options which I think is so great. Recently I had the cauliflower fried "rice" with Gardein "chicken". I felt really good about myself having eaten an entire meal comprised of vegetables only. And it was delicious. I've also had the clam chowder, soup and salad lunch special, chicken and Brussels and more. They serve their iced tea with iced tea ice cubes! So when they melt, it's just more iced tea! Brilliant. They also serve you break with oil/vinegar at the beginning, which is so tasty. The look and feel of the place is old Vegas, 1940's perhaps, like you might see Frank Sinatra walk in and sit down with his fellas. Every one I've received service from is always friendly and professional. I left my sunglasses there by accident one time and they found them and kept them safe until I called later to inquire. Overall, this is one of my go to places. It's not the cheapest, but nothing about the place would make you think it should be. Recommend!

At here recently for dinner.  
Had the Crab stuffed shrimp, and it was really good.  
Waiter was fun and played along with our group humor but had a good sense of the right amount of participation.

All in our group were very pleased with the food.  Two had the drunken hanger steak and were very happy with it.
If you want a upper scale dinner in the Fremont St area, this one is a good choice.
In my world this is closer to $$$ then $$, but as I have said before, in my world the break between $$ and $$$ would be lower, and I might even add a $$$$$ rating.

We usually can count on Yelp!  It's a win again this time!!!  All of us LOVED our food.  I had the pot roast and mashed potatoes, might have been the best I have ever had!  This is my favorite dish.  It was cooked perfectly.  I think this will be a spot to return to ever time we visit Vegas, which is a couple times a year, vacation and business.  Husband and friend had a bacon cheese burger and they almost couldn't finish it!  Another friend had sirloin and it was yummy as well after she had to send it back to be cooked how she wanted it in the first place.

The service could have been better.  We had to constantly ask for refills and a they were a little slow.  This was before dinner time, about 4pm.  I would be scared to see what their dinner time service would bring.
