Went to Triple George unexpectedly after finding that pizza rock had a huge wait during restaurant week and nascar weekend. They had a long wait but my girlfriend, her mom, and me found 3 seats at the bar pretty easily.. One side note if you are trying to get close and cuddle with your significant other the bar stools are bolted to the ground and are a little far away from each other so you'll be reaching a bit. 

The food was amazing and very reasonably prices for a steakhouse type of restaurant. We had some French onion soup which was amazing, I haven't been a big fan of French onion soup but have been getting into it lately and there's was delicious! The chopped salad unfortunately wasn't anything special, I like those real finely chopped ones and theirs was kind of just like chunky chopped. We had some chicken with crazy and mashed potatoes which was awesome the chicken was very flavorful. My girlfriends mom said that the chef was a little heavy handed on the pepper on each dish we tried, I like pepper so I didn't really notice. 

The only negative comment I have is that our waiter didn't check on us as often as I would have liked, this normally doesn't bother me but there were a few moments where we needed some things and I couldn't even get his attention. I know they were busy but if I'm trying to get your attention and I can't get it easily that kind of sucks, it took a few minutes and we also waited to get our check for a while even after our plates sat empty for about 15 minutes. Overall though the food was great atmosphere is classic and the staff was friendly.

Well, we've never eaten lunch or dinner at the Triple George but I must say it's the place to go  for a top-notch, classy happy hour. With that being said they don't look down their snout at you for coming in in your pool attire! Stopping by after going to the pool is a must for us. It's a plus that their happy hour goes until 7 p.m. As most of them in Freemont Street area only go till 6 p.m. And if you like to hang out at the pool until all of the sunshine is gone then the later time is ideal. I like the goat cheese appetizer and my wife really likes the fish sliders. It's very high quality food at a very reasonable price you can't beat this place! And Shelby was very attentive and professional as was everyone that talked to us. And it's always been that way every time we've went in. We're definitely going back soon to have lunch or dinner!

Always a pleasure to dine here! The entire staff is friendly and attentive. The food seems to get better every time,and the drinks are so unique and tasty. Thank you TGG for always showing me a wonderful time!
The waiter was super nice and the food was great. I had New York Strip, and it was awesome. Highly recommend! And for dessert, Creme Brûlée is a super good choice.

My family has been coming here for years! We were sat right next to the kitchen with the hustle and bustle and loud yelling of the managers and chefs. Such a sad experience last night for a big 70th birthday dinner. We were there for 3 hours- start to finish of our meal. Ordered drinks- mojito was not muddled- so we sent it back- only to receive another non muddled mojito. Our waiter was obviously extremely frustrated- with the slow kitchen or something. After over an hour an a half we received our food. We received an extremely burnt pot pie- sent it back and it was taking way too long so we cancelled the order. Broccoli with the $65 steak and lobster was ice cold. Sad to say we will never go back here, and the birthday celebration night was pretty much ruined.

Great steaks - great service - great environment ... the butter is amazing. 

Filets were cooked perfectly.
Never thought I would order a burger here but a friend told me that I would like it. He was right. Awesome burger. The chops are great too.

I was absolutely determined to try some new places on this trip. Which is very hard when you love your normal places (ie, 777 brewpub and charthouse HH downtown). Anyway I found Triple George had a Happy Hour and I went to check it out. It's a block from Fremont hotel. I had never been to that part of town (across from downtown grand and near Hogs and Hefers/Pizza Rock) anyway, there I was. I sat at the bar, even tho outside would probably be more fun (if weather was a little warmer and not being solo) but I'm comfortable at the bar and ordered 2 beers and chicken parm sliders for $11.92. Now we're talking. The sliders were absolutely delicious and I'll definitely like to have them again. I didn't want to overeat so it was sorta perfect. Nice atmosphere inside. Looked like there was a nice dining area inside too.

Classic place for a great martini and absolutely outstanding food. Massively favorite with the locals. If they're busy be ready to order your drinks and food quickly, but that's not really a complaint. Serious attention paid to the quality of food here. Highly recommended. Sitting at the counter is a blast!

Came from the grand pool across the street and werent sure if we had the proper attire to dine here. But Will greeted and seated us, told us to feel at home and was very polite and attentive. The happy hour menu here is pretty good and the service was excellent. And not to mention-Will makes a helluva martini. A great spot(and the best filet mignon with porcini ive ever had) Excellent

Yelp did NOT let me down on this one. For starters the wedge salad was delicious and  complimentary bread and herb butter was excellent. 

I ordered the surf and turf (lobster and filet medallions, served with truffle mashed potatoes), the flavors were so spot on. Over all it was such a delicious meal. The medallions had an amazing mushroom sauce on them. The mushrooms mixed with the potatoes tasted like it was made in heaven!! 

My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon with herb butter. I had one bite, it was so flavorful and tender.
This place would be 2 stars had their appetizers not been kind of good. The artichoke-spinach dip stole the show with rest of the food being very average. Service wasn't great either.

First we had reservations but didn't need them. They were not full and there was no wait time.  This should have been a clue.
Our server was Brian #100031. He was very pleasant and knowledgeable. 
Started off with Calamari. The Calamari was OK, nothing special here. It's served with two sauces, the Aioli tasted like mayonnaise with little seasoning, the spicy red sauce was less than spicy.  You could taste a little, but not really classified as spicy.  
My wife had the Porcini Ravioli, she loved it.  The sundried tomato cream sauce carried the porcini flavor, not sure if the mushrooms were present in the sauce or if it picked up the flavors from the ravioli. Must likely they added mushrooms to the sauce. She liked it so much she forgot (maybe on purpose) to let me try a part of a ravioli. It might be because the portion was small.
Or visiting guest had the Atlantic Special and she definitely liked her dish since she cleaned the plate. I did not go in for a taste for fear I would lose a digit or maybe my whole hand.
No for the reason for losing a star.
My main course was Spicy Shrimp and Scallop Linquine. First there was no spice, I mean none,  The sauce is listed as a creole cream sauce, this was the most bland sauce I have ever had.  Olive Garden does better and I hate that place(except for the endless salad). I don't think they even added salt to the dish. The Shrimp looked like it had seasoning but I could not taste any and the scallops were the waste I have ever had. They had a grayish look to them and both(yea I said both, that's all you get 2) were both very gritty, I think they dredge them in sand before cooking them in rancid butter or they don't check the product form the vendor.
Just so you know I did not complain about my meal, I am usually offered a free desert and I'm usually to full to eat desert. I just won't go there again and especially to an out of town guest.  They probably should get 3 stars based on misrepresenting a meal and having it so digusting.

Pretty great spot for a filet mignon that is not an arm and a leg. Chicken Parmesan was also delicious. Great quality for the price. Very nice old school style decoration. Would def come back here again.

So I ate hear while in town for business in Vegas. This place stayed packed. For lunch I had the fried chicken with sage gravy. Man when I tell you after the first bite, I almost slid under the table because it made me weak. It was that GOOD. It was hot, flavorful and crispy with mashed potatoes that sopped up with the gravy also. It was served with fresh veggies that were also delicious. The gravy was so good that when no one was looking i ran my finger across the plate to get the excess. (Dont Judge Me). My co-worker had the pot roast. It wasn't yo mama's pot roast it was more like a short rib with a sauce that tasted like it was made with red wine as opposed to a country style gravy with beef drippings. It was absolutely deliciousness also. I came back the next day and had the ribeye. This was a disappointment because it was tough. I ordered it Medium well and it looked like it was bleeding and I could have sworn I seen it move and it sounded like it let out a MOOOO. I told the waitress and she assured me it was a red wine reduction and not blood. It wasn't flavorful or tender at all. What a let down. The day after that I ordered the baked onion soup and salad. The soup was absolutely deliciousness. It was flavorful, had the right amount of cheese and onion with a good bread/crouton ratio. Oh and when I checked in I received a coupon. (Thats where the extra star came from because a sister LOVES her some deals). Service was outstanding! I will surely come back here the next time Im in Vegas,

Had a decent meal and okay service.  Seats were hard and it would have had a cooler vibe had it taken the "steakhouse" look and feel all the way to the max.  Having said that, wine list is decent, bar was hopping and people looked like they were having a good time.

I have mixed reviews on this place.
The sourdough bread they give when you first get there is amazing! The butter sauce that comes with it is even more amazing. We ordered the spinach dip that was super tasty. 
Our waitress was kinda snobbish 80% of the meal but at the end of dinner once she handed us the bill ( tip time) she perked up and was a sweetheart. We actually sat around and chit chatted with her. 
Dinners ......
The two $$ for pricing is for sure not two $$ 
Maybe the lunch menu is but dinner is about $40 - $60 a plate 
The atmosphere is great with a nice vintage feel which I loved. I could imagine Frank Sinatra coming here to eat dinner. 
This business has been in this building for 9 years but the building has been around since 1950s.
The burger was good, the fish and chips were good. 
The chicken with prosciutto wasn't good at all. 
Seriously sad about it too. The mashed potatoes tasted like instant potatoes and had a weird taste and texture. 
My salad was sooooo limp and sad. 
I would say skip dinner here and maybe come for lunch. 
But I'm so so so so glad we didn't do steak here because this was not a A+ steak house like Ruth Chris or anything like that at all.
This place was a little intimidating at first. But our server Cameron was great. . He loosened us up. . Great service, good food. . When we come back to Vegas we will come back!

called in to ask questions and the girl seemed irritated and cut me off short but I didn't let that bother me because I saw the 4 star ratings ...so when I arrived I knew it was her because she had a rough and short bitchy attitude didn't get her name she had black hair in ponytail. ..she seated us without even being courteous...so pissed me off right away....couldn't believe it...waiter was very nice food was good but wouldn't need to go back...no lemon was served with the lobster or butter..had much better food elsewhere

Pot roast flavorful and tender. Steak made my son roll his eyes back in his head. Side veggies were cooked perfect, Loaded potato was beautiful. Hard cider was very good. Service was attentive. Cozy cubby booths. Large bar if sitting at the bar is your thing.. Measures up to pricier steak houses.
It was a great atmosphere. Very nice, food was good prices were ok. Very enjoyable.

Escape the noise and bright lights of the Fremont Street Experience, and unleash your inner Don Draper - or Rat Packer Dean Martin - at this great bar and grill.

Triple Georges is mostly a large, U-shaped bar with old style wooden booths and a few tables. The atmosphere is vibrant, yet also intimate with the old style Vegas feel... You know, deals going down with lots of money changing hands. 

The food was excellent. We had lunch and would highly recommend the French dip and the Triple George Burger with grilled onions, bacon and mushrooms on sourdough with truffle fries. I will travel back to Vegas just for this burger.
Solid food every time I visit for lunch or dinner. Great place to grab food in downtown Las Vegas!

This review is based on two visits to Triple George Grill.  Overall, I found this restaurant/bar haunt on the edge of downtown to be an excellent provider of comfort food.  But there were ups and downs.

The first occasion followed an enjoyable Las Vegas Yelp Book Club meeting, as I dined with a few fellow Yelpers, including our Community Manager, Misti Y.  We began with very good warm sourdough bread, followed by a nice complimentary relish tray which contained green and black olives, hot red and green peppers, gerkins, and carrot sticks.  On the second occasion I had to ask for a relish tray, but it then quickly arrived. Slightly peppery Calamari was very good dipped in either a mild Marinara Sauce or an excellent Lemon Butter Sauce that was presented on request without extra charge.

Excellent baked French Onion Soup was both hot and cheesy.  The Cheese was Swiss, and the crouton bread that broke down quickly in the hot broth.  Only a little patience is required to allow the crouton time to melt.  On the first visit, soup was followed by a very good Caesar Salad with Parmesan splinters and tasty clusters of toasted Romano Cheese.  On the second, an equally fine George's Chopped Salad was served.  This dish featured Iceberg Lettuce, tomatoes, green onion, bacon, bleu cheese crumbles, and ample avocado chunks all tossed in a flavorful Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing.

Both entrees I ordered were delicious.  One was Bacon-Wrapped Meatloaf and mashed potatoes, served with excellent Brown Gravy, mushrooms, green beans, carrots, and onions.  To my surprise, I liked this dish even better than I did the Pancetta Wrapped Meatloaf with Mushroom Gravy I had recently enjoyed at Postrio, and later praised.

On the second outing, I was presented with a gigantic bowl topped by a thin sheet of crust beneath which lay the other ingredients of an excellent Chicken Pot Pie.  The crust and filling were not connected, but all it took to do so was to break the crust into pieces with a large spoon provided.  Inside the bowl were numerous chunks of white chicken meat, peas, carrots, pearl onions, tender potato chunks, and pieces of Button Mushrooms, all merged with a garlicky Cream Sauce that tasted good but was too peppery to me.  The crust was buttery and no different than a very good doughy top clinging to a traditionally prepared Chicken Pot Pie.  The result was successful, just like the independent-component and memorable Lobster Pot Pie I enjoyed at Michael Mina's Stonehill Tavern inside the St. Regis Hotel in Dana Point, California.  Unfortunately, Diane ordered Chicken Parmesan with specially requested Alfredo Sauce, which was graciously supplied.  But, while the portion of Chicken Parmesan and linguini was immense, the sauce was really thin and insipid.  Hopefully, this was but an infrequent aberration.

An excellent homemade and gigantic Chocolate Chip Cookie covered by a scoop of ordered Vanilla Ice Cream was the highlight of the second meal, even better than B.J.'s Pizookie, which I also happen to like.

Service on both occasions was friendly and very attentive.  It needed to be, because on the initial encounter, clumsy me overturned my straw-topped glass and spilled the entire contents of an almost fully filled Iced Tea right onto the lap of my Yelp friend Mamie P.  She brushed off this accident very well but I knew that it must have felt like an icy-cold assault, and felt badly about it.  When notified, the restaurant staff immediately charged into action, swiftly cleaning up the mess and providing new napkins, Iced Tea, and a new bread loaf, which also took a light hit from flying brown liquid drops.  

The restaurant has a dark woodsy look, and reminded me of San Francisco's Tadich Grill where I liked to dine when I had been able to scrounge up enough money to do so while attending law school in the city.  Papers littered the floor of the men's restroom on one visit to Triple George, but after I alerted my server about this, within one hour the messy restroom had been cleaned up.  I greatly enjoyed both dinners, and intend to return soon to try the Country Fried Steak.

4-1/2 stars!

Mixed feelings on Triple George, mostly because it was not what I thought it was. I was expecting a darkly lit mahogany lined room with smoke and loud jazz music playing. Why? I have no idea. What I did get was an open room with tv's on the wall (strange for fine dining) with a center bar. I believe there was jazz music playing in the background but it was so loud in the dining area I could barely hear the people at my table. 

The food was delicious, I had the Ribeye which was lightly seasoned with salt and pepper and was cooked to perfection. It was a steak lovers steak. The sides were creamy potatoes and seasonal vegetables, all were wonderful. Wife had the special Filet Medallions Oscar. We are used to Oscar with crab meat, they offered lobster. The lobster while plentiful, was slightly mushy, not as premium as the meats. The Creme Brulee was the perfect way to end the meal. 

The food was a 5, the service (waiter and bus) was a 5 but the ambiance was a 4. The extremely loud and annoying table blowing kazoos next to us was a 0 and the fact that the restaurant did nothing to slow down the extreme noise from the table proved to me management lacked an understanding of who their patrons that night were. 

Overall I would have given my experience a 3, but I'm looking past the annoying table behind us and granting the four.
No problems getting a same-day reservation during prime dinner hours. Servers were friendly and attentive. I highly recommend the George burger! The baked onion soup was awesome too.

My boyfriend and I recently dined here for Valentine's day. We were seated in a booth which had an intimate feel. We tried the pre fix Valentine's dinner. It was delicious! From the specialty drinks to the food and the outstanding service. Let's not forget the location, I would definitely come back here.
Food was excellent.  Chicken lentil soup was great too.  Portions were large. Service was on the spot.  And on Fremont Street Experience.

My. Goodness. Where to start. The homemade sourdough is simply perfect. Crunchy on the outside, soft and pillowy on the inside, with a good sourdough bite. The Caesar salad was a thing of perfection. The dressing was creamy with a nice tartness. The filet mignon  was by far one of the best I've had, as was the fettuccine alfredo. The chicken on the fettuccine was divine. Juicy, flavorful, grilled to perfection. Service was to notch.  This fine establishment is a must-stop when you're coming to Vegas.

I love this place, one of the better places to go in Downtown. Nice atmosphere, with a historic vibe and the food is really really good, without being expensive.

I would mark as 4 or 5 stars but that I asked them to let the kitchen know that I have a gluten intolerance and although my meal was delicious, I was sick the following day. All restaurants need to do is take some basic steps to ensure no gluten is used in the recipe, or that there is no cross contamination while they prepare a dish for me.

Update:

On my next visit I ordered the exact same dish and double-double-checked with the server, who tripled checked with the kitchen, but I *still* got sick the following day. Disappointing. If I do go back I'll certainly not eat the salmon again (even though it was DELICIOUS).

As long as you don't have any special dietary requirements, then this is a great place to go.
Excellent food and service. Prices commensurate with a nice night out at a nice eatery.

First! The bread here is AWESOME! ... Made a reservation for Valentines Dinner and as soon as we showed up were seated. They had a Valentine's prefixed menu but we're also serving the regular menu as well so that was good. We orders the crab cakes and the shrimp cocktail. The cocktail was pretty basic with nothing special about it. The crab cakes were really good but if you order them make sure the order extra sauce with them cause it doesn't come with enough on the plate. For entrees we had the signature Shrimp George and I had the recommended Pot Roast. The shrimp entree was amazing with a lot of flavor. The pot roast was also really good but heavy and rich as pot roast is. After the apps, bread and heave meal there was no room for desert. It's located in a very odd place in downtown Las Vegas next to a pizza place and a biker bar so if you find your self trying to find it and are surrounded by drunks getting pizza and bikers you are probably in the right place. You can valet at the grand hotel and the restaurant will validate your valet ticket. I would of given this place a 5 star except there were 2 big parties (one on each end of the room) that were so loud and obnoxious they were were ruining our experience. Hope this helps . Enjoy!

This place is just off the main drag downtown and lists steak and seafood as dual specialties.  The ambiance is nice, the staff friendly, and the lighting is desirable for a "slightly noisier than usual" meal.

My wife had the spicy linguine with scallops and shrimp.  The shrimp were fine (a little over cooked) the linguine was tasty but the scallops were soft and uninteresting...they swore they were dry scallops but they sure tasted like wet( wet scallops are injected with a solution to extend their shelf life and lose texture).  I had a very tough Hangar steak that I should have sent back..over seared and black, their steak knife had quite a tussle to get through for a couple of bites.

Based upon the above I might come back for an appetizer but not for a meal.

One of the best restaurants in downtown Vegas, specially for lunch. I love the atmosphere of the place. Put on suspenders and light a cigar to feel like home. Unfortunately, I don't have any of these habits.

The menu is quite diverse. I have tried almost all of it, from steak to pasta. IMHO the "best under ten" lunch specials have the best bang for the buck. There is not a single person that hasn't enjoyed the Pot Roast, which is soul food at it's finest. Downtown Ruben is also very very good (I'd recommend  with side of coleslaw).  

Soups including chowders are all home made. Most of the time soup of the day is quite tasty. 

There is exclusive parking in 3rd St for customers. Waitress are responsive and friendly, however, when packed, kitchen struggles from time to time, not in quality but in speed.. 

One of my fav places for lunch.

Sehr gut gegessen, Portionen sind amerikanisch, kaum wegzuessen..
Bedienung sehr freundlich - direkt am Downtown-Strip, ideal zum Abendessen vor der Light show in der Fremont Street..
Kann man durchaus weiterempfehlen!
We are traveling here and had Fm and ribeye steak here. It's perfect and the service is great. If you have a chance, you should definitely try the steak here!

This restaurant is on the backside of Fremont Casino on 3rd Street.  As you walk in, you see a bar atmosphere setting. The dining room is on the side in a nice secluded room.  Our waiter Andrew was very pleasant and catered to our needs.  Andrew indicated the restaurant is identical to Taddich restaurant located in San Francisco.  The food was great, the atmosphere great, the waiters are even better.  A must place to visit and enjoy an elegant meal.

SOOO good!!!!!! Found this gem on yelp and let me tell you...... It's amazing!! We were a party of 10 and Becky was our waitress who handled our large party perfectly!! She's great. Food was incredible. I tried the filet, ravioli, clam chowder, bruschetta, and spinach and artichoke dip. Every single dish was fabulous!!! Will DEFINITELY be back.

You would think the day after thanksgiving they would be locked on? The appetizer, while small and way over priced was good, how hard is it to not serve soggy fish and chips? The crowd was small
- I was the only one sitting out side - I just wanted catsup for my fries - no luck...maybe it's cause I am just a tourist and think I won't be back - well, I travel to Vegas often...and I won't be...if you are gonna gouge folks - at least provide the right service. Then the rude guy, wanders out and drops my $42.11 bill on the table - like I was an inconvenience- I tip well usually- but treat me like this - nope.

I was contacted by the on duty manager after I had posted my review, as well as the GM, via Yelp, very professional and sincere in their response. They assured me that the issue has been dealt with...professional service such as this would encourage me to give them a second chance.
Yummy Manhattans...Our waitress, Becky, hand selected the perfect whiskey. Steak cooked to perfection. Will definitely return.

Delicious caprese salad and bruschetta.  Large happy hour oration of bruschetta too.  Fabulous service from Marti the bartender.  Very cool and clean inside.  Not cheap but you do get a little break on some drinks and food during happy hour which ends at 7 pm.  Good spot.
One of my favorites has redeemed themselves. Went for lunch and had a fantastic overall experience. I was hoping the previous mediocre experience I had was a fluke.
